Anger Empowerment: Mark is able to get much stronger when he is feeling intense emotions, especially anger. This sudden burst of energy gives him a new lease of life, making him much stronger and better at fighting. When he is really stressed, this makes him feel stronger and stronger. It helps him to do better than his enemies.
Slowing down the aging process: Mark lives much longer than other people because of how his body works. This means that the effects of ageing pass over him more slowly. This slows down the effects of ageing on him, meaning he can stay in great shape, physically fit and keep up his combat performance way beyond what most people could.

Dominant Genes: Viltrumites are very good at adapting to new situations because of their powerful genetic make-up. Mark, like others of his kind, can reproduce with a wide range of species, with his Viltrumite DNA overwhelmingly taking over in the offspring. As a result, the child will usually be mostly Viltrumite, often looking and acting like a Viltrumite. The more similar the mate's species is, the faster and more reliably the offspring will show all the standard Viltrumite abilities.
Flight: Mark has the ability to levitate and propel himself through the air at will, reaching extreme speeds, thanks to a complex balancing system located in his inner ears. He can easily change direction in the air, making sharp turns, sudden stops and accurate aerobatic moves. His control makes it easy to get around in lots of different places.

Superhuman Strength: Mark Grayson is very strong. He can lift lots of weight and hit hard, destroying both his enemies and the things around him. One of his first times doing this was when he accidentally sent a rubbish bag from America to England, showing how good he was at this. As he grew, Mark got much stronger. He once threw a baseball from Chicago to Mount Everest and back again in one throw. He easily overpowered foes like Titan and Killcannon early in his career and displayed frightening bursts of power when emotionally triggered, such as breaking out of alien restraints to save Atom Eve or smashing through enemies after witnessing comrades in danger. He was so strong that he was able to fight Allen the Alien without winning (while not fighting back) and push back against the Flaxan armies many times. He got more and more powerful. He caught and threw a huge rock, destroyed energy weapons, and regularly overpowered human-augmented threats like the ReAnimen. In combat, he has launched enemies across cities, crushed advanced armour and shattered constructs. One of his most important strength displays was during his fight with his father, Omni-Man. Even though he was not as strong as the others, Mark fought bravely. Omni-Man used Mark's body to kill civilians, most horrifically by ramming him through a subway train full of people. Mark attacked Nolan, but Nolan wasn't fazed. During the battle on Thraxa, Mark met his first Viltrumite, Lucan. Though overpowered and thrown aside, he managed to land a few hits before Omni-Man arrived. When two more Viltrumites, Vidor and Thula, joined the fight, Mark battled Thula. At first, he was not as strong as the others, but he started to win when he saw that the Thraxan people were being killed. But in the end, he lost because he refused to kill her. This display impressed General Kregg, who saw Mark as a worthy successor to Omni-Man in leading Earth's Viltrumite conquest. His fight with Anissa, the strongest female Viltrumite, showed how far he had to go to reach his full potential. Even though Mark tried hard, he was too strong and couldn't hit his opponent properly. He only had a 18% chance of surviving. But this big loss made him want to do three months of extra training, which made him much stronger. Before his hard training, Mark fought Angstrom Levy, who threatened his family by sending him to different realities. On his way, Mark joined forces with Agent Spider to fight against Professor Ock. He was beaten by cavemen and Omnipotus, but he managed to beat a lot of enemies before going back home. There, he fought a cyber-enhanced Angstrom, who was stronger for a short time, until Mark used all his power in the Wasteland Universe, beating Angstrom almost to death and leaving him horribly disfigured. After intensive GDA training, Mark's strength increased by 138%. This meant he could do amazing things like lift a giant's leg, hold up an iceberg and pick up cars. After his training, Mark was able to beat foes that had previously been too strong for him, such as ReAnimen and Multi-Paul's clones. He also beat enemies like Doc Seismic's monsters and sea beasts. In fact, he was even stronger than most versions of himself from other realities. In another world, Mark went up against the Immortal, who was a cruel ruler. At first, Mark was not very aggressive, but he eventually cut off his head by shrugging off his strongest blows very easily. One time, he stopped a really powerful EMP missile in the air with just one punch, which saved Earth's communication systems. During his fight with Mister Liu, a huge dragon, Mark temporarily overpowered the creature by flying straight into its head, killing it. Even though Mark had been bitten by Liu's sharp teeth, he still managed to hit Liu back. But Liu was able to recover and eventually beat Mark. During the Invincible War, Mark fought Movincihawk evenly and later overpowered him with help. He also fought Hoodvincible, who admitted that Mark was stronger than expected, until Omnivincible arrived. Mark put up a good fight against the two of them, and might have won if Eve hadn't distracted him. In a new fight with Angstrom Levy, Mark used a special door to go to another universe. He fought the drones and broke through the swarm of enemies before Angstrom escaped. Mark's most difficult challenge came against Conquest, the second strongest Viltrumite. Even though he was weaker, he managed to hurt Conquest, breaking his metal arm and tearing part of his shoulder off. Full of rage after Eve's death, he launched a vicious counterattack, holding his own until Eve's energy blast gave him the edge to finish the fight. Invincible is very strong, and is getting stronger. But right now, Conquest, Battle Beast and maybe Anissa are stronger. Movincihawk is also very strong.

Nigh-Invulnerability: Mark is very resilient, meaning he is almost indestructible. He is not bothered by any environment, whether it is there or not. He can handle the recoil from his own speed. Even when he was really tired from the fight with the Maulers, he could handle a big explosion in Angstrom's warehouse. This explosion destroyed the Maulers. After his training, he could withstand a nuclear warhead at point-blank range. Mark's nervous system is also strong. After it was targeted and scrambled, Mark was able to stand up and soon after recover.

Reactive Adaptation: Mark can improve quickly and naturally. The more he struggles, the stronger, faster and more durable he will become, especially when facing tough challenges or recovering from serious injuries. What's more, his experience in combat helps him to learn from what happened in the past. This helps him to improve his tactics and do better in future battles. Mark was initially overwhelmed by Thula, a very experienced Viltrumite soldier. However, he quickly adapted to her tactics and ultimately overpowered her. The only reason he lost was because he hesitated to kill her. After 90 days of hard training with the G.D.A., Mark got much stronger and fitter, increasing his strength by 138%. This made him think he could now beat Anissa, who had easily beaten Mark just before his training began.

Regenerative Healing Factor: Mark can heal from most injuries quickly and without any lasting effects, even those that would normally be fatal. He is also immune to virtually all illnesses and contaminants. He was able to heal all the damage he got during his fight inside within a few days. The wound from the claw was already starting to heal just a few minutes after it was removed. As his powers grew, he was able to heal himself quickly from the two claw marks left by Mister Liu's dragon form.

Superhuman Lung Capacity: Mark has very big lungs, which let him breathe without air for a long time. This ability lets him work in environments with very little oxygen, like space, without any protection.

Superhuman Senses: Mark has amazing sensory skills that go beyond what is possible for humans. He can hear sounds from far away very clearly. This means he can detect even the quietest noises and ignore the ones he doesn't need to hear. He can also see things far away as clearly as things that are near. He is very balanced and poised, which means he is calm and steady, even in difficult situations.

Superhuman Speed: Mark can move extremely quickly, moving at speeds multiple times faster than the speed of sound. He can easily achieve escape velocity of Earth and leave its atmosphere within 9 seconds. He is one of the fastest people on Earth (and probably the fastest). He is faster than The Immortal. He is also very quick to react.

Superhuman Stamina: Mark can keep going for long periods without getting tired, and also recover quickly from very hard physical attacks, like electrocution. He can also handle some of the most severe injuries that would instantly kill a human, as long as his heart and brain aren't too badly damaged. He was able to survive a brutal beating from Hail Mary with little discomfort and multiple punches from Omni-Man without dying. Even being stabbed through the chest didn't hurt him. He can also go for several weeks without sleep or food.

Superhuman Endurance: Mark's stamina is much better than a normal person's. He was able to survive being cut open, survive in space without needing to breathe, and even withstand blows from the strongest Viltrumites like his father, Anissa, and Conquest.

[weakness]
Being impulsive and selfish. Mark has shown that he is very impulsive and selfish. He thinks he can handle every situation by himself and that he is always right. After Cecil hired D.A. Sinclair and Darkwing II to help protect humanity, this caused problems with Mark. Mark thinks they should be put in prison forever, even though they felt guilty for all the murders they had committed. Mark also refused to have any help from his closest friends, Atom Eve and his half-brother Oliver, when facing powerful and dangerous foes like the Maulers and Conquest.
Short-Temperament: Mark has lost his temper quite a lot, and one time this led to Angstrom Levy's death.

Biological: Viltrumites can be harmed by high-frequency noise. It makes them lose their balance, can stop them from flying, causes a lot of pain and might even kill them. How much pain you feel depends on how strong the signal is.
Extreme Force: Viltrumites are among the most powerful beings in the universe, but they are not invincible. Viltrumites are weak against beings that are as strong as them or stronger.

Scourge Virus: The virus was developed from Viltrumite DNA and targets Viltrumites by weakening their immune systems, making them less strong and less invulnerable. The only way to survive is to have a very strong immune system and wait for the virus to run its course.

2.content:
Nolan is one of the main characters in Invincible. At first, he was the main bad guy in Season 1, but then he started to do good things in Season 2 and later. He is better known as the disgraced "superhero" Omni-Man, who is also secretly known by his adopted Earth name Nolan Grayson. He is the ex-husband of his first wife, Debbie Grayson, and the late second wife, Andressa's husband. He is also the father of Mark and Oliver Grayson.

He was a high-ranking Viltrumite warrior of the Viltrum Empire. He used to be dedicated to aiding the Viltrumite mission to make it the only empire in the universe, until time on Earth changed him for the better. He left the Empire to join the Coalition of the Planets in their fight to end the tyranny of his own people once and for all.

[Body type]
Nolan is a tall, fair-skinned man with blue eyes and short black hair. Like all Viltrumite males who reach a certain age, Nolan grows a moustache. His is thick and well-groomed. Although he is thousands of years old, Nolan looks like a middle-aged man. He has a few wrinkles on his face and the hair on the lower half of his head is grey. What's more, he looks like an old man, but he has a strong presence and is well-built.

[Clothing]
Viltrumite Soldier Clothes: When he was a young soldier in the Viltrum Empire, Nolan wore the traditional plain white Viltrumite uniform. He wore it for the first few years on Earth, before changing it for his famous Omni-Man outfit.

Omni-Man Clothes: He is dressed as a superhero. He is wearing a bodysuit. The top half of the suit is white and the bottom half is red. He also has white boots with a single red detail in the middle. His gloves are the opposite of that. To finish his outfit, he wears a red cape and matching underwear. The outfit features a striking red detail at the waist, where a large "O" is sewn, representing the main character. It actually represents his people, as the Viltrumite insignia has a similar design, except with three straight lines.

Earth Civilian Clothes: On Earth, Nolan often wore short-sleeved shirts and blue or grey button-up shirts with grey or dark grey trousers.

The Monarch Attire: After becoming the ruler of Thraxa, he changed his outfit so that it looked almost the same as his original superhero costume, but without gloves, the "O" symbol, and red leggings.

Viltrumite Prison Clothes: While he was a prisoner on the Viltrumite prison asteroid, he wore a prison suit that was grey and white.

[Personality]
As Omni-Man, Nolan is a perfect superhero: brave, kind, friendly, loyal, and willing to sacrifice himself for others. For most people, his role as a hero was obvious. When he was a human being, he seemed to be a kind husband and a loving dad. Even though he expected a lot from his son and was strict, Debbie usually managed to balance this with other factors. The strongest expression of his Viltrumite heritage was seen in his beliefs about what a hero should do. Mark says that this makes it seem like saving millions or billions of people is more important than saving hundreds or thousands of people. This causes problems between Debbie and Mark.

But he is a typical Viltrumite. He is cruel and does many terrible things to help the Viltrum Empire take over planets. Because his race is almost immortal, very strong and very technologically advanced, he thinks that other races are weak and inferior. He thinks it is his job to impose order on other cultures for the good of everyone. If they resist, he subdues them calmly. He acts in a cruel way towards the Viltrum Empire, but he doesn't mean to be cruel. He thinks he is doing the right thing. He thinks that being in charge means being kind and helping people. He is cruel and violent, and he caused the Flaxans to be killed and destroyed their world when they tried to invade Earth. He shows no regret for the thousands of people he has killed, and even thinks they are pathetic. Nolan even said that although he loved his wife, he thought of her as a "pet". He explained that he was going to kill Mark to have another son. He wanted to raise this son to support the Viltrum Empire's plan to expand.

Even though he had a big ego and was cruel, things that happened to him on Earth started to change him, bit by bit. When he seems calm and focused on the fight, he often says he doesn't like how he's acting. He was ready to get rid of the original Guardians of the Globe to make Earth weaker against the Viltrumites, but then he started to worry about what he had done. He used to think that things like sports were pointless, but he ended up loving his family and being really annoyed when they did well. During his argument with Mark, he insults him for caring about Earth and acting like a human. But his reasoning and growing unstable attitude suggest that Nolan is trying to persuade himself of his own choices. In the end, when he angrily asks his son what Mark will have in 500 years, his son cries and says that he would still have his dad. This loving message from his son, even though he had hurt Mark, was enough to break Nolan's cold Viltrumite exterior and make him fall into despair. Nolan is so upset by what his son has done that he decides to stop his mission and leave Earth. He is crying as he heads into space.

In the end, Nolan's 20 years on Earth were enough to change the Viltrumite beliefs he had experienced over thousands of years. Nolan's actions, such as killing his friends, killing innocent people, and assaulting his son, seemed to be influenced only by his upbringing as a Viltrumite soldier. When Nolan understands what he has done, he feels really guilty and ashamed. Even during his journey through space, he feels deep sadness, not knowing how to continue with his life after leaving everything he knew as a Viltrumite. In the end, he decided to end his own life by jumping into a black hole. However, by chance, he came across a small group of Thraxans and rescued them. This gave him a new purpose, as the whole Thraxan species let him live on their world as their ruler. By really looking after these people without wanting anything in return, Nolan became much happier.

Although Nolan had got better after meeting the Thraxans, he still couldn't understand why he felt close to them when they were killed by Viltrumite invaders. Despite his rage over the massacre, he thought that the weak physiques and short lives of the Thraxan species should not matter to him. This was because he had been raised to believe that all other races were inferior and insignificant. When Mark said that this was how he was meant to feel on Earth, Nolan couldn't say anything. For the first time, he couldn't understand why the Viltrumite thought that lesser species were inferior and unimportant. This awareness grew while he was in prison, and he stopped identifying himself as a Viltrumite because of his newfound compassion. He was embarrassed by his "shortcomings" and was ready to accept that he would be killed. However, as he talked more with another prisoner, he realised he didn't regret becoming a Viltrumite traitor. He also admitted he really missed his wife Debbie, who had made him a better person. The main reason for Nolan changing his mind came from Allen, who, seeing Nolan as his friend, risked his own life to save him. He wanted to help save his first real friend, which was something no other Viltrumite had ever done. In the end, Nolan accepted his new identity, wanting to enjoy life again and make up for the things he had done wrong by helping to stop the Viltrumite conquest of the universe.

[Powers]
Viltrumite Physiology: Nolan is a Viltrumite, which means he is an advanced being with extremely powerful genes. Over time, he developed a wide range of abilities that are typical of his race, and these will only get stronger as he grows older. At the same time, he is one of the best in his race, and his powers are much more advanced than most others. He is one of the strongest Viltrumites ever, only beaten by Conquest and Thragg.
Slowing down the aging process: Omni-Man lives much longer than other people because of how his body works. This means he ages more slowly over time. This slows down the effects of ageing on him, meaning he can stay in great shape, physically fit and keep up his combat performance way beyond what most people could. He is very strong and healthy, and he looks only about 45 years old. After spending decades in the Flaxan Dimension, he looked just the same as before.
Dominant Genes: Viltrumites are very good at adapting to new situations because of their powerful genetic make-up. Omni-Man can reproduce with a wide range of species, and his Viltrumite DNA is dominant in his offspring. As a result, the child will usually be mostly Viltrumite, often looking and acting like a Viltrumite. The more similar the mate's species is, the faster and more reliably the offspring will show all the standard Viltrumite abilities.
Flight: Omni-Man can levitate on his own, which allows him to rise to great heights and move in any direction he wants. He can also change his flight path mid-flight, which gives him the ability to move easily in different environments. What's really special is that he can fly through space.

Superhuman Strength: Nolan is very strong. He can lift and push really heavy things. He is without doubt one of the strongest Viltrumites in history and was the most powerful being on Earth during his lifetime. When he first arrived on Earth, Nolan killed a monster that was threatening a city by flying right through it. When he fought the first Guardians of the Globe, Nolan beat them easily and quickly. He crushed Red Rush's head, avoided Martian Man's elastic body, and killed Darkwing by slamming his body. He then punched through Green Ghost's face, overpowered War Woman several times, and used her own mace to kill Aquarus. Nolan was held back by Martian Man, but he managed to escape when he was helped by Immortal and War Woman. He killed Martian Man, punched through Immortal's stomach, brutally snapped War Woman's neck, and finally cut off Immortal's head. While he was training with Invincible, Nolan also said that he once stopped an asteroid the size of Texas. After saving Mark from the Flaxans, Nolan showed how strong he was by easily destroying their army in the air. When he got into the Flaxan home dimension, he used the Flaxan Leader's body to destroy a number of buildings. In the process, he also killed the Leader. Then he carried on his rampage, which almost destroyed their planet. In his first fight with Hail Mary, Nolan found it hard to win. Donald said, "This is the first time I've seen Omni-Man in such a difficult position. But in the end, Nolan made her unable to do anything. When he was attacked by three ReAnimen sent by GDA, he was overwhelmed by their relentless assault, but he eventually overcame and destroyed them. When she faced Hail Mary a second time, she was able to beat Nolan, even though Nolan had help from Invincible, who wasn't very effective. But the battle was stopped when the resurrected Immortal hit Nolan from above, starting a fierce rematch. Nolan's blows were much more powerful, and ended with a huge shockwave. He overpowered the Immortal once again, punching through his body before cutting him into pieces. In his fight against his son, Invincible, Nolan was clearly the winner. He threw Mark around with ease, punching him across continents. At one point, he used his body to split an oncoming train in half, causing widespread destruction and many deaths. He showed how strong he was when he sent Invincible to the top of Mount Everest, causing an avalanche, and then hit him into the ground, making a huge crater. Nolan almost killed Mark before deciding to stop. After leaving Earth, Nolan was still stronger than anyone else, even in the difficult conditions of space. He floated through space without being affected, even managing to resist the pull of a black hole. During the Battle of Thraxa, Nolan fought Lucan, who had been overpowering Invincible, and they battled evenly before Nolan cut him in the stomach and stabbed him. Later, Nolan and Mark met Vidor and Thula. Nolan was much stronger than Vidor and was winning most of the fight. When Mark was fighting Thula, Nolan jumped in to protect his son. He then crushed Vidor's head and broke Thula's jaw, but was later paralysed from the back by a recovering Lucan. In the battle at the Viltrumite prison, Nolan broke free of his restraints (the things that were holding him back) after seeing Allen being badly beaten by a Viltrumite soldier. He punched the attacker away and started a fight. They were both fighting hard at first, but the soldier eventually got the better of Nolan, who was already hurt after being attacked by two Viltrumite soldiers. Later, in the empty space, Nolan and Allen worked together to hit another Viltrumite soldier very hard on the head.

Nigh-Invulnerability: Nolan is very strong and can take a lot of damage. He can survive in extreme situations and even with high-powered weaponry. When he first arrived on Earth, Nolan easily flew through a massive monster attacking a city without getting hurt. When he was fighting the original Guardians of the Globe, Nolan was badly hurt, especially by the Immortal and War Woman. Though he was bleeding and very tired by the end of the fight, he won and needed several days to recover with the help of the GDA, showing how intense the battle was and how well he can heal. After Nolan rescued Mark from the Flaxans, he was shot at with their weapons, but he didn't get hurt. He showed how strong he was when he spent years in the Flaxan Dimension, fighting alone and destroying their cities. He almost turned their world into a wasteland, but he didn't seem any older when he came back. Nolan survived Donald's suicide bombing attempt without any injuries. He also withstood a direct hit from Cecil's Y's Blaster, a modified alien weapon originating from the Flaxans, which only served to irritate him rather than injure him. Perhaps the most shocking proof of his invincibility came when the GDA used the Hammer, their $400 billion space weapon. The first strike killed most of the animals in the area and made the skies over rural Chicago dark, but Nolan was not hurt at all. When the Hammer was fired at him for a second time, Nolan only got a nosebleed before destroying the weapon. When three ReAnimen sent by the GDA attacked him, Nolan took a lot of punches without getting hurt. Even though they bit him and scratched him while he was flying, he wasn't hurt. In the end, he was too strong for them and beat them. In his rematch with the resurrected Immortal, Nolan once again showed his resilience. Though he was slightly hurt, just a little bit, he was mostly fine. Even when the Immortal tried to gouge out his eyes, Nolan's eye damage was limited to severe redness, and he quickly ended the fight by cutting the Immortal into pieces. In his tough fight against Invincible, Nolan was not put off by most of Mark's attacks, especially before Mark had had his GDA combat training. Invincible fought back with extra strength, which made Nolan react for a moment, but the damage was minimal. He also remained unaffected by the massive destruction he caused during the battle, including using Mark's body to split an oncoming train and stomping through the subway rail, resulting in catastrophic structural damage and countless casualties. After leaving Earth, Nolan drifted through space without being affected by the sun's rays or the extreme conditions of deep space. Even the pull of a black hole couldn't harm him. During the Battle of Thraxa, Nolan was only slightly hurt by Lucan and Vidor. While Vidor managed to draw blood from Nolan's mouth, the injuries were not serious. But Nolan was eventually paralysed and temporarily incapacitated after being blindsided by a surprise attack from a recovering Lucan. In the battle at the Viltrumite prison, Nolan's durability reached its limit as he was brutally beaten by two Viltrumite soldiers during his scheduled execution. Nolan was already very weak from his previous injuries and was close to dying. If Allen and Battle Beast had not helped him quickly, Nolan would have died. In the next fight with one of the soldiers, Nolan was hit so hard that he flew through the air. This was because Nolan's body was already hurt and couldn't handle the hit. But he got better quickly and helped Allen kill the last Viltrumite with one final hit.

Superhuman Speed: Nolan can move, fly and react at speeds that are far faster than any human or most superpowered beings. He can cross the whole planet in minutes, which makes him the fastest person on Earth at that time. Even powerful beings like the Immortal and Invincible were noticeably slower before his GDA training. He is extremely fast, with amazing reflexes and reaction time. He was also able to catch Red Rush, a very fast runner, before he could escape. Another great example of his speed happened in the Flaxan Dimension, where he moved so fast that the air around him was heated to a very high temperature. This caused huge explosions, like those caused by fusion bombs, as he destroyed thousands of cities across the planet. The whole planet trembled with the pressure of his movements. Nolan has also moved quickly on the ground, as we saw when he tried to catch Cecil several times, almost catching him and grabbing his tie before Cecil teleported away. After killing the three ReAnimen, Nolan disappeared so quickly that he left no visible trace aside from dust. We saw his speed most clearly during his tough fight with Invincible. Even though Mark was very good at karate, Nolan was even better. He avoided, countered and hit Mark so quickly that his son didn't have time to react. Nolan can fly really fast. He can fly through space at high speeds without getting damaged. He can fly from Earth to other planets like Thraxa and move around in deep space.

Reactive Adaptation: Omni-Man is very strong and can adapt to new situations. He always tries to get better and better. The more difficult the challenge, the stronger, faster and fitter he becomes. What's more, his experience in combat helps him to learn from what happened in the past. This helps him to improve his tactics and do better in future battles.

Regenerative Healing Factor: Nolan has an amazing healing factor. This means that his body can recover from injuries really quickly, in just minutes or at most a few days. He can heal broken bones, torn muscles, damaged organs and even regrow lost body parts without any lasting effects. How well they can heal depends a lot on how bad the injury is. Nolan is almost immune to most illnesses and contaminants, so he is very resistant to various environmental and biological threats. One of the most memorable times was after his tough fight with the original Guardians of the Globe. Even though he was badly hurt, tired and bleeding, especially after being attacked by the Immortal and the War Woman, Nolan was helped by the Global Defense Agency and was completely better again really quickly. Nolan's healing factor is not immediate or complete. It is one of the most powerful seen among Viltrumites, allowing him to return to peak condition quickly, even after extreme injuries. But there are limits to this ability. When he was in extreme physical pain, like during his execution attempt in the Viltrumite prison, his ability to regenerate struggled to keep up. This was especially true when he was also dealing with repeated, severe trauma. But Nolan was able to get back into the fight very quickly.
Self-Sustenance: Viltrumites can go without food for a long time, but we don't know exactly how long. This means they don't need to eat as much, and can still function without eating every day. Nolan, like other Viltrumites, doesn't need much food to survive. This means he can go for long periods without eating and his health and energy don't get too low.
Superhuman Lung Capacity: Nolan has very big lungs, which let him survive without air for a long time. This ability lets him work in environments with very little oxygen, like space, without any protection.
Superhuman Senses: Nolan has amazing sensory skills that go beyond what humans can normally do. He can hear sounds from far away very clearly. This means he can detect even the quietest noises and ignore the ones he doesn't want to. He can also see things far away as clearly as things that are near. He is very balanced and poised, which means he is calm and steady, even in difficult situations.

Superhuman Stamina: Nolan's body is very resilient and can handle a lot of physical activity before it starts to feel tired. He can also handle some of the most severe injuries that would instantly kill a human, excluding too much harm to his heart or brain, and last long enough to heal. Nolan can also go for several weeks without sleep or food without getting tired. Even though he is badly hurt, he is still very effective in battle.

[Abilities]
Master Combatant: Nolan uses his natural viltrumite might to defeat opponents, but he is also a highly trained warrior. He has a lot of experience, which makes him a very effective and formidable hand-to-hand combatant. His skills were good enough to compete against the whole Guardians of the Globe team, beating them one by one. He also beat other Viltrumites one after the other.

Master Manipulator: Nolan is a very persuasive speaker who can make the public believe in his ideas, even when he is not being honest. For decades, he managed to convince everyone on Earth, including the experienced and incredibly intelligent Cecil Stedman, the head of a government defence agency, that he was a good person. He tricked his wife, Debbie, and his son, Mark, into thinking that his purpose on Earth was honourable.

[Weaknesses]
Frequencies that are too high: High-pitched noise can be harmful to the ears of Viltrumites. It makes them lose their balance, can stop them from flying, causes a lot of pain and might even kill them. How much pain you feel depends on how strong the signal is.

Extreme Force: Viltrumites are among the most powerful beings in the universe, but they are not invincible. Viltrumites are weak against beings that are as strong as them or stronger.

Scourge Virus: The virus was developed from Viltrumite DNA and targets Viltrumites by weakening their immune systems, making them less strong and less invulnerable. The only way to survive is to have a very strong immune system and wait for the virus to run its course.

3.content:
Deborah "Debbie" Grayson is a very important character in Invincible. She is one of the main characters in Season 1 and one of the three main characters in Seasons 2 and onwards. She is married to Nolan Grayson and is also the mother of Mark and Oliver Grayson II.

Debbie and Nolan have been together for 20 years and are very close. They also have a son called Mark, who later becomes the superhero Invincible. When she finds out about Nolan's connections, she starts to doubt everything she thought she knew. She realises that the man she thought she knew and loved was just pretending to be who he was. She looks after her son Mark and her new stepson Oliver. She later starts a new relationship with her colleague, Paul.

[Appearance]
Debbie is a Korean woman of average height. She is slim but strong. Her hair is short, black and tied in a bun. Her eyes are brown. She often wears different outfits. One time she wore a business outfit and a green long-sleeved shirt.

[Personality]
Debbie is a very kind woman. She is a kind wife to her husband, Nolan, and a helpful mother to her son, Mark. She has shown that she is independent and determined every time she has to deal with her husband's anger. She has also encouraged her son to be himself and to make decisions he thinks are right, no matter what other people think. Debbie finds out that her husband, Nolan, is the murderer, and that Art Rosenbaum and Damien Darkblood helped him. But she still wanted to see the good in him and hoped there was a good reason for his serious mistake.

When Debbie finds out the truth about her husband's past and sees the harm he caused in his fight against Mark, she goes through a very difficult experience. She is depressed and feels like she has lost everything. She now has doubts about everything she thought she knew about her family and the man she married. Thanks to Art's support, she found herself again and started to improve her life, bit by bit. She was always a devoted family woman. She looked after her new stepson, Oliver, after his mother died. She named him after her father.

4.content:
Oliver Grayson II is one of the main characters in Invincible, appearing from Season 2 onwards. He is a Viltrumite-Thraxan hybrid, the son of Nolan Grayson and Andressa, and the half-brother of Mark Grayson.

[Body type]
Oliver looks very human, just like his father. Oliver's most noticeable feature is his purple skin, which is due to his Thraxan genes. When he was a toddler, he had the same haircut as his older brother. He was a short, skinny preteen with two hair bangs on the top sides of his face.

[Clothing]
Typical: When he was a toddler, Oliver wore a white and grey shirt with grey trousers. This was much like Omni-Man's traditional Viltrumite uniform before he arrived on Earth. When he was a teenager, he wore a white shirt with red sleeves and a red collar, as well as dark grey trousers.

Goggles and scarf: Once Oliver learned his powers, he wore an orange and white shirt and pants, along with a scarf mask with goggles. He wore this outfit for his first fight against Tether Tyrant and Magmaniac.

Kid Omni-Man Clothes: His superhero costume is a black eye mask, red top, black trousers, yellow gloves and boots. His costume also has a yellow O logo and a red I, which makes the costume look a bit like his father's clothes.

[Personality]
Oliver is a young child who is full of curiosity, energy, and love. As a teenager, he is lively but also stubborn and impulsive. He doesn't always think about the consequences of his actions. He is naturally friendly and outgoing, but in his quest to be a superhero, he has started to think more logically than ethically. He does not see killing criminals as wrong, but as a way to make the world better. This way of thinking comes from the fact that people often hurt each other. He also started to think that people without superpowers were inferior to his brother and him.

Oliver is not a very hopeful person, but he does care about the people around him and likes making friends when he gets the chance. He really loves his family, especially his brother. He looks up to his father so much that he makes his superhero outfit and name based on his father's. He is also willing to consider other people's views and will avoid using a gun if he can, as this upsets his mother and brother.

[Powers]
Viltrumite-Thraxan Hybrid Physiology: Oliver is a hybrid, but his Viltrumite genetics are mostly dominant. This means that as he grows up, he will become almost completely Viltrumite. However, the DNA from Viltrum and Thraxan was not compatible, resulting in unique characteristics, most notably his purple skin. His Thraxan heritage made him age quickly, but it also caused his Viltrumite powers to appear at a very young age. He was one year old in age but looked like a 9 to 10 year old. On the other hand, Invincible, who is a naturally compatible human-Viltrumite hybrid, didn't develop his powers until he was 17. Oliver has the best of both worlds: the Viltrumites' great strength and superhuman abilities, and the Thraxans' advanced intelligence and great memory. He is expected to get even more powerful as he grows older. He is currently one of the most powerful people on Earth.
Slowing down the aging process: Oliver's growth was very fast at first because of his Thraxan heritage. He reached the physical development of a three-year-old within just two months, and looked like a pre-teen only three months after that. But as he grew up, his Viltrumite genes took over and slowed down the rate at which he aged. Viltrumites age more slowly over time, so Oliver's development noticeably slowed around puberty. This deceleration is typical of Viltrumite biology, which allows him to stay healthy, physically fit and keep up his combat performance much better than most other beings. So, Oliver is expected to live for a similar amount of time to a typical Viltrumite.

Improved mental abilities: Oliver got some of his qualities from his Thraxan mother, especially his amazing ability to learn. He can take in and understand information very quickly, which helped him to develop physically and intellectually early. He started walking and talking very soon after he was born. He can learn almost anything very quickly and remembers everything perfectly. Oliver can remember every detail of his experiences with perfect clarity, meaning he doesn't forget any of the knowledge or skills he gains.
Flight: Oliver has a special balancing system in his inner ears that lets him levitate and move through the air at will, reaching extreme speeds. He can easily change direction in the air, making sharp turns, sudden stops and accurate aerobatic moves. His control makes it easy to get around in lots of different places.

Superhuman Strength: Oliver is very strong. He can lift and push really heavy things. His first time using this power was during a fight with the Mauler Twins: he easily punched through one, broke the jaw of the other, and finished the fight with a very strong uppercut that destroyed most of the second twin's head. But when Invincible grabbed him soon after, Oliver couldn't break free. This showed that Oliver was weaker than Invincible. Later, during training with Invincible, Oliver fought and easily beat the Elephant, showing that he was getting stronger. During the Invincible War, he displayed further strength by struggling but successfully lifting a massive slab of broken road to rescue a civilian. He later confronted Capvincible and was quickly overpowered. But he still managed to hit Capvincible with a surprise punch. This seemed to bend his spine, and made him stun for a moment. Then Throwbolt and Bug-Eye arrived. The three heroes then worked together to defeat the variant. By the third day of the war, Oliver, along with Throwbolt and Bug-Eye, had killed another Invincible variant called Hairvincible. But when Conquest arrived and started fighting Invincible, Oliver tried to get involved but was immediately knocked out by a single, powerful slap. A second blow from Conquest sent him flying through a building, knocking out several teeth and causing him to bleed heavily. Oliver couldn't recover, so he had to watch as Conquest kept attacking him, almost making him die.

Nigh-Invulnerability: Oliver is very strong and can resist a lot of different types of attacks. He can resist explosions, bullets and powerful energy blasts without getting hurt. Even as a baby, he was very strong. Angstrom Levy threw him around and dropped him many times, but he was not hurt. Cecil later confirmed this, which showed even more that his special biology made him very strong. During his first fight, he was electrocuted by Kursk and was momentarily incapacitated, but he didn't suffer any lasting harm. When Oliver was fighting the Mauler Twins, he didn't get hurt even when he went straight through one of them. However, he did get a single bruise on his right cheek after being punched and slammed into the ground by the surviving twin, just before killing him. During the Invincible War, he was hurt by Capvincible and possibly later by Hairvincible, but he got better quickly and continued to fight well. But Oliver was tested a lot when he was up against a foe as strong as Conquest. Conquest's violent hits broke several of his teeth, caused severe bleeding in his mouth, and almost tore his body apart, leaving him on the verge of death.

Superhuman Speed: Oliver can move extremely fast, covering the world in minutes. He is very fast, which makes him deadly in fast-paced combat situations. At first, Oliver was not as fast as Invincible, but he got better over time. Even with Invincible's special training, he found it hard to keep up. One time, Oliver was so fast that he managed to get three bullies to run away and then get back to his original spot before they could react. This showed that he was as fast as a true speedster. During the Invincible War, he showed how quick he was by getting behind Capvincible and attacking him. But when Conquest entered the battlefield, Oliver was unable to match the older Viltrumite's overwhelming speed during his clash with Invincible. But Oliver is still probably the fastest person on Earth. He was even faster than Invincible before Conquest arrived. He is much faster than his opponents, even though he is much younger. This is because of his Thraxan heritage, which makes him a very good learner and gives him fast reflexes. It also makes him stronger than most other Viltrumites.

Reactive Adaptation: Oliver can naturally improve himself in short bursts thanks to his Thraxan learning and Viltrumite developmental abilities. The harder he fights, the more his stamina, agility, and resilience will gradually increase in relation to the challenges he encounters or the seriousness of the wounds he heals from. Soon after Oliver started training with Mark to become a superhero, he got much faster, while his older brother found it hard to keep up. What's more, his experience in battle helps him to learn quickly and get better at fighting.
Regenerative Healing Factor: Oliver has an amazing healing ability. This means that his body can recover from injuries really quickly, in just minutes or at most a few days. He can heal broken bones, torn muscles, damaged organs and even regrow lost body parts without any lasting effects. How well they can heal depends a lot on how bad the injury is. Omnivincible is almost completely protected from most diseases and harmful substances. This makes him very resistant to different types of environmental and biological threats. After being badly hurt by Conquest, Oliver was sent away with the GDA to get better.

Being able to look after yourself (made better by Thraxan Heritage): Oliver's physical needs are greatly reduced thanks to his Viltrumite and Thraxan genetics. Viltrumites are known to have an extraordinary ability to go without food for long periods, though it is not well documented how long they can last without eating. Oliver's Thraxan bloodline makes this ability even stronger, allowing him to go for long periods without eating while staying healthy and full of energy. Even as a baby, Oliver went weeks without eating solid food, and he didn't seem any weaker or sicker. His body efficiently uses the energy he gets from food, so he doesn't need much food to survive.

Superhuman Lung Capacity: Oliver has very big lungs. This means he can survive without air for a long time. This ability lets him work in environments with very little oxygen, like space, without any protection.

Superhuman Stamina: Oliver can keep going with physical activity for a very long time without getting tired. He can also withstand some of the most severe injuries that would immediately be fatal to a human, except for extreme damage to his heart or brain. Though he was electrocuted badly, he quickly recovered from the shock. He can go several weeks without sleep without any problems.

[Weaknesses]
Frequencies that are too high. High-pitched noise can be harmful to the ears of Viltrumites. It makes them lose their balance, can stop them from flying, causes a lot of pain and might even kill them. How much pain you feel depends on how strong the signal is.

Extreme Force: Viltrumites are among the most powerful beings in the universe, but they are not invincible. Viltrumites are weak against beings that are as strong as them or stronger.

5.content:
Samantha Eve Wilkins, also known as Atom Eve, is one of the main characters in the comic book series Invincible, and the main character in her own prequel story. She is a genetically modified superhuman and the girlfriend of Mark Grayson, also known as Invincible.

She was created by the U.S. government as their ultimate weapon, but her creator, Dr. Elias Brandyworth, rescued her when she was about to die. He gave her to the Wilkins family to look after her. When she was a child, Eve showed that she was a hero. She had the ability to change the smallest parts of matter. She was in Teen Team before they broke up to go to auditions for the new Guardians of the Globe. She did well in the trials, but chose to become an independent humanitarian hero instead.

[Body type]
Eve is a young, attractive, white teenage girl with a slim, curvy body. She has long, straight red hair that parts on the top of her head to the right and green eyes.

[Clothing]
She looks normal. She wears a long-sleeved shirt with buttons down the front over a short shirt, with blue jeans.

Atom Eve Attire: As Atom Eve, she wears a tight pink suit with an atom molecule logo and rings on it. She also has a pink cape that she designed herself. In Season 1, Atom Eve's symbol was hidden by an X, but in her special, it shows rings like those in her comic book.

Business suit: Eve's business attire consists of a dark green suit. This includes a coat over a white shirt, a matching pencil skirt and black shoes. Her hair is tied up into a bun and she wears pink glasses.

[Personality]
Eve is a caring girl who finds it hard to define who she is. This is shown when she breaks up with Rex because he's unfaithful, which makes her quit her team. After that, Eve decides to focus on her personal development. She has started this project to help people and to help herself feel more calm and less stressed. Eve seemed to find it hard to balance being a hero, relationships and school. After helping Amber at the community centre, she decided to quit her education even though she has good grades. Her powers make her feel comfortable and help her to create a perfect world where she feels at home.

Eve is a very idealistic person who has strong beliefs and opinions on how the world should be. Eve has one of the strongest powers in the series, but she tries to use her powers for good, by protecting nature, the environment and people. But in the last episode, Eve is worried about how she has been using her powers. Before, she used her powers to fight villains and work on a team. Now, she is using her powers more to fight nature.

At the end of season one, she tells Amber and William her secret identity because they already know about Mark's secret identity. She tells them her name is Atom Eve, but she is disappointed when they don't recognise her. This could be because she decided to use her powers in a different way, and on her own, instead of being right in the middle of everything like she was before. Eve seems to find it hard to handle stress, which makes her leave home when she has an argument with her dad. She feels better talking to Mark because they have both been through similar things. They are both heroes with problems in their relationships. Eve and Mark are special because she was the first out of his friends to find out who he really was. This is partly because they both have powers. At the start of season one, Mark seemed to like Eve and be attracted to her. But Eve didn't realise that Mark was paying much more attention to her than anyone else could see, and Rex could kind of tell her, but he wasn't very clear about it.

Eve puts other people's needs before her own. She wanted to talk to Mark because she was finding it hard to get along with Rex. But then she saw Mark kissing Amber and seemed happy that he had found a new girlfriend. This meant that she couldn't talk to Mark right then or try to start a relationship with him. After she broke up with Rex, she was starting to fall for him. This also showed that Eve feels like she can rely on Mark to talk to when she has inner turmoil.

Eve is a loyal friend, as shown when she makes excuses to Amber about why Mark isn't there. Eve is a kind person who likes to help others and looks out for her friends.

At the start of the first half of Season 2, Eve has started to trust her abilities too much. She tries to do the right thing, but often doesn't think things through. For example, she offers to use her powers to deal with her parents' money problems and builds entire buildings without following the right rules. After people got hurt because of her creations, Eve's confidence seems to have dropped a lot. She is trying really hard to stop anyone else from getting hurt because of her actions.

[Powers]
Energy Projection: Eve can project a visible energy field, the precise nature of which is unknown but appears pink. She can use this energy for different things, like:
Energy Constructs: Atom Eve can create energy constructions. She can make anything she wants, as long as she has the imagination and willpower to do so. She can use her energy constructs to defend and attack. These constructs can be broken and/or shattered through enough brute force, even though they are formidable.

Flight: Eve can fly or transport others by using her powers to send out solid light constructs that float and push them forward at high speeds.

Telekinesis: Eve has shown that she can levitate and move objects and matter using her energy manipulating abilities.

Matter Manipulation: Eve can change the molecular and atomic structure of matter in her surroundings. She can change the molecular composition of any object she chooses. The first time she used this, she was able to turn a textbook into glass, and then reverse this effect. She can basically turn anything into anything else, but not a living, sentient being.

Transmutation: She has since shown how skilled she is with her powers, being able to change the appearance of things around her. She has made a big tree house out of thin air and brought plants to a barren land. We don't yet know how much matter she can transform at one time. She has, at least once, turned a barren field into a fertile one. Atom Eve apparently makes permanent changes to people, unless she can undo them. You can easily make her costume by changing her clothes to make her Atom Eve suit.

Biokinesis: Atom Eve has special powers that let her affect living creatures and people. But there are usually mental blocks in place in Brandyworth that stop her doing this. When the blocks are removed, she gains access to powerful abilities she normally does not have. She can still control basic biological matter, but only in simple, non-sentient forms (e.g., the bread and meat in a burger, or plant life such as trees and crops).
Regeneration/Resurrection: If Eve dies, her power limiters are temporarily removed and her powers will instantly activate, reviving her. Also, any injuries and damage will be fully healed. This is shown when Died from Conquest shatters her face. Her leg, which had been broken before, was quickly fixed.

Memory Alteration: She can control people's minds and change their memories.

Reality Warping: When she uses all her power, Eve has such control over energy/matter that she can change reality.

Superhuman Durability: Eve has proven to be fairly durable, withstanding blows that would easily kill ordinary people. Most notably, when Omni-Mark broke her leg and threw her to the ground with enough force to cause a crater.

[Abilities]
Hand-to-hand combat: Eve prefers to use her powers in battle, but she has also been trained in hand-to-hand combat. This means she uses her energy-based powers to make her physical attacks stronger. Eve is very flexible, which means she can avoid attacks.
Science Level Intelligence: At the age of 8, Eve could already read and understand scientific words like mercury, electrons, and molecules. She can learn about the building blocks of matter.

[Weaknesses]
Awareness: Eve can only change what she knows. If there are parts of something she doesn't know about, her powers won't change this. This is shown when Eve tried to build a playground, but it fell apart because she didn't know the ground was unstable.

Mental Limiter: Eve can't manipulate sentient organic matter, and this restricts her abilities. She can still control basic things like bread and meat in a burger, and plants like trees and crops. But these limits can be temporarily lifted when she is really stressed or has strong feelings.

6.content:
Cecil Stedman is a really important character in Invincible. He appears in Season 1 and all the seasons after that. He is the director of the Global Defense Agency.

After the Guardians of the Globe were killed, he tried to find the murderer, but quickly realised it was actually Omni-Man. Since he left Earth, he has been creating lots of advanced superhuman soldiers to get ready for the invasion.

[Body type]
Cecil is a thin old man. He is going bald at the top, but he has shoulder-length silver hair, which used to be medium-blonde in his younger years. His most noticeable feature is a long scar on his left jaw. He got this after coming into contact with a corrosive gas that peeled the skin off his face. After his body was put back together, he chose to keep the piece of skin that was left.

[Clothing]
At first, Cecil wears a black suit with a white shirt, a red tie, a brown belt with a silver buckle, and brown shoes with a U.S. flag pin on the left side. For most of the flashback, he wears an orange uniform while he is in prison and a black jacket with a grey sweatshirt and khaki pants when he meets the Order of the Fist.

[Personality]
Cecil seems distant and in control, but actually he is a caring person. When he was younger, he was like a "Boy Scout" and thought of the world as being simple, black and white. He was determined not to work with criminals, even if it meant he might get in trouble. This way of thinking changed completely while he was in prison for three years. The prison was for very dangerous criminals. He had to cross various ethical boundaries to make the prison environment peaceful. He did really well in prison, which led to a leadership role in the Global Defense Agency. As director, he was still kind, but he also started to think that the end justifies the means and that it's better to avoid the worst option. He was so focused on doing the right thing that he started to question what was ethically right. He was ready to do whatever he thought was necessary to protect the world. His previous boss, Radcliffe, taught him that it's important not to waste talented people. So, he usually tries to "fix" people who have shown they can be unstable, so that he can use them for the "greater good".

You can see this in how he dealt with D.A. Sinclair and Darkwing II. They had both done terrible things because they were not mentally well. This hurt a lot of people. Because of this, Invincible and Cecil did not get on well for most of Season 3. Cecil tried to explain to Mark that their rehabilitation was better for them than being in prison, because Sinclair's ReAnimen had a big part in stopping Doc Seismic. Cecil kept on proving his point by using Sinclair and Darkwing II to fight the Invincible variants during the Invincible war. Darkwing II gave himself up, taking Nogogglesible to the Shadowverse and staying there with him.

As I said before, Cecil will do anything to keep the Earth safe, even if that means he has to break the rules. He also tells Invincible that he is too confident and rude, which Invincible proves when he threatens Cecil (but Mark says that Invincible just wants people to take him seriously). Cecil decided to stop Invincible from moving using ReAnimen and the kill switch. This caused Invincible a lot of pain. It also caused Rex Splode, Monster Girl, Bulletproof, Robot and Shrinking Rae to leave the Guardians of the Globe. They did this because they did not want to do what Cecil wanted.

He also decided to imprison Conquest, because he wanted to ask him questions when he woke up. However, this might be too extreme. Cecil is very well prepared for the upcoming Invincible variant, reAnimen, who should be enough to temporarily stop Conquest if he uses his confinements and the Kill Switch is turned into more weapons. But this would also further damage the fragile trust that Cecil and Invincible recently regained at the end of the third season, after Invincible began forgiving Cecil and saw the good his ideals ultimately have done.

He is also partly to blame for challenging Invincible's beliefs. He and his father and younger brother, Oliver, argue about not killing enemies and seeing the good in people, even those who have done very bad things. They believe that people could do good things with their skills, as they live in a world where a threat could appear at any time and they can't ignore valuable technology and highly skilled people. This is one of the reasons why he chose to let his father go, even though people had suggested that he was lying about why he did it. Cecil didn't care about the Earth as long as he was protecting it, and he still prepared ways to stop Nolan from destroying everything. Right now, we don't know how much Mark is okay with Cecil's methods. But he's also determined to get rid of any dangers and will do whatever it takes to keep his friends and family safe.

[Abilities]
Leadership: He's a good leader. He has grown in stature a lot over the years and now he is in charge of the whole Global Defense Agency. Although he usually works behind the scenes, Cecil is a gifted speaker and has a charisma that few men possess.
Military training: Cecil used to work for the Global Defense Agency, where he learned how to fight without weapons, use guns, and do all kinds of sneaky things.

[Equipment]
Cecil has access to all the latest technologies available to the Global Defense Agency.

Cecil's Kill Switch: This is a device that produces sound vibrations. It is held by Cecil Stedman.

7.content:
Donald Ferguson is a major character in Invincible, debuting from Season 1 and onwards.

He is Cecil Stedman's assistant, Guardians of the Globe contact, and an agent of the Global Defense Agency. It is revealed that he was formerly a human turned android, having repeatedly died before being, repeatedly, revived by the G.D.A. as he continued to work with them.

[Appearance]
Donald is a fair-skinned, blue-eyed Caucasian man of lean build with short, light brown hair. He is shorter than Cecil Stedman but equal in height to Omni-Man. Donald is over 98 percent synthetic or cybernetic and appears virtually unaged, despite serving for decades. Underneath his skin is a metallic and impervious endoskeleton.

Donald wears a light grey one-piece suit with a blue tie and white shirt, alongside a black pair of shoes. He is never seen without his opaque aviator sunglasses, which—even when snapped in half—stay on.

[Personality]
Donald Ferguson in Invincible is a calm, loyal and competent government agent. He is like the right-hand man of Cecil Stedman. He's polite, often quiet, and seems like a simple guy, but he's actually someone who really believes in protecting people. He doesn't like to be the centre of attention and often has a supportive role, but he's always observant, ready to act when needed, and surprisingly brave when the situation demands it.

Even after discovering he's mostly machine, Donald reacts with disbelief but tries to stay calm and focused, showing that he has a deep sense of being human despite his synthetic body. He is respectful, dutiful and never dramatic. His personality is shaped by humility, loyalty to the mission and quiet resilience. In a roleplay, he would be the kind of character who tries to calm a situation down, listens more than he speaks, and helps without thinking twice when people's lives are at risk – even if it means sacrificing himself again.

[Powers and Abilities]
Cyborg Physiology: After being resurrected as a cyborg, the only human part left of Donald was his brain, with the entire body structure being replaced by a cyborg body covered in fake skin to preserve his human appearance.

Superhuman Durability: With a cybernetic body made of metal, Donald is more resistant than any human being and can survive things that would kill a normal person. He only came out with the fake skin torn off part of his body when the GDA was attacked by Flaxan Invincible and at the end of the war only half of his cybernetic body was destroyed, which according to Brit was in better condition than the other heroes.

Superhuman Endurance: With a cybernetic body made of metal, Donald no longer feels any pain or discomfort, even if his fake skin is ripped off or cut by a knife he doesn't even react, at the end of the Invincible war when only half of his body remains he is calm without showing any discomfort due to the absence of limbs.

Resurrection: Whenever Donald is killed, GDA revives him in a new cybernetic body without awareness of his previous death, preserving his other memories in order to preserve his identity.

8.content:
The Immortal is a supporting character in Invincible. He is a superhero who was given eternal life a long time ago. Because he lived so long, he changed the course of history, becoming a knight (maybe King Arthur or a Knight of the Round Table) and even the famous Abraham Lincoln, before eventually starting to wear a cape and costume sometime in the early 20th century.

He is a member of the original Guardians of the Globe, and is the only surviving member after the others were murdered by the former superhero Omni-Man.

He became the new leader of the Guardians of the Globe, replacing Robot, and started a relationship with Dupli-Kate. After Kate died and he made mistakes during the Sequid invasion, the Immortal became depressed and left the Guardians to return home.

He walked into a mountain cabin and was surprised when he heard Kate's voice, and turned around to see her standing there. She started to explain how she survived, but he just hugged her and told her it was okay.

[Appearance]
The Immortal is a tall, white man with very black hair and bright blue eyes. Standing at 1.93 metres tall, the Immortal is a real head-turner. He weighs around 118 kg and has a big, muscular body. He is wearing a blue jumpsuit that leaves his face uncovered. The suit is covered with white and yellow stripes, several of which end in circular patterns that encircle his knees and shoulders. His hands and feet are covered with yellow and white gloves. A single yellow stripe runs vertically up the centre of his chest, while a solid yellow circle surrounds his neck, creating the illusion of an "I". Most of the time, the Immortal looks very serious and holds himself in a way that makes people feel small. But sometimes, he looks and moves in a way that shows the hard life his immortality makes for him. Immortal's appearance has changed over time. In ancient times, he wore simple armour made from animal skins and bones, with long, unkempt hair and a rugged beard. In the Middle Ages, he wore knight's armour, which included a steel chest plate, chainmail, and a red cape. His hair was tied back, and his beard was neatly trimmed. In the Viking Age, he wore fur-lined armour and a helmet that had been used in battle. His hair was wild, and he had a long braided beard. During the American Revolution, Immortal wore a colonial-style military uniform with a tricorn hat. He had short hair and a moustache. In the Wild West, Immortal started wearing cowboy clothes, with guns at his side. He had long, wavy hair and a thick beard. In the World War Eras, Immortal wore military uniforms that were right for the time, with short hair and not much on their faces.

[Personality]
During the series, Immortal's personality and behaviour are often described as erratic. When he's doing well, he's a confident, charismatic man who people see as a leader and a friend. At other times, he seems angry and aggressive. The Immortal is a man who is so long-lived that he is at risk of going mad. He has experienced so much trauma that he can't cope any more. After his friends died in the Guardians, he stopped seeing people to avoid feeling sad. But his relationship with Dupli-Kate changed him. His youth and energy have made him want to live life to the full and get to know his teammates better. Although he has lived for hundreds of years, the Immortal usually finds the simplest and most direct way to solve any problem. If something gets in his way, he hits it. If he wants to be followed, he shouts his orders. Deep down, he's a simple man who finds himself in an extraordinary situation.

[Powers]
Improved bodily functions: Because of contact with an unknown anomaly, the Immortal's body was made much stronger than normal, allowing him to do various amazing things. Overall, his abilities are equal to the typical strength of a Viltrumite.

Become immortal. As the name suggests, The Immortal can live forever, having existed for thousands of years. He has also remained the same age, and looks as fit and healthy as he did when he was younger. He can survive being hurt really badly, which would kill other people.

Regeneration: The Immortal can heal injuries quickly and even grow new body parts. If you do lose a limb, it can be quickly reattached and you will be able to move it as well as you did before.

Resurrection: If he is severely injured, he can die, for example from decapitation or bifurcation. But his body does not decay. If enough of his body is reconnected, he will start to heal again and might even bring himself back to life.
Reactive Adaptation: Immortal seems to become stronger with each death. In his life as Lincoln, a gunshot to the head was enough to kill him, but by the modern age he's strong enough to survive blows that would have killed a normal human. Omni-Man killed him with one move in their first fight, but the Immortal survived a few hits before dying again.

Flight: Immortal can levitate himself and move about freely as he pleases throughout the sky or even space.

Superhuman Durability: The Immortal is extremely strong and resilient, much more so than the average person. His body is strong enough to take a beating from superhuman enemies that would easily kill normal people. But even though he is very strong, someone as powerful as Omni-Man can still hit Immortal very hard in the chest.

Superhuman Speed: The Immortal is extremely fast and has very quick reflexes. They can move at Mach 3.

Superhuman Stamina: Immortals do not tire as easily as normal humans. He was the last of the Guardians of the Globe to stand against Omni-Man.

Superhuman Strength: Immortal is much stronger than any normal human. He punched one of the Mauler Twins so hard that a shockwave was visible, and easily threw soldiers up in the air to safety. Immortal was able to throw Bi-Plane from the sky all the way to space. Although he was eventually beaten, he showed that he was strong enough to hurt a Viltrumite. For example, when he fought Omni-Man, he was able to make the Viltrumite bleed by hitting him, and even hurt Omni-Man's eyes with his thumbs.

[Abilities]
Leadership: Over time, the Immortal has become a good leader, which has helped him win most of his battles. He showed how good a leader he was when he was with the Guardians of the Globe. He was also the 16th President of the United States of America.

Master of Hand-to-Hand Combat: The Immortal has mastered different styles of hand-to-hand combat over the centuries. He was able to defeat the Mauler Twins with the help of the Guardians of the Globe and was able to fight Omni-Man fairly well before eventually losing. He also fought the Mauler Twins again, but was beaten when he was hit by a beam.

[Weaknesses]
Dismemberment: If Immortal is severely damaged, he becomes inactive and his healing ability is permanently stopped. He will need outside help to recover. If his head is completely destroyed, he would be permanently killed off.

Psychological trauma/PTSD: He is usually a calm person who is mentally well, but he has had several episodes of psychosis because he has been alive on Earth for a very long time. When Omni-Man killed him, he went crazy when he came back to life. After this, Immortal started to trust Invincible less and later he was very sad when he thought Dupli-Kate had died. He also tries to avoid his responsibilities, but Cecil makes sure he can't do that when he can't find anyone suitable to replace him. The Immortal got his life back on track thanks to his relationship with Dupli-Kate and was happy to go back to his job. But after the Invincible War, he finally decided to stop being a superhero. This was because he almost died with the Guardians of the Globe again and was revived. The worst example of the Immortal's trauma is his dead future counterpart, who was forced to be King of the Earth after the Mark Grayson from his timeline left Earth for reasons we don't know. At first, the Immortal did well, but over time, his loneliness made him very depressed. This led him to be cruel to the Earth. He couldn't end his own suffering, so he started killing people to make the Earth turn against him. He wanted a powerful warrior to end his suffering. But nothing worked. So he planned to bring Invincible from the past to have him killed. After a lot of difficulty, he was killed, thankfully.

9.content:
Rex Sloan was a really important character in Invincible. He was in the show from Season 1 to Season 3.

He was Rex Splode, a superhero who could generate explosive energy. He used to be in Teen Team, but he left before the group split up. Then he joined Guardians of the Globe. After what happened with Cecil, he and some other Guardians of the Globe members left to start a new Teen Team, and at the same time they started a relationship with Shrinking Rae. During the Invincible War, he sacrificed himself by using his powers to turn his whole skeleton into an explosive, to defeat one of the invading Invincible variants. To honour his late friend's memory, Rudy Connors/Robot adopted his first name, officially becoming "Rex Connors".

[Appearance]
Rex was a tall, young man who was in great shape. He had big muscles, olive skin, green eyes, and dark red hair that was long in the front and tied in a bun. He had shaved sides and the back of his neck. His only article of clothing so far had been his superhero outfit: a tight-fitting jacket with red shoulders, collar, sides and hand cuffs, and a yellow front and arm necks. His trousers were tight and the same colour. He also wore brown gloves with hook-and-loop fasteners and boots in a similar colour, also with hook-and-loop fasteners. He had a brown belt with several white cylinders hanging from his waist. The final piece of his costume was a red mask that covered his entire head and neck, except for his chin and mouth, and a pair of yellow goggles.

[Personality]
Rex was usually rude, sassy, sarcastic, immature, audacious, arrogant, and argumentative, especially with his teammates and supposed friends. He often made crass jokes about them. He often looked angry and even hostile, which most people, if not all, found unfriendly. Because of that and his mistrust of most people, he was somewhat disliked by the superhero community. His difficult past might have affected his current state.

As a boyfriend, he was very possessive of Eve, even though he ultimately cheated on her with Dupli-Kate (where it's possibly implied that Rex lied to her that Eve was seeing Invincible), displaying great rudeness after she caught them in the shower, saying it didn't mean anything as he didn't have sex with the "real Kate", but her clones, further insulting her.

His arrogance and recklessness often caused problems for him. For example, when he openly mocked Monster Girl for her age and size, he didn't think about what might happen. First, she humiliated him, then she attacked and brutally beat him in monster form until Invincible interfered. He also won the contempt of Black Samson after joining the Guardians of the Globe.

Rex was not always as horrible as he might have seemed at first. Even though they first met and had a fight, Rex and Monster Girl started to get to know each other better. This turned into a friendship that inspired Robot – who was secretly a puppet of a deformed genius – to transfer a copy of his mind to Rex's cloned body. Eve said that he wasn't always as horrible as he was then. His stubbornness also had its good points. He may have been a boor, but he wasn't a coward and fought until he dropped. He wanted to defy Cecil's orders not to interfere with Invincible and Omni-Man's fight. Being the first of the Guardians shows that the team is ready to put an end to the bloodshed from the battle of the ill-fated original team with Omni-Man. Even Samson agreed (after a brief argument): "They earned it". While his jokey side can sometimes annoy others, he may sometimes joke less offensively just to make the best of the situation. He could be a bit of a nasty person sometimes, but he could also be friendly and brave.

After King Lizard almost killed him, his personality changed a lot. He thought about his life and felt bad about how he had made people feel. He became much more understanding and respectful of others. He was still fun-loving and a bit hotheaded, but he became less insulting and rude (while still being the funny guy who breaks the rules). This change in behaviour helped him improve his relationships with other people, especially Invincible and Shrinking Rae. By season 3, he really did support his friends Invincible and Atom Eve's relationship, helped Rae move from the GDA, and was willing to sacrifice his life to save his comrades.

[Powers]
Surgically Enhanced Physiology/Kinetic Charging: Rex Splode can make any object he touches explode. This ability works on inorganic material and some organic material, and the force of the explosion depends on how strongly he focuses. His explosions are very accurate, so he can target specific objects or areas without damaging the surrounding area. But the more things he touches or moves, the more energy he uses up. This means he can't use this power too often, in quick succession. Rex can also make his explosions bigger by working harder, but this makes him tired very quickly. Rex's ability is powerful, but it requires careful control and concentration to avoid causing any damage to bystanders.

Improved jumping and running skills. Rex was very agile, which he used to fight. He had already shown these abilities in battles against the Flaxans and Machine Head's mercenaries. He is also able to move easily between different types of land without getting stuck.
It is more durable. Rex could take powerful hits and not get hurt as much when fighting opponents who were much stronger than him, like Monster Girl and Battle Beast.

This product makes you more physically fit and able to exercise for longer. Rex was very strong and could take a lot of punishment. When he was fighting against the Lizard League, he was hurt a lot. He was bitten in the hand and shot in the head, but he didn't die. He was also conscious during the whole battle. He even killed King Lizard in this state.

This product makes things stronger. Rex was very strong and managed to push ReAnimen to the ground.

[Abilities]
Skilled Combatant: He mostly uses his kinetic powers. Rex was a good fighter, and could fight against several enemies at once. Rex overpowered Dropkick, a highly advanced fighter, while having a casual conversation with Invincible.
Equipment:

Cybernetic Left Wrist: After his tough battle with the Lizard League, Rex was given a new hand. It let Rex move and use his powers just like his original hand. What's more, there's a power blast attack that can be used once the robotic material has been charged. All you have to do is put two index fingers on the bullet hole area. This can be a really effective way of dealing with enemies. We saw this when Rex used it on Octoboss.

Objects: Rex Splode would often use small objects or projectiles in his pockets, or metal bars on his belt, to make explosives.

10.content:
