Yamada Asaemon Shugen (山やま田だ浅あさェえ門もん殊しゅ現げん) is a minor antagonist of Hell's Paradise: Jigokuraku. He was the Yamada clan's 2nd rank Asaemon and a previous Assistant Instructor.

After the shogun became impatient of the first team acquiring the Elixir of Life on Kotaku, Shugen became the de facto leader of a second team sent to acquire the elixir. Upon landing on the island and finding evidence of his Asaemon allies dead, Shugen ordered the team to eliminate the surviving criminals and any monsters they found on sight.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


2/2


Shugen had chin-length hair with bangs that frame the sides of his face and slight hints of shadow below his eyes. His attire differed from the standard uniform of an Asaemon, being that he was clad in black due to wearing a black robe and hakama, instead of the standard white, and wore a matching colored kataginu.

After his confrontation with Rien, Shugen lost his right arm up to his elbow. Shugen also received burned marks to his face after recklessly charging towards Rien to attack while she was set on fire by Gabimaru's fire ninjutsu.
Gallery

Shugen's full appearance.
Shugen's full appearance.
Shugen after being burned by Gabimaru.
Shugen after being burned by Gabimaru.
Shugen's initial appearance.
Shugen's initial appearance.
Shugen as a child.
Shugen as a child.
Other

Gantetsusai in the stage play (Final Chapter).
Gantetsusai in the stage play (Final Chapter).

ADVERTISEMENT
Personality

Shugen crying
Shugen crying after having thought about one of his Yamada clansmen.
Shugen was very dignified and diligent in his duties as an executioner and took great pride in being an Asaemon. He cared greatly for his Yamada clansmen, having spent his years with them and being taught what they know, which was reflected in his abilities. He greatly expressed his concern for their safety on the island and vowed to bring them back home no matter what the means were. Furthermore, Shugen had a tendency to become emotional whenever he thought about his comrades. Even though the Yamada clan view women as inferior of becoming an executioner, Shugen was one of the rare few who do not believe in this belief as he vouched for Sagiri's qualifications in receiving a ranking and also did not think ill of Isuzu. It seemed that the only member he had a low opinion of was Jikka, who acted as his complete opposite, and did not take it lightly when he did not conduct himself in a dignified manner. Nevertheless, Shugen referred to him properly as his senior. Among his clan members, Shugen showed the most concern for Eizen, who was the one who took him in when he was young and promised to oversee his maturity as a Yamada Asaemon. After finding his corpse, Shugen broke down into tears and took the time to lay his soul to rest with a prayer.

Shugen greatly despised all criminals and truly believed that they are evil no matter who they are. At a young age, Shugen could not understand the Yamada clan's way of thinking when executing criminals and believed that they should all deserve a painful death. He believed that it was pointless to task the criminals from the vanguard party to retrieve the Elixir of Life and expressed his concern of the thought of one of the assigned criminals completing the mission and receiving the pardon, stating that it would leave him with nightmares. He also did not place his trust in the Iwagakure ninja and viewed them no better than criminals as well. Shugen's disdain towards criminals originated from the time his parents were killed by a murderer and sought revenge against the killer by executing them.

“	Such unpleasantness could not be avoided. Your execution alone would not stop your wicked ways from being carried on by your relations. The blame in such cases lies not only with the corrupt soul of a single man but also with the environment that produced him.	”
— Shugen's words to the boss of the Silver Serpent yakuza group.[1]


The Silver Serpent Incident
Even if they are an infant, Shugen shows no mercy to anyone who are connected to criminals.
Shugen believed in order of all things in the world; the order in which those who abide by the law are to be protected while those who break them should be punished without mercy. As an executioner, Shugen had shown a great display of mercilessness when performing his duties. A great example is when he executed the captured underlings of the Silver Serpent yakuza group in order for their boss to reveal the remaining members that were not arrested and execute them as well. However, despite completing the task he was given, Shugen did not feel that justice had truly been fulfilled and moved towards executing the entire families of each member, showing no mercy in killing men and women, young or old, to infants. Although he was merciless in his duties, Shugen showed what little sympathy he had prior to executing the boss, shedding tears in hoping that he, along with the rest he executed, became righteous in the afterlife. Shion noted that no matter how critical the situation was Shugen would not stoop so low as to ally himself with criminals or allow any Asaemon to ally themselves with criminals as well, even going so far as to state that his arrival on the island only made matters worse rather than good for the allied leftover criminals and Asaemons of the vanguard. Isuzu also vouched for this when she explained to Sagiri that Shugen places this brand of justice above his own desires, which was proven true when he cut down Fuchi who protected Gantetsusai from his wrath despite the years they spent together as comrades. Despite this betrayal, Shugen still thought of Fuchi as a comrade and ordered the Iwagakure shinobi to help him if he was still alive as he made his way to Hōrai's floodgates.

After finding the corpse of his fallen mentor, Shugen unleashed his ruthless, cruel nature and developed a more vengeful attitude, shedding a single tear of blood and furiously declared that he would kill every living thing on the island. He also became more violent and sadistic as he slowly carved away at a Dōshi until he told him everything he needed to know about the island. As they continue to travel the island and find the death of two more Asaemon, Jikka took note at how Shugen was acting more psychotic after resorting to using the whistle the Dōshi had earlier to summon the Monshin and carry them to Hōrai.

ADVERTISEMENT
Relationships

Yamada Clan

Yamada Asaemon Eizen

Yamada Asaemon Jikka

Yamada Asaemon Genji

Yamada Asaemon Fuchi

Yamada Asaemon Tenza

Yamada Asaemon Sagiri

Yamada Asaemon Isuzu

Yamada Asaemon Kiyomaru

Enemies

Criminals

Kotaku's Monsters

History

Past

Shugen was born as an only child and lived in a large shop owned by his parents. While still sound asleep one night, Shugen's parents were murdered after a young man broke in and robbed the shop.[2] After finding about his parents' murder at the hands of a criminal, a young Shugen went into a state of depression and started to develop a disdain towards those who commit illegal actions. Wanting to seek revenge for the yet to be captured criminal who took his parents away from him, Shugen ended up at the doorsteps of the Yamada clan and was looked after by Yamada Asaemon Eizen who had promised to be there for him to see that he learned the ways of the clan. Blinded by his anger and resentment towards his parents' killer, Shugen failed to get along with the members of the clan and focused his time on seeking out the murderer in his neighborhood, believing that it could very well be the same murderer who killed his parents. However, after Eizen and other clan members came to rescue him from the murderer who caught and beaten him up severely, Shugen came to see the Yamada clan as his new family and swore to protect everyone who gathered under its roof.[3] After he was certain he was accepted, Shugen devoted himself to learning all that he could from his clan members, leading to him earning his name as a Yamada Asaemon, the position of second rank as a potential candidate to become the clan's next head, and being recognized by his peers as being the strongest member within the clan, with quite a few members willing to become his followers. Some time ago, Shugen felt that Sagiri was qualified for a ranking and begged for his superiors to consider in giving her one.

During one of his duties as an executioner, Shugen executed the captured members of the Silver Serpent yakuza group in order for their boss to reveal the remaining members hidden within the Castle Town. After successfully executing all twenty members of the group, Shugen moved towards executing the families of each member, with the shogun present, while having the boss watch in horror before executing him last. This event caused Shugen to have an infamous reputation but also caught the approval of the shogun who rewarded him with a sword named Fuributsu Kaneki and ceremonial clothing.

Lord Tensen Arc

Main article: Lord Tensen Arc
The other Asaemon
Shugen and the other Asaemon prepare to depart to Kotaku.
Shugen sits next to Yamada Asaemon Jikka as he explains to the officials how he managed to return from the island. After angering them, Shugen apologizes for Jikka's behavior. They overlook this incident and explains to them the next course of action written in the shogun's message, which is to send out another team of Asaemon to the island. Once they were done discussing matters, Shugen scolds Jikka's behavior but is met with disrespect by the senior Asaemon, causing him to become furious and speaks bluntly that he can not tolerate his attitude. After Jikka apologizes, he wonders if there were any more criminals to send. Shugen informs him that the shogun has hired shinobi from Iwagakure instead of criminals and says that he will also be joining the next team as ordered by their leader, Yamada Asaemon Kichiji. He then sheds a tear after realizing that Eizen has failed to report back to him and becomes worried of his other fellow Asaemon members. A worker then comes up to Jikka asking what they should do with the giant monster head he had killed and brought back. Shugen gets close to the monster's head but the worker warns him that it may still be alive. However, Shugen says that the monster was dead after sensing no waves of life force. He then meets up with two additional allies and tells them that the four of them shall make preparations to depart to the island.

After departing the next day, Shugen thinks that Aoki is feeling uncomfortable with the ninjas presence and informs him that he can correct this. Aoki then becomes concerned with Kiyomaru and Isuzu being unranked Asaemon and wonders if they where capable of handling the mission. Shugen tells Aoki that despite not having a ranking they are skilled enough to handle themselves while also including Jikka, saying that he was adequate and declares that they will be determined to help his clansmen on the island. He then watches as one of the ninjas kills himself after being given the order by Kiyomaru to prove his loyalty and is approached by Kiyomaru asking if they can truly trust them. Shugen tells him that he never trust them to begin with and views them no better than criminals. He then expresses his resolve to kill the criminals on the island so that his clan members can return home. However, after being asked if they were already dead, Shugen becomes angry at the thought and tears up hoping that they are safe.

Shugen finds Eizen's body
Shugen emotionally breaks down after discovering Eizen's corpse.
After the landing party arrives on Kotaku, Shugen encounters a group of Sōshin and defends the team by fighting them barehanded. Once he quickly dealt with the monsters, Isuzu and Kiyomaru come to his aid but Shugen reassures them that as their senior he will take on the responsibility of taking care of lesser matters like fighting the monsters. Jikka becomes pleased to hear this but Shugen reminds him that he is his senior. As he proceeded to continue on with the mission, Shugen shockingly comes across the corpse of Yamada Asaemon Eizen and breaks down into tears. Feeling to distraught over the death of his master, Shugen uses his time to lay Eizen's soul to rest with a prayer before agreeing to continue on with the mission. While praying, the group fights off a horde of Monshin commanded by a Dōshi to attack them.

Shugen angry
Shugen declares vengeance upon everything living on the island.
After finishing with his prayer, Shugen cuts the leg off a Monshin that attempted to attack him from behind and uses its shakujō to chip away continuously at his blade. He then declares in anger that he will exact his revenge by killing every living thing on the island. Shugen manages to quickly defeat the Dōshi commanding the Monshin and attempts to extract information from him about the island by carving away at his head until he answers all his questions. Jikka tries to reason with him by saying that they should return home, however, Shugen angrily scolds Jikka, saying that under no circumstances are they allowed to return to the mainland. After being calmed down by Isuzu, Shugen apologizes to Jikka but demands that the Dōshi provide him with information he needed. One of the ninja then comes up to Shugen suggesting that the ninja handle this matter since they specialize in interrogation and torture.

Hōrai Arc

Main article: Hōrai Arc
The Treasure Barge departs
Shugen commanding the Monshin to transport him and the Asaemon to Hōrai.
While traveling to Hōrai, Shugen becomes furious after the ninja reveals to him evidence of Tenza's and Genji's deaths. Shugen then decides to use the Horse Flute used by the Dōshi to call upon the Monshin. Once the Monshin were summoned, Shugen orders them to quickly transport him and the Asaemon to Hōrai.

Upon arriving in Hōrai, the Monshin breach the walls of the palace, allowing Shugen's team to enter. Shugen commands the ninja to confront and eliminate the convicts but spare the Yamada Asaemon. Shugen then charges forward as an army of Dōshi advances to attack the intruders but are all taken down by Shugen who warns the others that the Dōshi's tandens are their weakness.

Gantetsusai and Shugen clash
Shugen clashes with Gantetsusai.
Shortly after, Shugen finds Yamada Asaemon Fuchi and demands an explanation from him as to why his criminal, Tamiya Gantetsusai, hands are untied. He then senses Gantetsusai's "blood lust" and silences him while he hears Fuchi's reason, who explains that the Yamada Asaemon had no other choice but to ally with criminals to survive the dangers of the island. Shugen accepts this excuse and tells Fuchi that he no longer has to cooperate with Gantetsusai since he is here and ask that he execute him before joining his side. Fuchi refuses Shugen's order, saying that the time for crime and punishment will have to come later after they escape the island. After noticing how the missing tsuba on his sword was used as Gantetsusai's eyepatch, Shugen becomes shocked and angry seeing as how Fuchi mistreated his Asaemon soul. Shugen then clashes swords with Gantetsusai after he insults the Yamada clan. Shugen loses his footing but regains it after imitating Kishō and blocks Gantetsusai's next attack. He then begins to tell Gantetsusai about the memories he had with Yamada Asaemon Genji and releases the same strength Genji possessed to push Gantetsusai back. Recalling Gantetsusai's insult earlier, Shugen challenges him and states that he will use the power of all the Yamada Asaemons. Shugen gains the upper hand in his fight with Gantetsusai by using the skills of Genji and Kishō with his swordplay and prepares to deliver the final blow after bringing Gantetsusai to his knees.

Shugen cuts Fuchi
Shugen slashes Fuchi.
However, Fuchi blocks Shugen's attack and tells him that despite Gantetsusai being a criminal he is not "evil" as he makes him out to be and also says that he does not wish to see more people die. Shugen ceases the assault on his blade and sees that Fuchi's caring side for others has not changed since the day they met. However, Shugen forces himself to cut Fuchi, saying that he wields his sword for the sake of the world. Gantetsusai tells Shugen that he is insane for cutting down one of his comrades. Shugen replies that what he did was determination and says that he is prepared to execute him. However, Shugen becomes distracted with the changing of the layout after Zhu Jin's fusion with the Banko. After bringing his attention back to Gantetsusai, Shugen sees that the criminal and Fuchi's bodies are covered in flowers. He then receives notice from a group of shinobi that Rien is preparing to leave the island and is handed the captured Elixir of Life. Before leaving Shugen orders the shinobi to kill Gantetsusai underneath the flower bed if he is still alive while sparing Fuchi if he also alive.

Departure Arc

Main article: Departure Arc
Shugen loses his arm
Shugen loses his arm to Rien.
As he races towards the underground floodgates to halt Rien's escape, Shugen senses something ominous about the Elixir of Life and decides to taste test it for poison before the time came to hand it over to his superiors. He then concluded that it was safe to consume. Later, Shugen manages to arrive on time to the floodgates, gets on board Rien's burning ship, and attacks the Tensen. Shugen strikes at Rien's tanden but finds out that it did not have any effect due to him not possessing Wood Tao and is punctured from the chest by Rien's Tao attack. Luckily, Shugen finds that he was slightly protected by Tenza's metal headband, which he was happy to know, and tries another attempt at attacking Rien using his skill replication of the Yamada Asaemon. After mimicking Shion, Shugen lands an effective strike on Rien, with the Tensen discovering that Shugen is capable of altering his Tao attribute. Shugen then sees the flames rising from the ships after Rien decides to put their full attention on him and unexpectedly has his right arm severed by Rien in their Yin form wielding a feathered fan. He is then quickly defeated by the Tensen and is left onboard unconscious and severely injured.

Shugen reacts to the elixir
Shugen feeling the effects of the Elixir of Life.
Shugen soon wakes up from his unconscious state and sees Gantetsusai standing in front of him who wishes to avenge Fuchi. Shugen manages to block Gantetsusai's sword attack but is unable to fight properly due to his body taking too much damage. However, Shugen refuses to give up due to his pride as a samurai, which causes Gantetsusai to angrily beat him barehanded, stating that it was the same pride that caused him to kill Fuchi. After getting back up and grabbing back his sword from the fire, Shugen cauterizes his right arm to heal his injury and does a few practice swings with his left arm. After managing to quickly adjust to wielding his sword using the knowledge Fuchi gave him in the past about the human body, Shugen lectures Gantetsusai about his duty as a samurai to protect all he holds dear in the Yamada clan and that he has abandoned sentimentality. After stating his conviction, Shugen senses that the Elixir of Life has started to take its effects on his body. He once again fights Gantetsusai but unexpectedly sees him kneel shortly after and hear him explain why he became known as the Blade Dragon. Shugen then becomes shocked to see the burning ship damaged after Gantetsusai unleashes a powerful slash with his sword. This action causes Rien to step outside and confront the two men in anger. With his job of slowing down the ship in time for the survivors to reach it completely, Gantetsusai prepares to leave but tells both Shugen and Rien that someone stronger than him will be on the ship to defeat them, which turns out to be Gabimaru who jumps on board and approach the two individuals.

Gabimaru vs Shugen vs Rien
Shugen battling both Gabimaru and Rien.
After announcing his resolve to fight for both the world and for the Yamada clan, Shugen engages in battle against both Gabimaru and Rien. However, both men soon realize that they are outmatched by Rien's power. Shortly after, Shugen sees Isuzu and Kiyomaru boarding the ship along with the other survivors from the vanguard. While Shugen's wounds is tended by Isuzu and Kiyomaru, the survivors fight against Rien but are caught victim to her Tao illusion. Shugen then becomes one of the few to witness Rien enter her Kishikai. After Sagiri's attack on Rien's tanden failed, Shugen jumps in to move her out of the way of Rien's Tao manipulation and orders Isuzu and Kiyomaru to move the criminals to the other ship since he did not want the monster to take away the Yamada clan's task of executing them. However, Rien unleashes her power upon the humans by dismantling the exterior of the ship, which resulted in the death of Kiyomaru. Shugen then bares witness to Isuzu being killed right in front of him by Rien. Fueled by blind rage, Shugen rushes towards Rien to try and attack while Gabimaru tries to incinerate her but is also caught in the fire as well. Though he was badly injured from Gabimaru's flames, Shugen pushes himself to continue fighting, since he desires to make Isuzu and Kiyomaru proud by carrying out his clan's duty, and orders Sagiri to return to the other ship after noticing how she has lost her resolve to fight due to doubt. Though this was the case, Shugen hears Sagiri boldly speak about how her imperfections are what forms her and senses her Tao reacting as a result.

Shugen slashes Jofuku
Shugen unleashing his final attack to destroy Jofuku's corpse.
After she manages to help in Gabimaru's recovery, Shugen watches as Sagiri and Gabimaru fight alongside each other against Rien and starts to see Sagiri in a new light as she holds her own against the monster. In an attempt to create an opening for Sagiri to destroy Rien's tanden, Gabimaru targets Jofuku's gilded body in order to weaken Rien's Tao after she becomes stricken with anger. However, Gabimaru becomes hesitant after realizing that, like his relationship with Yui, Rien and Jofuku are a married couple. Shugen then comes in to finish the task with complete devotion to his duties and cuts Jofuku's body in half with a powerful Tao-imbued sword slash. As a result of overexerting too much of his Tao, Shugen passes out with the right side of his face crumbled away and dies.


ADVERTISEMENT
Abilities and Powers

Shugen was viewed by his peers as being the strongest Asaemon in the Yamada clan. Being the second ranked Asaemon, Shugen's suitability for becoming the next head of the clan rivalled that of his mentor, Eizen. After arriving on Kotaku, Shugen was capable of single-handedly defeat a group of Sōshin without the use of his sword and easily cut down a Monshin with no signs of worrying. He was also able to defeat a Dōshi, students of Lord Tensen who are well-versed at using Tao than any human. Furthermore, Shugen was able to overwhelm Gantetsusai, a powerfully well-known swordsmen, and almost came close to slaying him. Ultimately, Shugen became one of the few humans in 1,000 years to survive and escape the horrendous ordeals that Kotaku had to offer, such as the monsters and the members of Lord Tensen.
Physical Abilities

Shugen kills a Soshin
Shugen sends a Sōshin's head flying.
Shugen possessed impressive physical strength, being able to break the leg of a large Sōshin and effortlessly lift its arms when it was trying to hold on to him. Combined with his knowledge of anatomy and his ability to sense Tao, Shugen was able to fight barehanded against a group of Sōshin and easily defeat them without a single scratch. Using his copying ability, Shugen could further increase his strength to match that of Yamada Asaemon Genji's, which was capable enough to overpower the likes of Gantetsusai. Shugen had also shown to have great endurance to pain as he kept his composure after his right arm was severed by Rien. His reflexes were also great enough to dodge a Tao attack directed at him by Rien.

Kenjutsu

Further information: Tameshi Ittō-ryū
Shugen beheading the Doshi
Shugen beheading multiple Dōshi.
Shugen was known to have great skill and knowledge in swordsmanship than any other member in the Yamada clan. As an Asaemon, Shugen was capable of decapitating his victims with a single cut of his sword. After chipping away at his blade, Shugen was able to execute cuts modeled after the execution method known as Sawing (鋸のこ引びき, Nokogiribiki), where he would carve away at his opponent if they refused to answer his questions as a means of interrogation. During the raid in Hōrai, Shugen gracefully beheaded every Dōshi while they were riding on horses. By applying his mimicry of every skill of the ranked Yamada Asaemons to his swordsmanship, Shugen was able to best Gantetsusai, an incredibly strong and highly experienced master in swordsmanship, and bring him to his knees. Using his knowledge of the human body imparted to him by Fuchi, Shugen made a remarkable feat of quickly adapting to wielding his sword with his left arm, after his right arm was cut off by Rien, in only a matter of seconds.

Techniques

Tameshi Ittō-ryū: Kabutowari — Genji Bājon (試ためし一いっ刀とう流りゅう　兜かぶと割わり 源げん嗣じ追悼バージョン, Literal meaning: One Sword School Test Cutting: Helmet Splitter — Genji Version): Shugen brings out enough strength in his wrists to equal that of Yamada Asaemon Genji's and applies a huge amount of force to his sword when clashed with another, causing his opponent to fall forward. This is called Ittō-ryū School: Helmsplitter Genji Style in the Viz Manga.
Tameshi Ittō-ryū: Mura Shigure — Kishō Bājon (試ためし一いっ刀とう流りゅう　村むら時雨しぐれ 期き聖しょう追悼バージョン, Literal meaning: One Sword School Test Cutting: Autumn Shower — Kishō Version): Shugen uses the Tameshi Ittō-ryū: Mura Shigure combined with a calm mentality equaling that of Yamada Asaemon Kishō's to overwhelm his opponent. This is called Ittō-ryū School: Harvest Shower Kisho Style in the Viz Manga.
Tameshi Ittō-ryū: Kabutōchi — Genji Bājon (試ためし一いっ刀とう流りゅう　兜かぶと落うち 源げん嗣じ追悼バージョン, Literal meaning: One Sword School Test Cutting: Helmet Drop — Genji Version): Shugen brings out enough strength in his wrists to equal that of Yamada Asaemon Genji's and applies force to a single swing of his sword. This is called Ittō-ryū School: Helm Divest Genji Style in the Viz Manga.
Tameshi Ittō-ryū Gaiden: Shunjin no Tsuki — Senta Bājon (試ためし一いっ刀とう流りゅう　外がい伝でん 俊しゅん迅じんの突つき 仙せん汰た追悼バージョン, Literal meaning: One Sword School Test Cutting Gaiden: Excellent Swift Thrust — Senta Version): Shugen uses Senta's style of swordsmanship to rapidly pierce his opponent from a distance while adding more force behind his blade. This is called Ittō-ryū School Gaiden: Swift Thrust — Senta Style in the Viz Manga.
Tao

Further information: Tao
Shugen possessed Water-attribute Tao and was capable of using it. With its use, Shugen could sense the presence of others, the movements and weak spots of his opponents, and enhance his physical attacks, which included imbuing his sword.

Skill Replication and Attribute Alteration

Shugen copying Genji and Kisho
Shugen fighting as both Genji and Kishō against Gantetsusai.
Having spent his time carefully analyzing the ranked Yamada Asaemons personalities, strengths, and weaknesses, Shugen became able to copy their unique abilities as if his opponent was actually fighting the ranked Asaemon he chose to emulate. Fuchi characterizes this ability as being akin to possession where it seems as though Shugen is being taken over by the Yamada Asaemon he chooses to fight as. After Shugen chose to fight as Genji, Gantetsusai had a look of confusion as if he was clashing swords with someone else. By switching in and out of each skill he uses, Shugen's opponents became overwhelmed as if they were actually fighting more than one Yamada Asaemon. In addition, not only could Shugen use their talents to their fullest, but he could also compensate for any weaknesses they may have by applying his own skill.

As confirmed by Rien, Shugen's clear grasp of his clansmen strengths and weaknesses did not just merely allow him to copy their abilities but also inexplicably allowed him to transform his Tao attribute to match theirs exactly, thereby making him suitable to fight against Flower Tao users other than those who had Fire Tao. Even a Tao master such as Rien never thought such an ability could be possible.

Yamada Asaemons

Yamada Asaemon Genji (山やま田だ浅あさェえ門もん源げん嗣じ): Shugen was able to replicate Yamada Asaemon Genji's monstrous wrist strength in his swordsmanship. In his fight against Gantetsusai, Shugen was able to beat him in a feat of strength when they clashed swords, causing him to be pushed back a good distance and fall down from the weight. By adding fluidity with this ability, Shugen improved upon Genji's swordplay. Gantetsusai had also taken note that the pure raw power prevented him from counterattacking even if Shugen was left with plenty of openings.
Yamada Asaemon Kishō (山やま田だ浅あさェえ門もん期き聖しょう): Shugen was able to replicate Yamada Asaemon Kishō's calm mentality to foresee incoming attacks as if he had saw a moment into the future, allowing him to avoid them and deliver a counterattack. Due to his attribute alteration ability, it was also possibly for Shugen to replicate Kishō's Earth-attribute Tao.
Yamada Asaemon Senta (山やま田だ浅あさェえ門もん仙せん汰た): Shugen was able to replicate Yamada Asaemon Senta's swordsmanship where he extended his arm to perform thrusting and cutting attacks. Shugen used this ability to fight at mid-range from the monsters created by the Zhu Jin-fused Banko to avoid being turned into flowers. By adding twisting force behind his attacks to make them more destructive, Shugen improved upon Senta's swordplay.
Yamada Asaemon Tenza (山やま田だ浅あさェえ門もん典てん坐ざ): Shugen was able to replicate Yamada Asaemon Tenza's fast swordsmanship. Due to his attribute alteration ability, it was also possibly for Shugen to replicate Tenza's Fire-attribute Tao.
Yamada Asaemon Shion (山やま田だ浅あさェえ門もん士し遠おん): Shugen was able to replicate Yamada Asaemon Shion's swordsmanship, as well as his Wood-attribute Tao.
Yamada Asaemon Fuchi (山やま田だ浅あさェえ門もん付ふ知ち): Shugen was able to replicate Yamada Asaemon Fuchi's agile movements. Due to his attribute alteration ability, it was also possibly for Shugen to replicate Fuchi's Metal-attribute Tao.
Flower Tao

After test tasting the Elixir of Life for poison, Shugen acquired the healing abilities of Flower Tao. However, due to only consuming, and spitting out, a small sample of the elixir, Shugen's healing factor was much weaker than most Flower Tao users since his wounds took longer to heal themselves, rather than instantaneously, and could not regenerate any lost limbs. The effects also did not automatically activate until later on. Upon awakening the power, Shugen's cauterized right arm healed itself without him being aware. His resistance to pain had been heighten, as he was able to continue fighting Rien even after his body was heavily scarred by Gabimaru's fire ninjutsu.

Intelligence

Shugen possessed knowledge taught to him by a few of his fellow clansmen, such as Fuchi's understanding of anatomy and the workings behind Tao from Shion. These two studies combined allowed Shugen to easily defeat his opponents in a fight even without the use of his sword.


ADVERTISEMENT
Weapons

Fuributsu Kaneki
Shugen's sword: Fuributsu Kaneki.
Having impressed the shogun, Shugen was given the named blade, Fuributsu Kaneki. After arriving in Kotaku, Shugen acquired the Horse Flute that was previously owned by a Dōshi he defeated. He later used it to call out the Monshin from their nest to have them carry him and the Asaemon to Hōrai.

I was fed up with it all. I fled. I turned my gaze. I told myself I was powerless and that there was no use in fighting back. Because once again, I was fed up with my own weakness for having fled and fled.
MEI (CHAPTER 114)

Mei (メイ) is a Tensen-class Sennin who was formerly affiliated with Lord Tensen, having been banished by Rien for acting defiant. After being found by Hōko, Mei went into hiding and chose to live out her remaining time on Kotaku being raised by him as his daughter. Several years later, she becomes a close ally of Gabimaru, Sagiri, and the other surviving humans in their attempt to retrieve the elixir known as Tan from Lord Tensen and escape the island. She is a major supporting character of Hell's Paradise: Jigokuraku.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


1/2




Mei is a child with pink eyes and long hair that she wears in two braided Chinese-style buns at the back of her head. As for attire, she wears a red, long sleeve robe, a skirt, and walks around barefoot.

Initially, during her time spent in Lord Tensen, Mei was a full-grown woman and wore a lavender robe. However, after defying Rien, she received a scar-like mark that ran down across her back and had her body reduced to that of a child's. After her first use of Tao, Mei's face and body started to mature and grew about the same height as Fuchi. Her body eventually grew back to what it original was after releasing her Tao for the second time to save Gabimaru. After honoring Hōko's wish by extracting his remaining Tao to rejuvenate herself, Mei reverted back to her former child body.

In her Kishikai state, Mei resembles a gigantic moth with many pistil-shaped tentacles on her thorax and five large petal-like wings, shaped exactly like plum blossoms.

After several years passed since the Edo Period, Mei is revived back to her former child body and is shown wearing similar clothes as she did in the past.
Gallery

Mei's manga design.
Mei's manga design.

A close up of Mei's face in her Kishikai.

ADVERTISEMENT
Personality

Mei is a shy, quiet, and innocent girl who becomes easily frightened when harm comes to her. She is especially kind and caring to the people around her that she views as her allies and is also accepting of others when seeing their good qualities. When they first met, Mei was afraid of Gabimaru because of his intimidating demeanor but, after showing signs of respect towards her, she wasn't afraid to come near him. Mei also has a sense of knowing what's right from wrong, believing that Rien's cruel research on the Hōko needed to be stopped. Unlike the Tensens, Mei does not have a low opinion on humans, or have any reason to look down on them, and was willing to help the survivors who came to the island in any way she could.
Relationships

Family

Rien

Tensens

Hōko

Vanguard Party

Gabimaru

Gabimaru initially had gotten off to a bad start with Mei after committing actions that caused her to become scared of him, such as pursuing, restraining and threatening her into giving out information about the Elixir of Life and pointing a sword at her to see if she had regeneration powers like Hōko. It was only after Gabimaru showed her respect while the two were taking a bath that Mei saw him as a good person and felt comfortable being near him. Later, after Gabimaru decided to travel to Hōrai by himself, Mei followed him and saved Gabimaru from being killed by Zhu Jin. Though he was not obligated to look after her, Gabimaru became attached to Mei, as he wanted to protect her from the Dōshi and felt that it was only right that he repay her for saving his life from Zhu Jin. Mei in turn also felt connected to Gabimaru. She was concerned about Gabimaru's mental state after sensing that his Tao was not fully restored from his first usage of Tao. After Gabimaru was prepared to risk his life to defeat Chōbei, Mei cried out to him to stop and rushed in to put an end to his fight by using her Tao, knowing full well that it would speed up the process of her Arborification. When the time came for survivors to raid Hōrai, Mei was most concerned about Gabimaru since she was aware of his backup plan that involved him losing his humanity and rushed to his side after his Tao had been negatively influenced by Zhu Jin. Ultimately, in her last moments, Mei chose to happily say her goodbyes to both Gabimaru and Sagiri in a Tao illusion and tells Gabimaru that during their time together she has come to see him as a source of courage.

Yamada Asaemon Sagiri

Tamiya Gantetsusai


ADVERTISEMENT
History

Past

Mei's banishment
Mei being punished by Rien.
1,000 years ago on Kotaku, Mei was the first Tensen created from the Tao of a single Tao puppet created by Rien but was born to believe that her creator was Rien's husband, Jofuku. She then served as Jofuku's disciple and obeyed all practices of Tao as part of his research in discovering immortality. She also helped to nurture six young Tensens while they trained in the ways of Tao. As time went by, Mei started to develop feelings of disapproval for all that had been going on around her, and upon discovering that Rien had been sacrificing many of the Hōko's lives after favoring the Outer Way of Tan, Mei tried to stop her from going any further. This however led to her being punished by Rien by having her plant ovule broken, her body reduced to a child's, and being sentenced to engage in Bōchū Jutsu with the Dōshi. She eventually managed to escape from Hōrai and was found by Hōko. Mei then went on to being raised by him and lived happily in the abandoned Hōko village, while also choosing to not concern herself with the activities of Lord Tensen.

Edo Period

Lord Tensen Arc

Main article: Lord Tensen Arc
Gabimaru restrains Mei
Mei captured by Gabimaru.
Mei spots Gabimaru, Sagiri, Yuzuriha and Senta gazing at the village. Gabimaru senses her presence and goes after her. After being captured by him she cries from his frightening behavior. Sagiri calms her down and takes her back to the group with Hōko taken down. Hōko then persuades them into coming to the village.

While Sagiri and Yuzuriha are taking a bath, Mei supplies them with towels and leaves. She then joins the group discussing about the elixir, the island, and Lord Tensen. Hōko shows them that the elixir exists by separating its hand and regenerating it. Gabimaru looks towards Mei with his sword and asked if she is also blessed with this ability, resulting in her becoming scarred. She then goes to take a bath but is walked in by Gabimaru and Sagiri and screams in panic. Sagiri provides the two with a proper bath and offers to clean Mei. After noticing Mei's marking on her back, Gabimaru advised her that appearance do not matter and that she should not try to hide her marking. Mei notices Gabimaru's respectful behavior and finds it safe to come near him. The two then return to the lodging and rest for the night.

Mei saving Gabimaru
Mei saves Gabimaru from Zhu Jin.
Right after Gabimaru left for Hōrai and was on the verge of death from battling Zhu Jin, Mei appears besides him and helps him escape by creating a crater leading down a cliff. While asleep, the two are found by Tamiya Gantetsusai and Yamada Asaemon Fuchi. She later wakes up slightly grown which surprises Gabimaru. After speaking for the first time to Gabimaru, he quickly asked her if she knew anything about the elixir and her strange power. Mei says that her power is called Tao but confuses them with her odd explanation. The group are then approached by the Sōshin. Wanting to know how to use Tao, Gantetsusai carries Mei on his shoulder and asked her to teach him how to master it while fighting the Sōshin.

Gabimaru comes to Mei's side
Gabimaru comes to Mei's side.
Gantetsusai ask Mei for reports on his progress of awakening Tao as he kills the Sōshin. Mei says no because he was using too much of his strength. Gantetsusai then pointed to Gabimaru but Mei says that he is also using too much of his strength. After looking at her with a scary expression she starts to cry much to Gabimaru's disappointment. Mei is then captured by a Dōshi who is pleased with meeting her and addresses her in a polite manner. The Dōshi explains to them that Mei is similar to Lord Tensen and ask her to return to Hōrai for guidance. She then looks towards Gabimaru with tears in her eyes and instantly appears by her side. He explains that even though she was none of his concern he still wanted to protect her.

Gabimaru asks the Dōshi why they wanted Mei. The Dōshi explains that she is a part of their training in Bōchū Jutsu where they preform sexual congress and join their Yang with her Yin, which causes her to become frighten. She continues to tremble as he explains to them her past of being banished from the palace, being scarred by Rien and given the option of dying or being part of the Dōshi's training. Hearing enough of what they had to say, Gabimaru and Gantetsusai stand behind Mei to defend her from the transformed Dōshi's.

Mei helping Gabimaru sense Tao
Mei helps Gabimaru awaken his Tao.
After Fuchi interpreted Mei's words about Tao, Mei helps Gabimaru try to sense his Tao by touching his hand. Gabimaru finds it hard to believe that by accepting his weakness he will be able to learn Tao. However, after Mei states that strength derives from weakness, Gabimaru manages to understand and awakens his Tao. After he steps forward to confront the Dōshi's once again, Mei comments on how Gabimaru possess a huge amount of Tao. She then watches as Gabimaru dodges the Dōshi's invisible attacks. Gantetsusai states that Gabimaru was able to understand Tao quickly because of his ninja training, but Mei shakes her head in disagreement. The three are then shocked to see Gabimaru dispel the Dōshi's transformation.

After Gabimaru and Gantetsusai finish off the Dōshi, Fuchi suggests asking Mei for guidance but Gantetsusai thinks that it would be best for her to return home. Gabimaru tells Mei that he was still indebted to her and was willing to go along with whatever she wanted to do. Before she had a chance to make up her mind, she is shocked to see Gabimaru bleeding from his nose and faints. They then travel halfway up the valley and settle in a cave. After Gabimaru awakens, Mei provides information about what she knows about Tao and has Fuchi interpret her words. The group then decides to get some rest for tomorrow. Mei comes out to see Gabimaru and asked if he was okay. He answers that he was okay, however, Mei becomes frighten when she sees that a part of Gabimaru's Tao is missing.

The next day, the group travels up the valley to reach Hōrai. Upon making it to the top, they encounter Aza Chōbei and Aza Tōma. After Chōbei attacks Gabimaru, he counter attacks by snapping Chobe's neck, but after surviving and throwing Gabimaru to the ground, Mei warns Gabimaru that Chōbei had a large amount of Tao.

Mei creates a crater
Mei puts an end to Gabimaru's fight with Chōbei.
While fighting Chōbei, the three notices that Gabimaru is acting unusual. Mei explains that Gabimaru's Tao is acting strange and has lost the thing that made him strong. While fighting Gantetsusai, Tōma orders the enslaved Dōshi to attack her and Fuchi, however, Fuchi draws out his swords to guard Mei. She then watches as Gabimaru fights a transformed Chōbei while in critical condition. After Gabimaru sees an opponent to attack, Mei runs to stop him before he attempts to use up his remaining life. Mei ends the fight by releasing her Tao to create a massive crater. Gabimaru and Tōma remain save on the edge while Chōbei falls down the valley. Mei's body then matures further.

She is then given Gantetsusai's robe for coverage and travels with the group to the front gate of Hōrai where they meet Sagiri, Yuzuriha, Yamada Asaemon Shion and Nurugai. Seeing Mei's state, Hōko asked if she used her power which she answers yes. He then expresses his gratitude that the group kept Mei safe. She is then comforted by Sagiri after seeing the state she is in. After realizing that Gabimaru has loss his memories after shortly waking up, Sagiri pins him down to have him cooperate and restore his Tao. Gantetsusai thinks that they are performing Bōchū Jutsu but Mei blushes saying that it was different yet similar.

The group then relocates to a cave to escape from Lord Tensen's sensory field. Mei body becomes ill and Sagiri asks Fuchi to help make a medicine for her. Fuchi agrees but demands that Mei tells him everything they need to know. Mei relays the information to Fuchi, translating that a Hōshi came to the island in search of ways to achieve immortality, resulting in the creation of the monsters and Lord Tensen who have been practicing the inner and outer way of Tao for 1,000 years. After Yuzuriha hears that a prototype elixir known as Tan has been created by Lord Tensen, she asks why they were going so far in their research. Mei answers that it is possible that they are following the will of Jofuku, the Hōshi that created Lord Tensen.

Mei absorbs Hoko
Mei absorbs Hōko's Tao.
Mei's conditions worsens and the three see that her arm starts to transform into a tree. Mei explains that her usage of Tao is causing her to turn into a tree and has little Tao due to having a broken tanden caused by Rien. Hōko offers Mei his Tao to recover but can't bring herself to use him as a sacrifice. Hōko insists, explaining that he hopes she forgives him for not fulfilling her desire to leave the island after seeing her as his late daughter. Mei breaks out into tears honoring his final wish and tells him that she sees him as father. After extracting his Tao, Mei reverts back into a child and says goodbye to Hōko.

The vanguard party join forces
Mei joins the survivors to help them complete their mission and escape the island.
The four then gather back to the group. Mei returns Gantetsusai's robe and sees that he is disappointed that her body has shrunken back to her child body. She then senses strong Tao that has just landed on the island coming from either a person or a group of people. Shion and Fuchi believe that it is Shugen and the other Asaemon who were sent as reinforcements, along with another group of criminals. While Sagiri tells everyone that Shugen will be helpful in assisting them, Shion informs them that Shugen despises criminals and gives proof by revealing the story of Shugen executing the Silver Serpent yakuza group and their families. The group moves on by listening to Shion's plan of splitting everyone into two teams for finding Tan and an escape route off the island. They also listen to his strategy of using their Tao attributes to hinder and defeat Lord Tensen. After hearing Yuzuriha's suggestion of abandoning the goal of the mission and leave the island in hiding, Shion gives everyone the option of following their own objective or working together in completing the mission. Unanimously, everyone follows Shion and chooses to cooperate in finding the elixir and escape the island together.

Hōrai Arc

Main article: Hōrai Arc
Gabimaru promises Mei
Gabimaru promises Mei to have her see Rien and Jofuku for the last time.
Mei provides the group with information regarding the sea monsters guarding the island and the ships located deep within Hōrai as a way to escape the island. She also tells them that the elixir is located in Rien's, and her previous, laboratory. The group then sits through lessons instructed by Gabimaru and Yuzuriha on how to use Tao. Once they were done, Mei assists Gantetsusai after becoming exhausted from the lessons by massaging his shoulders. She is then assigned to the Escape Route Securing Team. Gantetsusai suggests that they send her departing without having her wait for the Elixir Team. However, Gabimaru asks Mei if there was anything she wanted to do before leaving the island. Mei confesses that she wishes to live a normal life off the island but to also reunite with Jofuku and Rien to know why they underwent a major change in the past. Gabimaru honors Mei's request and promises to have her see the two again.

During the making of their strategy in infiltrating the palace, Mei tells them about the layout of the palace building and the palaces each Tensen reside in. After finish strategizing, the group decides to make their move tonight. Mei then takes the time to explain to Gabimaru and Tōma how Chōbei managed to fuse with the Flower Tao of the Waitanhua flower. They then walk back to Mu Dan's corpse where Gabimaru takes one of his plant stingers, using the fusion of Flower Tao as his backup plan. Mei is against this idea since it is a dangerous risk and certain conditions must be met in order for someone to obtain the powers of Flower Tao. However, Gabimaru is aware of how Chōbei took control and knows what he has to do in order to do the same.

Elixir Team meets Ran
The Elixir Retrieval Team encounters Ran.
Mei joins the Elixir Retrieval Team and infiltrates the palace. The teams signals the Escape Route Securing Team that it was safe to enter and then senses the layout of the palace, which causes Mei and Sagiri to become disturbed by the corpses they sense in Rien's laboratory. They then enter successfully into the building but are met by Ran who knew that Mei would be the one to guide them.

Ran tries to have Mei return to Lord Tensen's side, revealing that the Elixir of Life has finally been completed. Mei explains that she is different from the rest of them and came to say goodbye before leaving the island. Despite his disappointment, Ran says that the Rite of Just Consumption will have to continue, which is to capture the humans and offer them as sacrifices to the grandmaster. Seeing as how their plan to avoid Lord Tensen has failed, the group moves on to their second plan of fighting against them. Gabimaru tells Sagiri and Mei to find the elixir, however, Mei warns Gabimaru that they are not in the Rentan Palace. Ran reveals that he has rearranged the layout of the palace before they arrived. He then traps Mei by controlling the Tao on the ground. While Gabimaru and Yuzuriha fight Ran, Sagiri frees Mei from her bindings and the two proceed to head to the Rentan Palace.

While heading to the Rentan Palace, Mei and Sagiri hear loud noises coming from the Dō'in Palace. Sagiri assures Mei that Gabimaru will be okay since he has a backup plan, causing her to worry since she knows what it entails. Sagiri becomes shocked and horrified after Mei explains what Gabimaru plans to do but knows that they must move forward after arriving at the Rentan Palace.

Rentan Palace encounter
Mei and Sagiri encounters Gui Fa in the Rentan Palace.
Mei and Sagiri enter the palace but see that Gui Fa is in the room instead of Rien. The Tensen then says that they will stop them if they take a step forward from their spot but is told by Sagiri that she does not wish to fight and would like to apologize to Gui Fa on behave of the humans that have trespassed on their island and asks if her group would be allowed to return home safely. Gui Fa says that they will honor her request but warns her that it would be pointless to return to Japan by revealing Rien's plan to turn every human into Waitanhua flowers and form the giant Banko to create more perfected Tan. Sagiri asks Gui Fa why would they go to such lengths, to which Gui Fa explains that the Tensens only see humans as material to create more Tan. Mei disagreed, saying that Jofuku tried to help humanity with his research and that using human lives was wrong. However, Gui Fa explains that their plans have changed ever since humans first came to the island in the past.

After the ritual circle reveals that all the Tensens were defeated, Gui Fa prepares to report back to Rien with no intentions on avenging their comrades. However, before leaving, Gui Fa asks Mei why she chose to come back to Hōrai. Mei answers that she finally understood what life meant after remembering her time with Hōko. The three then feel the palace starting to tremble from the Monshin breaching the walls outside, allowing the second landing party to enter the palace. Mei and Sagiri come under attack by both the Iwagakure shinobi and the Dōshi but are saved by Yuzuriha, who they become happy to see again. After being aware that Iwagakure shinobi and the Dōshi have raided the palace, Mei is asked by Sagiri if she was willing to accompany them to confront Rien. However, before she could answer, Yamada Asaemon Isuzu appears with the intention of eliminating Yuzuriha, as ordered by Shugen to take down the convicts, but is hindered by Sagiri.

Mei being effected by Zhu Jin
Mei under the influence of the Zhu Jin-fused Banko.
After Zhu Jin fuses with the Banko, Mei's starts to witness her body changing due to her Tao going into disarray from Zhu Jin's influence and worries for her situation. After the remaining surviving humans gather together, Mei explains to everyone that morning is when the Banko will bloom and the Arborification will take effects on those who breath in the Tan particles in the air. The survivors then decide that their best option is to work together to destroy the Banko and scattered to their designated tandens; with Mei being in charge of locating the tandens for the group while staying by Yuzuriha's side to give out the signal to perform a coordinated attack on the tandens.

Departure Arc

Main article: Departure Arc
Mei shocked
Mei shocked after learning the truth about Jofuku.
After the group manages to destroy the Zhu Jin-fused Banko, Mei and Yuzuriha run outside the palace and encounter Gui Fa, as a child, holding the Basin. Gui Fa then tells them the secrets they found in the Rentan Palace, revealing that the Rien they know is actually one of the many puppets created by Rien, the wife of Jofuku who plans to depart to Japan and turn every citizen into Tan in order to revive her husband Jofuku, which will happen within two hours, shocking both Mei and Yuzuriha. Not knowing what they should do after this revelation, Gui Fa asks Mei for her suggestion. Before she could answer, Yuzuriha tells Mei in panic that they need to make haste off the island. Before leaving, Gui Fa warns them that if they choose to go after Rien then only two men and one female will survive based on the I Ching ritual they found in the palace.

Mei helps the survivors escape
Mei clears a path for the survivors to sail off.
The survivors gather at the entrance to the floodgates and enter. The group sadly sees that all the ships have been destroyed with the exception of one but is unable to set sail due to the wreckage blocking the water from flowing. As Gabimaru, Sagiri, and Nurugai make a desperate attempt at removing the wreckage, Mei, despite knowing the risk of her life ending, makes the decision to enter her Kishikai to clear a path for the others. Using her large petal wings, Mei blows away the debris and gives everyone the opportunity to head towards the ship. Gabimaru yells out to Mei and reminds her that if she stays in her Kishikai she will die and not have a chance to live a normal life. After hearing him, Mei creates an illusion of herself and hugs Sagiri and Gabimaru, telling them both that this was the only way she could take responsibility and face her fate and thanks them for all they have done for her. She then ends the illusion and have Gabimaru and Sagiri transported on to the ship. After the ship leaves, Mei's crumbling soul apologizes to the people that helped her for not being able to flee with them, to Hōko, to the Tensens, and to Rien for not realizing how sadden they were when they banished her and for not being able to stop them.

At some unknown point in time before leaving the island, Gui Fa had managed to acquire either a replica or the original plant ovule of Mei's and had it cultivated within the Basin to allow her to be revived along with the other Tensens.

New Era

After several centuries had passed (presumably during the Reiwa Era), Mei becomes fully resurrected after finishing her cultivation period within the Basin and is currently living amongst the humans with Gui Fa, who has become an online teacher. After checking in on the deceased Tensens' plant ovules, Mei informs Gui Fa that Ju Fa and Tao Fa are starting to develop earlier and walks along with them to go and revisit.


ADVERTISEMENT
Abilities and Powers

Tao

Further information: Tao
Mei possesses Water-attribute Tao and has knowledge of its principles. Despite her small body, she has been shown capable of using it to enhance her physical strength and cause harm to her targets. Mei is also able to release a large amount of her Tao to create craters. However, after her tanden was broken, Mei's Tao usage was limited as any large quantity she lost would cause her to mature until she reached her original body and slowly Arborify. This side effect could only be reversed if she absorbed another beings Tao to rejuvenate herself, similar to the consumption of Tan. During her final moments, Mei was also shown capable of creating Tao illusions.

Regeneration

As a Tensen, Mei possesses the regeneration abilities of Flower Tao. Since she possesses Water Tao, Mei's regeneration can only be weakened if she were to be attacked by a Tao user who possesses the Earth-attribute, and the only known way of killing her was if the said Earth Tao user completely destroys her plant ovule within her tanden.

Kishikai Transformation

Mei's Kishikai
Mei's Kishikai Transformation.
As a Tensen, Mei is able to enter into a Kishikai state, which takes the form of a giant moth with five large petal-like wings. Using her wings, Mei is capable of flight and can release a large gust of wind to blow away anything in her path by flapping them.

This is a lesson you immortals will soon learn. The fleeting nature of a mortal life. That weight. That terror.
SHION (CHAPTER 42)

Shion (士遠), previously known as Yamada Asaemon Shion (山田やま浅だあェえも門ん 士遠), is the former 4th rank Asaemon of the Yamada clan. He is a major supporting character of Hell's Paradise: Jigokuraku.

After the shogun called for death row convicts to acquire the Elixir of Life from the dangerous island believed to be Shinsenkyō, in exchange for a pardon for their past crimes, Shion joined in the expedition team as one of the Yamada Asaemon monitors and was assigned to keep watch over the criminal Akaginu.

Appearance

Shion is a blind man with short, spiky silver hair in a faux hawk cut. He has three long, distinctive scars crossing his face; two vertical running from forehead to cheek crossing the center of each eye, and one horizontal across the top of his nose through each eye. He wears the standard attire of the Asaemon, however, he does not carry the bell around his collar. After his confrontation with Zhu Jin, Shion wears a bandage around his neck to keep the wound he received from opening.

After briefly settling in Hōrai, Shion changed from his Asaemon attire to a light blue robe with a pattern running down the collar and cuffs and wears matching pants. He then switches to wearing a black Iwagakure shinobi robe, along with matches pants, gaiters, gauntlets, sandals, and wears white tasuki to hold his sleeves.

A year later, Shion removes the bandages around his neck and allows the throat scar he received from Zhu Jin to be visible. He is seen traveling in a simple robe.
Gallery

Shion's manga design.
Shion's manga design.
