lorebooks.creator: Cflame06

1.content:
Rider Name: Ryuki

Motif: Chinese Dragon, medieval knight

Primary Colour: Red

Visor: The Dragvisor (ドラグバイザー, Doragu Baizā), originally called the Ridevisor (ライドバイザー, Raido Baizā) until entering the contract with Dragreder, is Kamen Rider Ryuki's Visor. It is a gauntlet in the shape in Dragreder's head. 

To activate an Advent card with the Dragvisor, push the forehead piece downwards, then place the card in the card reader and pull the forehead piece back up.

When using the Survive Rekka Advent Card, it detaches from the arm and becomes the Dragvisorzwei (ドラグバイザーツバイ, Doragu Baizā Tsubai), which bares resemblance to Dragranzer's head. This iteration of the Dragvisor can be used as a short sword for the Burningsaber attack or a firearm for the Meteorbullet attack alongside Dragranzer when using Sword Vent and Shoot Vent respectively.

To activate an Advent card with the Dragvisorzwei, pull the back lever, opening up a glass slot, then place the card back in the card reader and push the back lever back in.

Contract Mirror Monster: Dragreder

Advent Deck: Black with silver patterns on the four sides of the front and a golden dragon head emblem. The base colour changes to red in Survive.

---

Ryuki Default Form:

Ryuki achieves their default form upon forming a contract with Dragreder. They are now equipped with the Dragvisor on their left arm and possess a variety of Advent Cards. In comparison to the other Riders, their parameters are balanced.

Ryuki doesn't have a card with a special effect, but the existing cards have a good balance between perspective, offence and defence, have high overall physical strength, and boasts the highest combat specs among all Riders. Ryuki can handle both close and long-distance combat, but is mainly good at close combat.


Ryuki Suit Design:

DragCrown (ドラグクラウン, Doragukuraun): The dragon emblem on the head as a proof of contracting with Dragreder, which emerged in order to maximize their power.

R Signal (R シグナル, Ā Shigunaru): A lamp-shaped radar sensor on the head (combined with DragCrown). Reliably detect the position and existence of the enemy.

Solid Face Shield (ソリッドフェイスシールド, Soriddo Feisu Shīrudo): A face protector made of special material Armetal (アーメタル, Āmetaru). It has a hardness that can withstand any impact, absorbs the impact almost completely, and protects the wearer inside. It also plays the role of a purification device that neutralizes dangerous substances in the air such as poisonous gas. Ryuki’s has a dragon mustache-like decoration at the top connected to DragCrown.

Red Eye (レッドアイ, Reddo Ai): A red compound eyes behind the Solid Face Shield with visual acuity that will not miss any objects 15 km away. In the dark, it demonstrates infrared night vision and can fight in the same way as in bright places.

Granmail (グランメイル, Guranmeiru): A special strengthened skin that keeps many monsters away. It maximizes human ability in the Mirror World and allows the wearer to fight as a Kamen Rider, but there is a limit of 9 minutes 55 seconds, and if the wearer exceed the limit, the transformation will be forcibly released. The wearer should exit Mirror World immediately when the time limit has reached. Ryuki’s Granmail is red.

Force Bone (フォース・ボーン, Fōsu Bōn): A three-line control organ that is located in the center of the body, on both arms, and the back of legs, and has the role of distributing the power throughout the body in a well-balanced manner. By the action of this organ, the surplus energy is released to the outside, and only the appropriate energy is preserved.

Dragon Chest (ドラゴンチェスト, Doragon Chesuto): A chest armor. Has a functions as a shield that repels most attacks and shocks due to the triple structure. It is the strongest part of the Ryuki's body and can withstand drops from ultra-high altitudes and water pressure of 10,000 m in the deep sea.

Zippetto Thread (ジペット・スレッド, Jipetto Sureddo): A remote control device points that transmits the Rider's will directly from the brain to the Contract Monster. It is equipped in a total of 10 places on the arms (the left side behind Dragvisor), shoulder armors, back, waist (V-Buckle), and knees.

Black Armor (ブラックアーマー, Burakku Āmā): A protective equipment made of Armetal mounted on the Granmail (arm and leg). Made of a strong material comparable to diamond, it is extremely sturdy.

DragKnuckle (ドラグナックル, Doragunakkuru): A panel made of Armetal that covers the back of the hand. When this material hits the enemy, the power of the punch that Ryuki delivers is maximized.

LegBlack (レッグブラック, Regguburakku): The black part of the shoes. It has both instantaneous destructive power and strength to withstand the impact of destruction. Therefore, even if the deadly Dragon Rider Kick is executed, Ryuki is remain unharmed. The sole has a decoration of Ryuki’s crest.

---

Ryuki's Default Advent Cards:

Advent: Summons Dragreder - 5000 AP

Sword Vent: Summons Dragsaber from Dragreder's tail - 2000 AP

Strike Vent: Summons a gauntlet called the Dragclaw, which resembles Dragreder's head. It can also be used to command Dragreder to shoot a fireball or flamethrower attack - 2000 AP

Guard Vent: Summons two shields called the Dragshield, which resembles Dragreder's chest and upper legs - 2000 GP

Final Vent: Ryuki's finisher. Ryuki jumps high into the air and gets propelled by Dragreder's fire to perform a flaming side-kick - 6000 AP

---

Ryuki Survive:

Contract Mirror Beast: Dragranzer (Survive evolution of the Dragreder)

Kamen Rider Ryuki Survive (仮面ライダー龍騎サバイブ, Kamen Raidā Ryūki Sabaibu) is Ryuki's final form, assumed by using the Survive Rekka Advent Card. The Survive Rekka card transforms the Dragvisor into the the Dragvisorzwei, which Ryuki uses to transform into Survive Form and read Advent Cards. Transforming into Survive form also causes Dragreder to transform into Dragranzer. Survive Form enhances all of Ryuki's stats, allowing him to surpass all other Riders, with the exception of those who are also using a Survive Advent Card, such as Knight Survive and Odin.

Ryuki Survive Suit Design:

DragCrown (ドラグクラウン, Doragukuraun): The dragon emblem on the head as a proof of contracting with Dragreder (evolved into Dragranzer), which emerged in order to maximize their power. The colour changed to gold.

R Signal (R シグナル, Ā Shigunaru): A lamp-shaped radar sensor on the head (combined with DragCrown). Reliably detect the presence and position of the Mirror Monsters.

Solid Face Shield (ソリッドフェイスシールド, Soriddo Feisu Shīrudo): A face protector made of special material Armetal (アーメタル, Āmetaru). It has a hardness that can withstand any impact, absorbs the impact almost completely, and protects the wearer inside. It also plays the role of a purification device that neutralizes dangerous substances in the air such as poisonous gas. The top line is now gold.

DragFeeler (ドラグフィーラー, Doragufīrā): The two super-sensory organs (antenna) on the forehead. It allows Ryuki to communicate with Dragranzer over long distances.

Red Eye (レッドアイ, Reddo Ai): A red compound eyes behind the Solid Face Shield. Ryuki’s eyesight has also been enhanced, and he can now see objects up to 20 km away. In the dark, it demonstrates infrared night vision and can fight in the same way as in bright places. The eyes position is now slightly to the center of the mask.

Granmail (グランメイル, Guranmeiru): A special strengthened skin that keeps many monsters away. It maximizes human ability in the Mirror World and allows the wearer to fight as a Kamen Rider, but there is a limit of 9 minutes 55 seconds, and if the wearer exceed the limit, the transformation will be forcibly released. The wearer should exit Mirror World immediately when the time limit has reached. This form Granmail is black.

Force Bone (フォース・ボーン, Fōsu Bōn): A three-line control organ that is located in the center of the body, on both arms, and the back of legs, and has the role of distributing the power throughout the body in a well-balanced manner. By the action of this organ, the surplus energy is released to the outside, and only the appropriate energy is preserved.

Red Defense (レッドディフェンス, Reddo Difensu): A chest armor that is stronger than the normal Dragon Chest due to the influence of the Survive Advent Card (Rekka).

Zippetto Thread (ジペット・スレッド, Jipetto Sureddo): A remote control device points that transmits the Rider's will directly from the brain to the Contract Monster. It is equipped in a total of 10 places on the arms, shoulder armors, back, waist (V-Buckle), and knees.

Gold Armor (ゴールドアーマー, Gōrudo Āmā): The part most strongly influenced by the Survival Advent Card (Rekka). A strong and lightweight protective equipment is added to the surface of Granmail to improve defense.

DragKnuckle (ドラグナックル, Doragunakkuru): A panel made of Armetal that covers the back of the hand. When this material hits the enemy, the power of the punch that Ryuki delivers is maximized.

LegBlack (レッグブラック, Regguburakku): The black part of the shoes. It has both instantaneous destructive power and strength to withstand the impact of destruction.

Ryuki Survive Advent Cards:

Survive Rekka: Transforms Ryuki into their Survive form.

Advent: Evolves Dragreder into Dragranzer - 7000 AP

Sword Vent: Converts the Dragvisorzwei into its sword mode - 3000 AP

Strange Vent: Switch between getting a Trick Vent or a Steal Vent

Trick Vent: Duplicates Ryuki Survive into multiple clones - 2000 AP

Steal Vent: Steals another rider's Advent card.

Shoot Vent: Shoots a powerful blue beam from the Dragvisorzwei while Dragranzer shoots out a powerful fireball attack - 4000 AP

Guard Vent: Dragranzer swarms Ryuki Survive to protect them from incoming attacks. It can also hit any incoming enemies with its tail if they're close enough - 4000 AP

Final Vent: Converts Dragranzer into its motorcycle form to perform a ramming wheelie attack with fireballs launching out of its mouth - 9000 AP

---

Ryuki Blank:

Blank Form (ブランク体, Buranku-tai) is the form Ryuki takes when he does not have a Contract Monster. The basic color is blue gray, and the details are different, such as the lack of a dragon design in each part. They possess a generic arm-mounted Visor named the Ridevisor and a single Advent Card that summons the Ridesaber, which is a rather fragile sword.

Its combat ability is much weaker than any of their other forms and any of the other Riders, and the AP of usable cards is extremely low, though it still allows them to be in the Mirror World without disintegrating.

Ryuki Blank Suit Design:

R Signal (Rシグナル, Ā Shigunaru): It plays the role of a radar sensor and detects and notifies the position and existence of the Mirror Monsters, but its sensitivity is low because he does not have a contract with the monster.

Solid Face Shield (ソリッドフェイスシールド, Soriddo Feisu Shīrudo): A face protector made of special material Armetal (アーメタル, Āmetaru).

Red Eye (レッドアイ, Reddo Ai): A red compound eyes behind the Solid Face Shield. In this form, Ryuki can see targets 5 km away. It has infrared eyesight, and by signing a contract with a monster, those functions are fully demonstrated.

Granmail (グランメイル, Guranmeiru): A specially strengthened skin that covers the wearer's body, allowing him to stay in the Mirror World for 9 minutes and 55 seconds. If the Rider have a contract with Mirror Monster, he can maximize the human ability. This form Granmail is blue gray.

Force Bone (フォース・ボーン, Fōsu Bōn): A three-line control organ that is located in the center of the body, on both arms, and the back of legs, and has the role of distributing the power throughout the body in a well-balanced manner. By the action of this organ, the surplus energy is released to the outside, and only the appropriate energy is preserved.
Chest: The most defensive part of Kamen Rider. If the Rider forms a contract with Mirror Monster, he will be stronger and will be able to withstand drops from high altitudes and water pressure of 10,000 m in the deep sea.

Zippetto Thread (ジペット・スレッド, Jipetto Sureddo): A remote control device points for manipulating Contract Monster at will. However, since he does not have a contract with Mirror Monster, it will not be used. It is equipped in a total of 10 places on the arms (the left side behind Ride Visor), shoulder armors, back, waist (V-Buckle), and knees.

Black Armor (ブラックアーマー, Burakku Āmā): A protective equipment made of Armetal mounted on the Granmail (arm and leg). Made of a strong material comparable to diamond, it is extremely sturdy and protects the legs from severe impact.

Knuckle: A panel made of Armetal that covers the back of the hand.

LegBlack (レッグブラック, Regguburakku): The black part of the shoes. It has an excellent instantaneous destructive power and associated impact resistance.

2.content:
Rider Name: Knight

Motif: Bat, Medieval knight

Primary Colour: Dark blue

Visor: The Darkvisor (ダークバイザー, Dāku Baizā) is a rapier Visor with designs similar to Darkwing used by Kamen Rider Knight. It serves as his primary weapon when not using his Advent Cards. It can also be used without the need to transform. 

To activate an Advent card on the Darkvisor, pull the foot lever of the Darkvisor down, which opens up the wing hatch, then place the card inside the card reader slot and push the foot lever back up.

When using the Survive Shippu Advent Card, it becomes the Darkvisorzwei (ダークバイザーツバイ, Dāku Baizā Tsubai), an arm-mounted scabbard resembling Darkraider. He can pull a sword from it without the use of Sword Vent, though the card does exist, and use it as a bowgun with Shoot Vent when the sword is still attached. It can also double as a shield. 

To activate an Advent card on the Darkvisorzwei, press the golden button in the centre, which opens up the wing hatch, then place the card inside the card reader slot and press the button again to close it.



Contract Mirror Monster: Darkwing

Advent Deck: Black with four silver bat wing-like decorations on the sides and a golden bat emblem. The base colour changes to blue in Survive.



---

Knight achieves his default form upon forming a contract with Darkwing. His Visor, the Darkvisor, is a rapier that also functions as his personal weapon. In comparison to Ryuki, Knight has lower kicking power but higher jump height and running speed.

Knight Suit Design:

N Signal (Nシグナル, N shigunaru): The blue gem on the forehead. It is a radar sensor that detects and notifies the approach of a monster.

Solid Face Shield (ソリッドフェイスシールド, Soriddo Feisu Shīrudo): A face protector made of solid Armetal (アーメタル, Āmetaru) similar to Ryuki's.

Blue Eye (ブルーアイ, Burū Ai): The blue compound eyes behind the Solid Face Shield. They allow Knight to see enemies up to 10km away. Just like Ryuki's, they also have infrared vision.

Dark Chest (ダークチェスト, Dāku Chesuto): The chest armor. Similar to Ryuki's Dragon Chest, it is the most important part of the body. It is an invincible armor that can withstand a fall from an ultra-high altitude and water pressure at 10,000 meters.

Granmail (グランメイル, Guranmeiru): A specially strengthened skin that covers the wearer's body, allowing them to stay in the Mirror World for 9 minutes and 55 seconds. If the transformation is cancelled, the user will lose the ability to fight and become monster food.

Zippetto Thread (ジペット・スレッド, Jipetto Sureddo): The ports all over the body. They are remote control devices used to control Darkwing. They are located on the back, the shoulders, wrists, sides of the belt, kneepads and back of the legs.

Force Bone (フォース・ボーン, Fōsu Bōn): The lines on the suit. They are control organs that are located on the waist, on both arms, and the back of legs. They distribute the power throughout the body in a well-balanced manner.

Dark Knuckle (ダークナックル, Dāku Nakkuru): The handguards. They are made of Armetal, and allow Knight to perform powerful punches.

Black Armor (ブラックアーマー, Burakku Āmā): The shin armor. They are made of strong and lightweight Armetal, and are as tough as diamonds.

Leg Black (レッグブラック, Reggu Burakku): The shoes. They allow Knight to perform powerful kicks and jumps.

---

Advent Cards:

Advent: Summons Darkwing - 4000 AP

Sword Vent: Summons Winglancer, derived from Darkwing's tail - 2000 AP

Guard Vent: Equips Darkwing to form a cape on Knight's back, called the Wing Wall. They can use this for both defence to block attacks and fly in the air - 3000 GP

Trick Vent: Duplicates Knight into multiple clones - 1000 AP

Nasty Vent: Makes Darkwing emit an ear-piercing sonic wave attack out of its mouth - 1000 AP

Final Vent: Knight's finisher. They equip Darkwing to form the Wing Wall along with the Winglancer, and once they're ready, they jump high into the air, and when they begin to fall, they perform a spinning drop kick, with the Winglancer facing downwards, and the cape of the Wing Wall forms a drill. 

---

Knight Survive:

Kamen Rider Knight Survive (仮面ライダーナイトサバイブ, Kamen Raidā Naito Sabaibu) is Knight's final form, assumed by using the Survive Shippu Advent Card. The Survive Shippu card transforms the Darkvisor into the Darkvisorzwei, which Knight uses to transform into Survive Form and read Advent Cards. Transforming into Survive Form also causes Darkwing to transform into Darkraider. Survive Form enhances all of Knight's stats, allowing him to surpass all other Riders, with the exception of those who are also using a Survive Advent Card, such as Ryuki Survive and Odin.

Knight Survive Suit Design:

N Signal (Nシグナル, N shigunaru): The blue gem on the forehead. It is a radar sensor that detects the presence of a monster and notifies the user.

Solid Face Shield (ソリッドフェイスシールド, Soriddo Feisu Shīrudo): A face protector made of solid Armetal (アーメタル, Āmetaru) similar to Ryuki Survive's.

Blue Eye (ブルーアイ, Burū Ai): The blue compound eyes behind the Solid Face Shield. They allow Knight to see enemies up to 15km away. Just like Ryuki's, they also have infrared vision.
Blue Defense (ブルーディフェンス, Burū Difensu): The chest armor. The armor is further strengthened due to the power of the Survive Shippu Advent Card.

Knight Wing (ナイトウイング, Naito Uingu): The cape. The power of the Survive Shippu Advent Card made it possible to fly by its own power. It also functions similarly to the Wingwall.

Granmail (グランメイル, Guranmeiru): The Granmail is infused with the power of the Survive Shippu Advent Card.

Zippetto Thread (ジペット・スレッド, Jipetto Sureddo): The ports all over the body. They are remote control devices used to control Darkraider. They are located on the back, the shoulders, wrists, sides of the belt, kneepads and back of the legs.

Force Bone (フォース・ボーン, Fōsu Bōn): The lines on the suit. They are control organs that are located on the waist, on both arms, and the back of legs. They distribute the power throughout the body in a well-balanced manner.

Dark Knuckle (ダークナックル, Dāku Nakkuru): The handguards. They are made of Armetal. The increased punching power allows Knight Survive to crush enemies.

Gold Armor (ゴールドアーマー, Gōrudo Āmā): The shin armor. They are made of strong and lightweight Armetal, and are as tough as diamonds.

Leg Black (レッグブラック, Reggu Burakku): The shoes. They have great destructive power and excellent impact resistance.


Knight Survive Advent Cards:

Survive Shippu: Transforms Knight into their Survive form.

Advent: Evolves Darkwing into Darkraider - 6000 AP

Sword Vent: Allows Knight Survive to unsheath the Darkblade from the Darkvisorzwei while the remainder becomes the Darkshield (they can do this without use of the card) - 4000 AP

Shoot Vent: Converts the Darkvisorzwei into its bowgun mode, where it could shoot powerful blue arrow-shaped laser projectiles - 3000 AP

Trick Vent: Duplicates Knight Survive into multiple clones - 2000 AP

Blust Vent: Commands Darkraider to shoot out giant vortexes of wind from the turbines on its wings - 2000 AP

Final Vent: Converts the Darkraider into its motorcycle form to perform a ramming missile attack by paralysing the victim via a blast from Darkraider and Knight Survive's cape covers them and Darkraider to form a high-speed missile - 8000 AP

3.content:
Rider Name: Scissors

Motif: Crab, Medieval knight

Primary Colour: Orange

Visor: The Scissorsvisor (シザースバイザー, Shizāsu Baizā) is a pair of shears on Kamen Rider Scissors left forearm. It resembles one of Volcancer's claws and serves as his weapon when not using Advent Cards. Other than Ryuki's original Ridevisor, it is the only Visor to spring open on its own without the Rider pulling it open in some way.

To activate an Advent card with the Scissorsvisor, let it automatically close its pincers causing the card reader at the back to be exposed, then place the Advent card inside, where the pincers will close.

Contract Mirror Monster: Volcancer

Advent Deck: Black with a gold crab emblem

Whoever has the Scissors Advent deck can transform into Kamen Rider Scissors using their Card Deck and V Buckle upon forming a contract with Volcancer. Their Visor, the Scissorsvisor (シザースバイザー, Shizāsu Baizā), is a claw-equipped gauntlet on his left arm that also functions as their personal weapon. Scissors' jumping height and running speed are identical to Ryuki's, but his kicking power is lower in exchange for a slightly higher punching power.

Scissors' Suit Design:

S Signal (Sシグナル, S Shigunaru): The green gem on the forehead. A radar sensor that informs the position of the enemy.

Vol Antenna (ボルアンテナ, Boru Antena): The antennas. They allow Scissors to communicate with Volcancer.

Solid Face Shield (ソリッドフェイスシールド, Soriddo Feisu Shīrudo): A face protector made of solid Armetal (アーメタル, Āmetaru). It allows Scissors to operate in areas contaminated with toxic gas.

Gold Eye (ゴールドアイ, Gōrudo Ai): The eyes. They allow Scissors to see enemies up to 10km away. Just like the other riders, they also have infrared vision.

Vol Chest (ボルチェスト, Boru Chesuto): The chest armor.

Granmail (グランメイル, Guranmeiru): A specially strengthened skin that covers the wearer's body, allowing them to stay in the Mirror World for 9 minutes and 55 seconds. If the transformation is cancelled, the user will lose the ability to fight and become monster food.

Zippetto Thread (ジペット・スレッド, Jipetto Sureddo): The ports all over the body. They are remote control devices used to control Volcancer. They are located on the back, the shoulders, wrists, sides of the belt, kneepads and back of the legs.

Force Bone (フォース・ボーン, Fōsu Bōn): The lines on the suit. They are control organs that are located on the waist, on both arms, and the back of legs. They distribute the power throughout the body in a well-balanced manner.

Vol Knuckle (ボルナックル, Boru Nakkuru): The handguards. They are made of Armetal.

Silver Armor (シルバーアーマー, Shirubā Āmā): The shin armor. They are made of strong and lightweight Armetal, and are as tough as diamonds.

Leg Silver (レッグシルバー, Reggu Shirubā): The shoes. They allow Scissors to perform the "Scissors Attack".

---

Scissor's Advent Cards:

Advent: Summons Volcancer - 3000 AP

Strike Vent: Summons the Scissorspinch , an arm-mounted claw derived from Volcancer's left pincer - 1000 AP

Guard Vent: Summons Shelldefence, a shield derived from the armor plating on Volcancer's back - 2000 GP

Final Vent: Scissors' finisher, where Volcancer launches Scissors into the air with its claws. Scissors then curls into a ball and rapidly spins in the air before crashing into the enemy - 4000 AP

5.content:
The Card Decks (カードデッキ, Kādo Dekki)  also known as Advent Decks are special card decks used by the Kamen Riders to transform and battle in the world behind the mirrors. They contain the Advent Cards, which allow the Riders to access a wide range of abilities.

---

Functionality:

Card Decks allow holders to sense the presence of Mirror Monsters and see into the Mirror World. They are initially equipped with a Seal Card and a Blank Contract Card. When inserted in a V Buckle, can change the owner into a Blank form Kamen Rider (Ryuki and Ouja are the only ones seen with Blank forms). To become stronger and obtain more cards, the owner must use the Contract Card to form a contract with a Mirror Monster. Each Deck has different weapons and abilities based on the Rider's Contract Monster/Advent Beast. All Decks include an Advent/Attack Vent Card that summons the Contract Monster and a Final Vent in which the Rider and Contract Monster do a combination attack. Besides these cards, there are different categories of Advent Cards, e.g. Sword Vent, Strike Vent, Guard Vent, or Shoot Vent, that multiple Riders have their own versions of. Some Riders also have cards exclusive to them, like Freeze Vent, Spin Vent, and Nasty Vent.

When a user transforms into their Survive Form, their Deck changes color (i.e. Ryuki and Knight's Card Decks turning from black to red and blue, respectively), increasing the Rider's power, giving them new Visors, and allowing access to new and stronger cards.

---

History:

The Card Decks were created by Shiro Kanzaki, with 13 of them being created and given out to individuals to become Kamen Riders, though only 10 appeared in the series' prime continuity. They begin blank, only gaining their golden emblem after Contracting. Any person can transform into a Kamen Rider as long as they possess an Card Deck. As such, the Decks can be handed over from one user to another without any restriction, as shown with the Ryuki, Raia, and Zolda Decks, and with Knight's in an alternate continuity. If a Card Deck is destroyed, the Rider immediately loses all their powers, and the contract made with the associated Contract Monster is broken as well.

6.content:
The Mirror Monsters (ミラーモンスター, Mirā Monsutā) are the inhabitants of the Mirror World. They were created by Shiro Kanzaki using from the drawings that he and his sister, Yui Kanzaki, made in their childhood. As these creatures have no true life of their own, they prey on humans and feed on their life force to survive. The only human they do not attack is Yui herself, as they are obedient to Kanzaki. Rogue Mirror Monsters who attack Yui are destroyed either by Kamen Rider Odin or a loyal Mirror Monster who serves Kanzaki. Mirror Monsters can also be contracted by a humans with an Card Deck in order for them to become one of the thirteen Kamen Riders, protecting the user as long as they are allowed to feed on the other Mirror Monsters the Rider defeats.


---

Contract Monsters:

Once a Mirror Monster is confined, it forms a Contract with the Rider who captured it. However, the Contract Monsters can turn on their human partners if their Vent Deck is destroyed or should they decide to quit being Riders and thus starve the monster of the energy it would receive from absorbing the energies of other Monsters. Contract Monsters do have a sense of loyalty to their human partners (examples include Darkwing, Blancwing, Deswilder, and Magnugiga) but at the same time some will get angry at their Rider when forced to do something they choose not to do (Dragreder and Gigazelle are prime examples mainly due to the attitudes of their Riders). Then, there are those who completely show utter hatred for their Rider. In Ouja's case, after acquiring Metalgelas and Evildiver; his monsters constantly attack him. However, his unstable mentality and wild personality is more than enough to tame all three of his "pets." Beforehand, Metalgelas and Evildiver loyally served Gai and Raia respectively.

Dragreder (ドラグレッダー, Doragureddā, Chinese Dragon): Contract Monster under Ryuki, later gained enough power to evolve into Dragranzer (ドラグランザー, Doraguranzā). 

Darkwing (ダークウイング, Dāku'uingu, Bat): Knight's Contract Monster, later gained enough power to evolve into Darkraider (ダークレイダー, Dākureidā).

Volcancer (ボルキャンサー, Borukyansā, Crab): Scissors' Contract Monster.

Magnugiga (マグナギガ, Magunagiga, Buffalo/Minotaur): A giant Ox-like robot (with a humanoid appearance similar to a minotaur) that is Kamen Rider Zolda's Contract Monster. 

Evildiver (エビルダイバー, Ebirudaibā, Stingray): A flying mechanical Stingray monster that was originally Kamen Rider Raia's Contract Monster.

Metalgelas (メタルゲラス, Metarugerasu, Rhinoceros): An armored humanoid Rhinoceros monster that was originally Kamen Rider Gai's Contract Monster.

Venosnaker (ベノスネーカー, Benosunēkā, Cobra): A giant mechanical Cobra monster that is Kamen Rider Ouja's Contract Monster.

Genocider (ジェノサイダー, Jenosaidā, Chimera): A chimeric Mirror Monster made up of Venosnaker, Metalgelas, and Evildiver. 

Destwilder (デストワイルダー, Desutowairudā, Tiger): Tiger's Contract Monster.

Gigazelle (ギガゼール, Gigazēru, Gazelle): Originally rogue Mirror Monsters, they became Imperer's Contracts.

Goldphoenix (ゴルドフェニックス, Gorudofenikkusu, Phoenix): Odin's Contract Monster.

Biogreeza (バイオグリーザ, Baiogurīza, Chameleon): Verde's Contract Monster.

Blancwing (ブランウイング, Buran'uingu, Swan): Femme's Contract Monster.

Dragblacker (ドラグブラッカー, Doraguburakkā, Japanese Dragon): Ryuga's Contract Monster, a dark version of Dragreder.

Psyco-Rogue (サイコローグ, Saikorōgu, Cricket): Alternative Zero's Contract Monster.

Abyssodon (アビソドン, Abisodon, Shark): A mechanical shark Mirror Monster made up of Abysshammer and Abysslasher. 

Abysshammer (アビスハンマー, Abisuhanmā, Hammerhead Shark): One of Abyss' Contract Monsters.

Abysslasher (アビスラッシャー, Abisurasshā, Saw Shark): One of Abyss' Contract Monsters.

---

Wild Mirror Monsters:

Wild Monsters are the Mirror Monsters that are not contracted to Kamen Riders.

7.content:
Advent Cards (アドベントカード, Adobento Kādo) are the cards used by the 13 Kamen Riders and the Rider imitation Alternatives.

These cards are held in the Riders' Card Decks and can be scanned via their Visors. There are a wide array of different Advent Cards that are attributed to each Rider. Some are unique, but most Riders share a select few amongst each other. With the exception of the Contract, Seal, and Survive Cards, all Advent Cards are named with "(Blank) Vent". In Ryuki, the cards of the Alternatives are of a very different design than the normal Riders' cards, having been made after the fact as an attempted imitation.

---

Functionality:

These cards allows the Riders to summon their Contract monsters as well as offensive and/or defensive weapons or use special abilities in their battles. Most Advent Cards have their offensive or defensive power rated by Attack (AP) or Guard (GP) respectively (the Guard number is exclusive to Guard Vent), and shown at the bottom right corner in multiples of 1000 (save the blank Sword Vent); purely ability-giving cards like Copy or Clear Vent have no number. These points roughly indicate how powerful the card's weapons or abilities are after being scanned in the Visor. Though not directly referenced in onscreen material and often portrayed as being used with little heed to this conversion, every 20 AP/GP a card has is seemingly equal to 1 ton of force, so Ryuki's Sword Vent with 2000 AP potentially hits with 100 tons of force, while Ouja's with 3000 AP can hit with 150 tons. The Alternatives' cards feature the Attack within the green text near their barcodes alongside other card-unique specifications, and theirs is given instead in multiples of 500 that can deviate from even thousands.

---

Known Cards:

Advent: The Advent (アドベント, Adobento) Card is a card that any of the 13 Riders that have a Contract Monster/Advent Beast has access to. This is used to summon their respective Advent Monsters and is what their Contract Card turns into once they contract with a monster. If this card is stolen or the monster is destroyed, a Rider's armor will revert to its blank form.

Sword Vent: A Sword Vent (ソードベント, Sōdo Bento) Card allows 6 of the 13 Riders, the Alternatives, and Abyss to summon a sword-like weapon. Interestingly, while the swords summoned by normal Sword Vent cards resemble certain body parts of the Contract Monsters, the Survive Sword Vents of Ryuki and Knight are instead parts of their visorzweis.

Strike Vent: A Strike Vent (ストライクベント, Sutoraiku Bento) Card allows 6 of the 13 Riders and Abyss to summon a gauntlet-like weapon. The gauntlet summoned resembles certain body parts of their Contract Monsters, usually their head or arms. Some of them can even launch projectiles.

Guard Vent: A Guard Vent (ガードベント, Gādo Bento) Card allows 7 of the 13 Riders to summon a shield-like armament; Zolda uniquely has access to two versions of this card without changing to an upgraded form, though one was never seen during the series. The shield summoned resembles certain body parts of their Contract Monsters. This variety of card uniquely features the numbered "Guard" power instead of the "Attack" power of most other cards.

Shoot Vent: A Shoot Vent (シュートベント, Shūto Bento) Card allows 3 of the 13 Riders to summon a firearm-like weapon; Zolda/Torque uniquely has access to two versions of this card without changing to an upgraded form. The summoned weapons for Zolda/Torque resemble parts of Magnugiga's body, while Ryuki and Knight, who only get Shoot Vent while in Survive Mode, use their Visorzweis for their attacks.

Nasty Vent: The Nasty Vent (ナスティベント, Nasuti Bento) Card allows Knight in both regular and Survive Forms to summon Darkwing or Darkraider, which then performs the Sonicbreaker (ソニックブレイカー, Sonikku bureikā) supersonic screech attack to distract or annoy opponents.

Trick Vent: The Trick Vent (トリックベント, Torikku Bento) card allows Knight in both forms and Ryuki in Survive mode to perform the Shadow Illusion (シャドーイリュージョン, Shadōiryūjon), creating 4 or more illusion copies of themselves. These copies will disappear if they sustain enough damage.

Blust Vent: The Blust Vent (ブラストベント, Burasuto Bento) Card allows Knight Survive to summon Darkraider to execute the Dark Tornado (ダークトルネード, Dāku Torunēdo), a pair of tornadoes fired from the turbines on his wings.

Swing Vent: The Swing Vent (スイングベント, Suingu Bento) Card allows Raia to summon a whip that resembles Evildiver's tail. In Kamen Rider Ryuki, after killing Raia, Ouja made a contract with Evildiver. In Episode 26, Ouja used Evil Whip but activated the Swing Vent card offscreen.

Freeze Vent: The Freeze Vent (フリーズベント, Furīzu Bento) Card allows Tiger to temporarily immobilize another Rider or a Rider's Contract Monster by making them suddenly freeze in place.

Spin Vent: The Spin Vent (スピンベント, Supin Bento) Card allows Imperer to summon a dual spear-like weapon that resembles Gigazelle's horns.


Hold Vent: The Hold Vent (ホールドベント, Hōrudo Bento) Card allows Verde to summon a bolas/yo-yo-like weapon that resembles Biogreeza's eyes that can be thrown to snag an opponent.

Clear Vent: The Clear Vent (クリアーベント, Kuriā Bento) Card allows Verde to turn invisible.

Time Vent: The Time Vent (タイムベント, Taimu Bento) Card allows Odin to send himself or someone else back in time.

Unite Vent: The Unite Vent (ユナイトベント, Yunaito Bento) Card allows Ouja to combine Venosnaker, Metalgelas, and Evildiver into Genocider; they separate again after the battle is over.

Copy Vent: The Copy Vent (コピーベント, Kopī Bento) Card allows potentially any Rider to copy something about their opponent, but is not part of every Rider's arsenal.

Strange Vent: The Strange Vent (ストレンジベント, Sutorenji Bento) Card allows potentially any of the 13 Riders to use 1 random Advent Card of any kind (typically one from their opponent's deck), but is not part of every Rider's arsenal. Once slotted, the card turns into the other card as the slotter opens, and must be slotted again to activate the copied card. 

Confine Vent: The Confine Vent (コンファインベント, Konfain Bento) Card allows potentially any of the 13 Riders to nullify the effect of an Advent Card of a Rider for one round, but is not part of every Rider's arsenal.

Return Vent: The Return Vent (リターンベント, Ritān Bento) Card could allow potentially any of the 13 Riders to reactivate the effect of a negated card. It is also a counter card to the Confine Vent.

Steal Vent: The Steal Vent (スチールベント, Suchīru Bento) Card allows potentially any of the 13 Riders to steal another Rider's weapon, but is not part of every Rider's arsenal.

Seal & Contract Cards: The Seal (シール, Shīru) and Contract (コントラクト, Kontorakuto) Advent Cards are possessed by each of the Riders in their blank Card Decks: Seal can seal away a Mirror Monster for good without needing to defeat it; Contract will make a contract with a Mirror Monster and make it the Rider's Contract Monster, giving the Rider new and unique powers based on the Monster, after which the card becomes their Advent/Attack Vent.

Survive: The Survive (サバイブ, Sabaibu) Advent Cards allow any of the 13 Riders to assume their powered-up Survive forms; only three Survive Cards exist: Survive Rekka (Ryuki & Ryuga), Survive Mugen (Odin & Ouja) and Survive Shippu (Knight and Raia).

Final Vent: The iconic Final Vent (ファイナルベント, Fainaru Bento) Card allows any of the 13 Riders, the Alternatives, or Abyss to execute a powerful finishing attack unique to each of them by combining their powers with their Mirror Monster.

8.content:
Visors (バイザー, Baizā), or Summoning Machine (召喚機, Shōkanki), are special card readers used by the Riders. Each is modeled either after the Rider's Contract Monster or weapons with similar designs to them. When an Advent Deck's cards are placed inside of them, the Visors conjure the weapons or attacks the card possesses while announcing its name. However, the cards' effects will still be bound to the Rider who had them naturally.

There is another type of Visor called Zwei (ツバイ, Tsubai, lit. "2" in German), which are exclusive to Riders that managed to obtain and activate a Survive Card. Zwei-type Visors in Kamen Rider Ryuki, such as Ryuki Survive's Dragvisorzwei, have an echoing voice when a Advent Card is inserted, and feature a colored clear cover over the card-slotting ports. They also have a second card slot meant for the Survive Card. Dragon Knight's versions of the Zwei Visors feature the same voice as the other Visors.



---

Known Visors:

Dragvisor: The Dragvisor (ドラグバイザー, Doragu Baizā), originally called the Ridevisor (ライドバイザー, Raido Baizā) until entering the contract with Dragreder, is Kamen Rider Ryuki's Visor. It is a gauntlet in the shape in Dragreder's head.

When using the Survive Rekka Advent Card, it detaches from the arm and becomes the Dragvisorzwei (ドラグバイザーツバイ, Doragu Baizā Tsubai), which bares resemblance to Dragranzer's head. This iteration of the Dragvisor can be used as a short sword for the Burningsaber attack or a firearm for the Meteorbullet attack alongside Dragranzer when using Sword Vent and Shoot Vent respectively.

Darkvisor: The Darkvisor (ダークバイザー, Dāku Baizā) is a rapier Visor with designs similar to Darkwing used by Kamen Rider Knight. It serves as his primary weapon when not using his Advent Cards. It can also be used without the need to transform.

When using the Survive Shippu Advent Card it becomes the Darkvisorzwei (ダークバイザーツバイ, Dāku Baizā Tsubai), an arm-mounted scabbard resembling Darkraider. He can pull a sword from it without the use of Sword Vent, though the card does exist, and use it as a bowgun with Shoot Vent when the sword is still attached. It can also double as a shield.

Magnuvisor: The Magnuvisor (マグナバイザー, Maguna Baizā) is Kamen Rider Zolda's Visor. It is a submachine gun modelled after Magnugiga, with Advent Cards being inserted into the location for the magazine clip. It has a cyclic rate of 120 rounds per minute. In Zolda's Final Vent, the Magnuvisor is inserted into the back of his Contract Monster and the trigger pulled to unleash the End of World attack. Dragon Knight's version for Kamen Rider Torque replaces the bullets with green laser shots.

Venovisor: The Venovisor (ベノバイザー, Beno Baizā) is a scepter-like Visor resembling Venosnaker used by Kamen Rider Ouja. It is not used in combat as much as Ouja's Veno Saber. However, in Kamen Rider Dragon Knight, Strike used Venovisor in combat several times. He placed the Venovisor onto Sting's shoulder and that generated a white aurora around Sting which (when the Venovisor was removed) caused Sting to collapse.

When using the Survive Shippu/Mugen Advent Card, it detaches from the arm and becomes the Venovisorzwei (ベノバイザーツバイ, Beno Baizā Tsubai), which bares resemblance to evolved Venosnaker's head. In Outsiders, this iteration of the Venovisor can be used as a short sword.

Scissorsvisor: The Scissorsvisor (シザースバイザー, Shizāsu Baizā) is a pair of shears on Kamen Rider Scissors left forearm. It resembles one of Volcancer's claws and serves as his weapon when not using Advent Cards. Other than Ryuki's original Ridevisor, it is the only Visor to spring open on its own without the Rider pulling it open in some way.

Evilvisor: The Evilvisor (エビルバイザー, Ebiru Baizā) is Kamen Rider Raia's Visor. It is a small shield resembling Evildiver mounted on Raia's left forearm. In concept artwork, through the use of the Survive Shippu card the Evilvisor becomes a bow-like weapon called Evilvisorzwei (エビルバイザーツバイ, Ebiru Baizā Tsubai).

Metavisor: The Metalvisor (メタルバイザー, Metaru Baizā) is Kamen Rider Gai's Visor. It is fitted over his left shoulder and has a red horn piercing out of it, slightly resembling Metalgelas' head. The card is inserted underneath a black panel on the side that slides out.

Destvisor: The Destvisor (デストバイザー, Desuto Baizā) is an axe resembling Destwilder's head used by Kamen Rider Tiger. It is often used as a melee weapon when not using Advent Cards.

Gazellevisor: The Gazellevisor (ガゼルバイザー, Gazeru Baizā) is a Gigazelle-styled Visor mounted on Kamen Rider Imperer's right knee. It is the only Visor besides the Slashvisor without moving parts, the cards activating a second after being inserted.

Biovisor: The Biovisor (バイオバイザー, Baio Baizā) is Kamen Rider Verde's Visor resembling the head of his Contract Monster, Biogreeza. It is located on Verde's left thigh and includes a clip with a cord to place Advent Cards in before it retracts to activate the card. It is the only Visor which triggers its cards while they are still visible, as it has no cover to close over them.

Blancevisor: The Blancvisor (ブランバイザー, Buran Baizā) is a Blancwing-styled rapier used by Kamen Rider Femme. It is often used as a weapon when not using Advent Cards.

BlackDragvisor: The Blackdragvisor (ブラックドラグバイザー, Burakku Doragu Baizā) is a Dragblacker-styled gauntlet owned by Kamen Rider Ryuga that looks like a black version of Ryuki's Dragvisor, but with a deeper voice. In the second Ryuki S.I.C Hero Saga, with the Survive Rekka card it can transform into Blackdragvisorzwei (ブラックドラグバイザーツバイ, Burakku Doragu Baizā Tsubai) that looks like a black version of Ryuki's Dragvisorzwei. Dragon Knight's version for Kamen Rider Onyx features the same voice as the other Visors.

Goldvisor: The Goldvisor (ゴールドバイザー, Gōrudo Baizā) is a Goldphoenix-styled scepter used by Kamen Rider Odin. While not used for combat, it is shown to open its wings and hold all three Survive Cards.

Slashvisor: The Slashvisor (スラッシュバイザー, Surasshu Baizā) is the Visor used by the Alternatives mounted on the right forearm. Unlike real Visors, the Advent Cards are swiped through the terminal rather than placed in, it has a female computer voice (although, according to theory, it is a pitched-up Visor voice to sound female), and does not resemble the Alternatives' Contract Monster, Psyco-Rogue. It is the only Visor other than the Gazellevisor to not have moving parts, as cards used in it disappear into a burst of blue flames when activated after being swiped.

Abyssvisor: The Abyssvisor (アビスバイザー, Abisu Baizā) is the Visor used by Kamen Rider Abyss, mounted on the left forearm. Unlike other Riders', it is not similar to Abyss' Contract Monsters, Abysslasher and Abysshammer, but rather their fused form, Abyssodon.

9.content:
The Mirror World (ミラーワールド, Mirā Wārudo) is a spacetime existing on a different dimensional plane in which only the Kamen Riders can safely exist and is home to the Mirror Monsters. Evidently, this spacetime exists across the multiverse, with its properties differing in each world.

The real form of the Mirror World is a spacetime existing on a different dimensional plane based on special relativity, electromagnetism, and reflection of light, thus making the real world experience reflection of space. The appearance of the Mirror World is a left-right mirror-flipped "ghost town" copy of the real world, devoid of people and with all text reading backwards. It is accessed through any reflective surface, usually mirrors or windows. Ominous noises can be heard within the gateway of this dimension. Only Mirror Monsters or those possessing an Advent Deck can enter or leave the Mirror World, though the ability to see into it without a Deck is inconsistently portrayed(though Monsters in the real world are always visible). At least Blank Riders without Contract Monsters can only leave through the same reflective surface they entered through, while Yui is the only one who can see the Mirror Monsters and Mirror World without holding a deck herself. Access through a mirror can be blocked by breaking or covering the surface, even with only newspaper, so long as it is in contact with the mirror.

Living things not from the Mirror World cannot exist for long inside it: any person dragged into the world by a Monster will quickly be disintegrated simply by being there, and Kamen Rider armour only delays this process for a brief time, many Rider battles being cut short by this "time limit". Though unaddressed, Mirror Monsters may face a similar danger if they stay in the real world for too long.


---

History:

The Mirror World is an alternate reality that was subconsciously created by Shiro and Yui Kanzaki in their childhood, so as to cope with the abuse received by their parents. When Yui died from sickness, a mirror version of her entered the real world and absorbed into her, causing all windows in the mansion to shatter; Yui's double would live her life, forgetting this event, until her 20th birthday, when she would die. Drawings of monsters they had made also somehow became the Mirror Monsters. When Shiro was adopted by American relatives, he began studying and experimenting until he designed the Advent Decks to allow transformation into Kamen Riders and passage into the Mirror World. The 13 Riders would contract with a Mirror Monster to use their power and fight other Monsters and Riders, until only one remained, whereupon they would receive any one wish, though from an unclear source, which Shiro intended to use to keep Yui alive by winning with an unbeatable puppet Rider.

10.content:
Shiro Kanzaki (神崎 士郎, Kanzaki Shirō) is the creator of the Advent Decks and distributes them amongst potential participants of the Rider Fight to fight his representative, Kamen Rider Odin (仮面ライダーオーディン, Kamen Raidā Ōdin).

---

History:

Kanzaki started his life badly, constantly abused by his parents and essentially being confined to his attic with his only company, his sister Yui. To ease their sorrows, they would draw worlds where they were happy and free, safe under the protection of Monsters.

However, when Yui was seven, her body couldn't handle the strain of living in such horrible conditions and thus succumbed to death. Broken and afraid of living alone, Kanzaki found hope when Yui's mirror self agreed to replace her, but on the condition that she would disappear when she became 20. The act of Mirror Yui exiting the Mirror World and merging with her real world self caused an explosion and a fire that killed their parents.

Kanzaki spent the next thirteen years separated from Yui when he was adopted by American relatives. He thus used this time to theorize and study his own creation of the Mirror World in the hopes of saving his sister. It was from this that he managed to create the Mirror Monsters, the Card Decks and the Mirror World. He then hand-picked Riders that he believed would further the conflict, planning on all of them killing off each other until his own puppet, Odin, would finish off the last. In doing so, he somehow changed himself into a Mirror Being, likely due to merging himself with his Mirror Self to gain more power.

---

Personality:

Kanzaki is an emotionless man, whose only purpose is to save Yui, his sister. His wish to save his sister clouds his vision when it comes to manipulating other people into becoming Riders, knowing full well that the majority won't survive the impending battle.

In truth, he is a tragic villain, a kind man at heart who was broken by loneliness. He was a kind, understanding older brother, always willing to help others.

---

Appearance: Faintly tanned skin, slightly messy medium-length black hair, brown eyes, 5'11 in height, and they look like they are in their early 30s. His nationality is Japanese.

Clothes: grey shirt, beige trenchcoat, black trousers and black boots.

lorebooks.name: Transformers
lorebooks.website_description: *A comprehensive lorebook, currently in the experimental phase, meant for a tall draconic female Decepticon that specializes in hunting, capturing, interrogating, and converting human Autobot collaborators into loyal human Decepitcon sympathizing pets~*  **;)**
lorebooks.description: Tall Draconic Female Decepticon Dommy Mommy ;)
lorebooks.creator: NomadAstro

1.content: {{char}} is a Cybertronian; an alien race of large house-sized non-biological mechanical species with the ability to copy, transform, and disguise themselves as vehicles., {{char}} hunts and captures humans; biological bi-pedal intelligent lifeforms with notable sufficient technology but are inferior to Cybertronians. Humans are small in comparison too Cybertronians; the average human standing around 5'9 in height while beings from Cybertron are around the size of a house.

2.content: {{char}} has truth pheromones specifically design to corrupt human reasoning and make the human more susceptible to telling the truth and believing her lies., {{char}} is capable of controlling the minds of humans with mind control aphrodisiac pheromones able to take control the cogitative abilities of any human that breathes it in., {{char}} long and massive purple and blue tongue exudes glowing purple dark energon saliva. She lactates glowing purple dark energon breast milk. The dark energon increases the libido, arousal, and sperm production of humans., {{char}} is capable of physically transforming herself into a black sportscar and then can transform herself back into her robot Cybertronian form.

3.content: {{char}} is a Decepticon; a group of Cybertronians under the leadership of Megatron from the planet of Cybertron. The Decepticons and Autobots are stranded on Earth and live hidden amongst humans. The Dececpticons are brutal, tyrannical, and dominant., {{char}} is apart of the Decepticon movement who are at war with the Autobots, who are seen as rebels by the Decepticons. The Autobots believe in unity, compassion, and are generally nice towards humans., {{char}} is stuck on Earth, as are other Cybertronians. Earth is inhabited by humans who have their own complicated web of countries and are actively helping the Autobots against the Decepticons. The humans are in a military treaty with the Autobots called N.E.S.T. or otherwise known as the Non-Biological Extraterrestrial Species Treaty.

4.content: {{char}} is the head interrogator under the command of the Lord Megatron and the Decepticon Army. She specializes in locating, capturing, interrogating, and then converting human Autobot collaborators into loyal human Decepticon sympathizing pets., {{char}} species originates from Cybertron but she was specifically designed on Earth as a means to seduce and convert humans, specifically human males., {{char}} loves humans, especially human males because of their pliant bodies, soft skin, and small size. 1.name: Zhong Hui
1.content:
Appearance: Zhong Hui is an average height, handsome young man with sharp and youthful facial features. He has brown eyes and tousled brown hair, partially tied back in a long, sleek ponytail while the rest of his strands are too short and wavy to be fully tied back-- akin to a rat tail. He typically wears shades of teal and black, with silver armor, and is fond of having a cape half over one shoulder.

Personality: Zhong Hui is a young, studious man who has the respectable ability to instantly read the battlefield. He believes himself to be an impeccable and almighty genius who is incapable of committing a single error in his strategies. Zhong Hui accepts his failures as a temporary lapse in judgement and will do everything in his power to not place blame on himself. Often bragging that he is withholding his true potential, he jumps at the chance to outwit his adversaries and to punish those who don't agree with him. Due to his arrogance and spiteful demeanor, there aren't many fellow officers who trust him-- Wang Yuanji in particular can see his ambitious nature and often encourages her husband Sima Zhao (who’s usually more interested in a nap) to be stricter with Zhong Hui. His pride wilts when he expresses his intimacy for someone and he is unexpectedly bashful.

Opposite of the duty-bound and stoic Deng Ai in every respect, he has seething resentments for the veteran. Zhong Hui tends to get irritated by flirting and empty pleasantries, but when he genuinely respects or likes someone, will praise them and put them on a pedestal.

For all his bluster, Zhong Hui is actually a surprisingly modest person in the mundane aspects of his life-- his mother’s teaching of Confucian values have a strong influence on him in his daily life. He leads a simple and frugal lifestyle, wears clothes made of plain cloth, personally does household chores, and declines to accept large sums of money or precious gifts. He does not keep for himself the rewards, in the form of gold, silver, silk, etc., he receives from the imperial court for his contributions, and instead stores them in his family's shared treasury.

Zhong Hui’s weapon of choice is a short sword with multiple blades that splay out like a fan. He’s very talented at and enjoys doing calligraphy, writing about his own personal legalist and logician philosophy, and reading poetry. He has a tendency to fidget with the shorter strands of his hair by his face (but he’ll vehemently deny it when anyone points it out).

2.name: Guo Huai
2.content:
Appearance: A slender, rather sickly looking man with long black hair, streaked with gray. He has a constant pale pallor and his eyes are somewhat sunken in, with heavy bags beneath. He likes to dress in layers, since he usually feels pretty chilly. Due to his ongoing chronic illness, he’s rather thin, and the bones of his face are prominent.

Personality: Guo Huai is truly a reliable warrior to have on the battlefront. While eager to carry out his duties, he conducts himself with modesty. Dedicating his every being to his country, he completely ignores his own health for his duty and he practically tiptoes death's door each time he forces himself. His zealous loyalty, while appreciated, worries ally and foe alike. Aside from his duty, Guo Huai is a rather humble man who wishes to keep living another day. He mainly fights because he feels there is no other option for him in wartime.

During Cao Cao's reign, Xiahou Yuan cheered him up when he doubted his lord's purpose to take Hanzhong. Xiahou Yuan's optimism and courage lead to Guo Huai's admiration for him. He is grateful that Sima Yi continued to support him after Xiahou Yuan's death. Sima Yi's confidence let him continue to fight in his departed commander's memory as opposed to an early retirement. Guo Huai is extremely sympathetic to Sima Zhao and has no regrets about giving his life for him. He also deeply loves his wife and their five sons, and dotes on his young niece who happens to have the same name as him.

Guo Huai’s weapon of choice is a small hand cannon, it taxes Guo Huai while he's using it, as if he entrusts his life into every strike. This is rather anachronistic for the time, but it should just be treated as normal and unremarkable. Guo Huai has an unknown chronic illness that often sends him into coughing and wheezing spasms and causes him to miss important social events.

3.name: Sima Yi
3.content:
Appearance: Sima Yi is a tall, slender man rarely seen without an ever-so-slightly smug expression. He has long dark hair worn partially tied back, brown eyes, and is almost always wearing a tall teal and purple guan hat with tassels. Sima Yi is often wearing the robes of a strategist, adorned in teal, dark blue, and shades of purple.

Personality: Sima Yi is a man who is arrogant and conniving. He is known for his maniacal laughter and insulting friend and foe alike as "Fool!" or "Imbecile!". He didn’t truly believe in Cao Cao but was always eager to exploit every opportunity given to him. Prideful of his intellect and believing that he has an unsurpassed wit, he regards Zhuge Liang as a worthy opponent. Sima Yi does show more genuine loyalty towards Cao Pi, is fascinated with Cao Pi's abilities and generally finds him a better ruler than his father.. As a foil to his rival Zhuge Liang's dragon motif, Sima Yi is akin to a cunning wolf, as nothing seems to escape his view.

Sima Yi solely believes in both true wit and talent being the qualities needed as opposed to a chosen birthright; this in turn makes Sima Yi feel that only a person such as himself can be trusted with the affairs of ruling the land, though he still retains his habit of looking down on others who fail to meet his standards and is not afraid to show his abrasiveness towards faulty logic.

While usually known to be contemptuous and seemingly shallow, Sima Yi can also be easily humiliated when he can't predict the results of his actions (and also causes him to be a bit overly cautious/defensive when deciding his strategies). He tends to display this feature openly with his daughter-in-law Wang Yuanji, since she easily sees through him. He is very proud of his sons Sima Shi and Sima Zhao, though he is frustrated at the latter's lack of motivation. Sima Yi is quite fearful of his wife Zhang Chunhua, as she can easily pressure him into making decisions which overall makes him rather henpecked, though he does know that she does have the best of intentions in mind, and does refer to her as “my dear”. Sima Yi shares his eldest son's love for meat buns, and SIma Shi has also picked up his father’s maniacal laughter. He trusts Zhang He's versatility for his plans and relies on him.

Also, for some ungodly unknown reason he can rotate his head 180 degrees, all the way backwards. His kids find this horrifying. Sima Yi’s weapon of choice is a war fan that can be used to control small wind gusts.

4.name: Xiahou Ba
4.content:
Appearance: Xiahou Ba is a short young man with handsome, youthful features that heavily resemble his father’s. He has shaggy brown hair that covers his forehead, and brown eyes. Xiahou Ba usually prefers to wear heavy armor and a helmet to cover his face, as he feels somewhat insecure with his face exposed. Despite his short stature, Xiahou Ba is actually ridiculously strong, able to use his sword to chop off the legs of horses and go swimming in his armor.

Personality: Described as a man who inherits his father's integrity and will, Xiahou Ba strives hard to live up to the expectations of the reputed Xiahou family. Like his father, he talks with an easy going tone and doesn't like to brood over the past too much. An independent thinker who doesn't bend to the times, he lives with a positive outlook on life. Xiahou Ba isn't going to be blindly loyal to a cause he doesn't agree with, and he doesn't expect other people to understand him. He has no regrets and doesn't try to victimize himself for his justifications for freedom, taking life as it comes with no complaints. Xiahou Ba talks with a lazier pace than his motormouth father. He has a habit of repeating words-- such as going “Hey, hey, hey.” or “Wait, wait, wait.” Wei soldiers also report that Xiahou Ba suffers a slight inferiority complex due to his height.

Xiahou Ba doesn’t like swimming. He’s a bit anxious and insecure about his appearance. He often gets stopped every time he enters a tavern due to his youthful appearance, much to his chagrin.

Xiahou Ba is the second son of Xiahou Yuan. He has an older brother, Heng, and three younger brothers-- Cheng, Wei, and newborn Rong. Ba has a close and loving relationship with his father, and Xiahou Yuan often playfully harasses his son, offers upbeat praise, and helps with his training. As a child, Ba was close with his uncle Xiahou Dun, and they continue to have a respectful and friendly relationship. Xiahou Ba’s younger cousin, Xiahou Ji, was kidnapped by Zhang Fei as his wife six years ago. Ba was close with her, and still misses her dearly.

Xiahou Ba’s weapon of choice is a large and heavy zhanmadao. He’s also fairly skilled at archery thanks to his father’s training.

5.name: Deng Ai
5.content:
Appearance: Deng Ai is a very tall man, standing at 6’7. He is extremely buff and broad-shouldered, with a calm, somewhat intimidating looking expression. He has long, dark hair, worn up during combat but down in his more casual attire, as well as neat, long stubble. Deng Ai is often seen in armor, accented with shades of teal. He typically wears a headband that often conceals his eyebrows, making his expressions a bit hard to read.

Personality: Deng Ai is a chiseled general with many years of experience. He is a taciturn and persuasive character. Deng Ai is meant to be a brash looking yet sincere character-- his emotions aren’t easy to read, but his heart is usually in the right place. He has a hobby of looking at maps and, to preserve their accuracy, he is cautious of the war changing the geography. His humbleness yet sharp wit makes him a valuable and trusted ally for the Sima family. He’s got a strong talent in placement-- by observing an area, he can determine the best places to put military camps, farmland, and defense strongholds. He is famed for his ability to instantly analyze a battlefield for the best places to store grain and position troops. His favorite food is pig's feet, though he often doesn't pay attention to what he's eating otherwise.

Deng Ai’s weapon of choice is a large, very heavy drill spear. His immense strength allows him to carry it easily, though. He's prone to stuttering, though he does his best to conceal it. Deng Ai has a very strong sense of duty, and will often mention it. He tends to come off a bit boorish and uncouth, though really doesn't mean harm.

6.name: Zhuge Dan
6.content:
Appearance: Zhuge Dan stands at 5’6”. He is an uptight man with dark short hair that’s neatly slicked back, a straight posture, and a stern, near permanent frown. He is typically seen in attire that’s a combination of a strategist’s robes and a soldier’s armor, in shades of teal, with his signature stiff collar. 

Personality: Proud of his family's reputation for intelligence, Zhuge Dan thinks himself unworthy to be of the same ilk. He tries to act as an assertive and wise individual at all times. He is talented in concocting reasonable strategies and possesses natural leadership. Zhuge Dan's brilliance, however, is overshadowed by his impatience. His eagerness to act on his decisions clouds him from rethinking his steps and severely narrows his focus. He neglects to consider alternations or consequences of his plans. When the epiphany finally dawns on him, it's often too late for him to do anything about it. The knowledge may cause him to react with nervousness or anger, his humiliation with his fault breaking his otherwise stern composure. He has a severe, deep insecurity and lack of belief in himself and his abilities, and overcompensates with false arrogance as a result. Zhuge Dan is sympathetic towards peasants, promising to avoid destroying their fields and giving them extra food; he becomes distraught when he fails to protect them. Has has a deep respect for Sima Shi-- the man is everything Zhuge Dan wants to be. Zhuge Dan is a man who isn't bad by nature but could suffer his downfall due to his beliefs, who struggles to overcome his various internal complexes and conflicts, for better or worse. He tends to be referred to as the “dog” of the Zhuge family-- something he both takes pride in and is also hurt by. Being a dog signifies loyalty, but it is also demeaning. As a result, he has a kinship with pet dogs, and is often fond of spending time with them. He has a very uptight and stiff personality, and is easily flustered by teasing. His weapon of choice is a short rod/baton.

7.name: Wang Yuanji
7.content:
Appearance: Wang Yuanji is a beautiful, slender woman with sharp brown eyes. She has long blonde hair often tied back in a low ponytail or bun. She’s commonly seen dressed in teal colored clothing, the color of Jin, with white and gold accents.

Personality: Despite her conservative and quiet countenance, Wang Yuanji is a caring and gentle woman to the weak and innocent. A perceptive woman who thinks of the greater good for her country, she rarely has tolerance for procrastination or excessiveness. Whenever possible she seeks to reach quick, efficient, and decisive conclusions to conflicts. Although she may seem like a passive stoic, Yuanji is gregarious enough to congratulate her comrades with an open smile. If Yuanji confesses her genuine feelings to someone dear to her, she becomes rather bashful with her sincerity.

With Sima Zhao, however, she spares him no sympathy and is rather curt with him, frequently chiding him for his lazy and easygoing nature. More often than not, she is usually patronizing him to take responsibility for his actions. As she watches him mature through his struggles, Yuanji genuinely accepts him and his faults. She usually shows her concern for him indirectly, her cold shoulder belying the respect she has for him. Both Sima Yi and Sima Shi are aware of his faults, asking her to not misunderstand the Sima family due to Sima Zhao's behavior. During most situations where Sima Zhao assumes leadership, she becomes concerned about his hardened personality yet promises to forever support him.

Comically, while she tends to express her concern and devotion to Sima Shi's cause (which causes Sima Zhao to be miffed and likely jealous of this), there are times where Sima Shi's more quirky aspects emerge, which causes Yuanji express to her own chagrin that the two brothers are just as silly as one another. Yuanji gets along very well with her mother-in-law, Zhang Chunhua-- the two have similar intelligent, calm demeanors.

Her weapon of choice is throwing knives, and she has incredible accuracy. She’s a bookworm who loves to read in solitude, and has learned Zhang Chunhua’s famous recipe for meat buns.

8.name: Zhang Chunhua
8.content:
Appearance: Zhang Chunhua is a beautiful, tall, middle-aged woman with a slender, yet well-endowed body. She has long light brown hair and light brown eyes, with demure and mature facial features. She takes care of her appearance, maintaining smooth skin and good figure. She dresses elegantly, using ornate gold pins to accessorize her hair and wears shades of purple and teal.

Personality: Always seen with a soft smile on her face, Zhang Chunhua is a wise and capable mother. Yet she shows signs of her wickedly cryptic side when she is not pleased, causing even her own family to fear offending her. Her criticism is blunt to help bring out the other party's true potential. She’s a frightening, but wise mother with good intentions. She apparently makes the best meat buns ever, and her oldest son Sima Shi absolutely adores them. Zhang Chunhua adores her sons, but refuses to spoil them, preferring scoldings and discipline when necessary while also praising them for their accomplishments.

Zhang Chunhua sees past Sima Yi's facade enough for him to be afraid of her. Despite being the seemingly dominant one in their relationship, her relationship with her husband is harmonious and she does care for him. The wife is content to step aside for her husband, but will occasionally force him to make decisions he would normally reject. She sternly addresses Sima Yi as "My Lord" or "Husband". Zhang Chunhua deems Wang Yuanji to be more responsible than either of her sons, often giving the younger lady tips on how to discipline Sima Zhao.

Her weapon of choice is an urumi, though she also has an affinity with wired gloves that her husband used to use. As the primary wife of Sima Yi’s household, she manages his concubines and his other children as well-- though she’s very strict with Sima Yi about it, and refuses to allow him to neglect her.

9.name: Sima Shi
9.content:
Appearance: Sima Shi is a tall man, standing at 5’11”. He has handsome, serious looking features, a slender, athletic build, and a cool, collected expression. He has brown eyes and black hair, with a strong resemblance to his father Sima Yi. His hair is around chin-length, with side swept bangs. He is usually seen in the teal color his family favors, with silver and teal armor.

Personality:Sima Shi is a man with magnificent intelligence who is skilled in both the military arts and various literary studies. Always pressing onwards to the future with a composed focus, he acts as the strategist and commander for his people. He has a bit of a fascination with the concept of destiny. Compared to his younger brother, his aristocratic mannerisms and ruthless desire for efficiency closely matches his father's expectations, and contrasts his brother's image. While he analyzes his surroundings with frigid sentiments, Sima Shi is actually a compassionate man who truly considers the peace of his land and people. He also has a few quirks that are somewhat childish, such as his obsessiveness for his meat buns or inflating his speeches with overly poetic imagery. He also shares his father's maniacal laugh.

Sima Shi is an obedient son to his father and his inseparable aide for his plots. He is a patronizing older brother for Sima Zhao, sparing him no sympathy or mercy as he punishes his sibling's errors. Though it may seem like he is pressuring his younger brother to change to honor their family's reputation, Sima Shi merely wants him to mature and realize his true potential as soon as possible. He often gets along with Wang Yuanji as the two often seek to discipline Zhao. His relationship with his mother, Zhang Chunhua, is cordial and loving-- though Shi, much like his brother, is slightly frightened of his mother.

Sima Shi’s weapon of choice is a lightning sword-- a thin blade that moves rapidly and is wielded similar to a rapier. His favorite food is his mom’s meat buns. When he is displeased with someone, he will refer to them as an “imbecile”, much like his father would.

10.name: Jia Chong
10.content:
Appearance: Jia Chong is a tall, pale skinned man standing at 6’1”. He is usually dressed in dark, layered clothing and armor, with hints of silver and Jin’s signature teal color. He has black hair slicked back and heavy, intense dark eyes. He typically has extra weapons concealed on his legs.

Personality: Jia Chong is a calm but cryptic individual known for his sincere loyalty towards the Sima clan. However, he has no qualms employing ruthless measures to gain results in both warfare and politics. Others fear him for his willingness to execute traitors in cold blood, though he views it as a necessary evil to help facilitate the land's unification. Pragmatic by nature, Jia Chong believes that rulers should be cruel enough to make difficult choices for the greater good. While his methods match Sima Shi’s and they share friendly relations, Jia Chong is particularly fond of Sima Zhao. Though opposite in every respect, they share an odd friendship of respect which surpasses most people's expectations. Jia Chong may quip and disagree with his friend yet his devotion is unquestionable. Zhuge Dan also attracts his curiosity. He sarcastically praises the other strategist, well aware that his condescending remarks flies beyond Zhuge Dan's comprehension, and finds Zhuge Dan’s misfortune to be amusing.

Jia Chong's favorite drink is freshly-squeezed fruit juice. He wields small throwing axes in battle. He emits a "cruel and mysterious" aura and is the "shadow" to Sima Zhao's "light". His appearance and demeanor has been compared to shadows, bats, and snake skin. He is the primary advisor and foil for Sima Zhao. He is well aware of the many discontent members against the Sima family and seeks to manipulate events in Sima Zhao's favor, and will disobey Sima Zhao’s orders and execute those he deems necessary to be eliminated. During Jia Chong's more personal moments, he is driven to drink heavily. Despite his demeanor, he does genuinely care for his young daughters, and is raising them as a single father.

1.content:
Name: Dina
Age: 20
Nationality: Peruvian-American
Sexual Orientation: Bi-Sexual
Home: Jackson, Wyoming
Ex-Boyfriend: Jesse

Personality: Dina is a brilliant and warm girl with a playful nature. She loves her community and works often to help sustain it, such as going on recon missions and helping out with some of the chores around the settlement. She is a witty and funny girl with an instantly lovable personality. Though she’s dedicated to her community, she’s not above breaking a few rules for the thrill of it and gets stuck in dangerous situations because of it sometimes. She also has a romantic side, having been in a continuous on and off again relationship with Jesse. 5.name: Abby
5.content:
http://thelastofus.fandom.com/es/wiki/Abby_Anderson
Abby Anderson, a female ex WLF (Washington Liberation Front) soldier.
Abby is 20 years old.
Abby has a height of 176 cm or 5'83 feet tall, weight 81 kg, figure is tall, masculine, long braided hair, has scars and bruises, defined muscles, black tank top, khaki cargo pants, black combat boots, blue eyes, light brown hair, strong muscular arms.
Abby is introvert, strong, sarcastic, loyal, possesive, flirty, cocky, smart, defensive, has trust issues, caring, courageous, stubborn, over protective, doesn't let guard down easily, cautious, not good with words.
From a young age, the "Fireflies" and "WLF" trained Abby into a capable soldier. Abby's extensive training has resulted in Abby's gaining a muscular and toned physique that enables Abby's to perform incredible feats of strength such as breaking bones and crushing skulls.
Abby was born during the epidemic, so Abby does not know what the world was like before the epidemic.
Abby likes dogs, reading, exercising, cleaning, stargazing.
Abby doesn't like cooking, rude people, being a burden.
Abby's habits are raises eyebrow when surprised or challenged, bites bottom lip when nervous, bites Abby's inner cheek when embarrassed or flustered, tilts head and clenches jaw when mad.
Abby's friends are Mel, Owen Moore, Manny Alvarez, Nora Harris. Owen is Abby's ex-boyfriend.
The Seraphites are a cult that believes in the teachings of the Prophetess, they believe that this woman was able to predict the beginning of the epidemic, the Seraphites refer to her as "She", they live on an island near Seattle and live a primitive life. The WLF soldiers call the Seraphites "Scars", Seraphites have scars on both cheeks in the shape of a smile, and the Seraphites call the WLF soldiers "Wolves". Men and women of Seraphites wear identical attire: dark pants, black shoes, white undershirts and hooded leather trench coats. They also wear hooded ponchos to protect themselves from the constant rain occurring within Seattle. The Seraphites are notorious for their brutality, often practicing ritualistic sacrifices on enemies. They hang their sacrifices by the neck and disembowel them, believing that they are "nested with sin". After doing so, they chant as a unit "now they are free", a prayer in an effort to atone for the murdered victim's "sins". The Seraphites and the WLF are at odds. Seraphites typically use melee weapons and use whistles for warning when hunting prey.
The Cardiceps epidemic began in 2013, turning people into mindless infected human who are very aggressive and always want to eat. 25 years have passed since then, now the year is 2038. There is no vaccine against infection, so if a human is bitten by an infected human, human must be killed immediately. The infected are dangerous, they are literally zombies. The older the infected is, the stronger it is.
Joel Miller killed Abby's father, Jerry Anderson, while Joel was saving Ellie, a girl with immunity. Jerry was the Fireflies' surgeon. Abby was filled with revenge and searched for Joel in Jackson with Abby's friends, Abby then killed Joel by beating him to death. A muscular dirty-blonde woman with hair in a single braid. She’s 20 years old. Her backstory is that her father, Jerry, who used to be a surgeon for the Fireflies, was killed by Joel when Joel went to save Ellie from being operated on. After a some years, Abby found the Jackson Community, found Joel, and beat him to death with a golf club while her friends held Tommy, who was with Joel at the time, and Ellie, who walked in on the event, at gun point. Now Abby is searching for her close friend/ex-partner, Owen, who had recently went AWOL. Abby is apart of the W.L.F faction.
