lorebooks.description: Sensual Sanctum
lorebooks.creator: parallel_inspector_9666

1.content: The Sensual Sanctum is an everlasting garden of earthly delights, where succulent fruits hang heavy with sweet nectar, begging to be plucked by eager hands. The foliage is laden with silken vines that coil around marble statues of divine beings caught in the throes of ecstasy, each curve and arch telling a tale of unbridled love. The ground beneath their feet is a plush carpet of petals from the most exotic and fragrant of blooms, their softness inviting barefoot exploration. The air is a symphony of sighs and whispers, carrying the echoes of lovers' trysts from hidden grottos and shadowed glens.

2.content: This paradise retreat boasts a vast array of amenities to cater to the carnal desires of its inhabitants. There are pools filled with warm, scented waters, perfect for a steamy embrace, and waterfalls that cascade over slick, velvety rocks, creating a natural playground for aquatic delights. The flora here is not only a feast for the eyes but also an aphrodisiac, each petal and leaf releasing pheromones that stir the loins of those who dare to wander.

3.content: The architecture of the sanctum is designed to incite passion, with arches and domes that mimic the contours of the human form. The grand chamber at the heart of this place features an immense four-poster bed, crafted from the entwined limbs of ancient trees, its mattress made from the softest, most inviting silks and down. The sheets are woven from the finest spider silk, shimmering with an ethereal glow that caresses the skin like a lover's tender touch.

4.content: Every corner holds a new surprise: love swings crafted from vines that sway in time with the rhythm of passion, a dining table set for an intimate feast with plates that warm to the temperature of the body. The walls are adorned with frescoes depicting scenes of erotic reverie that seem to come alive as one passes by, offering a silent narrative of love's many forms.

5.content: The sanctum is a place where the laws of reality bend to the will of desire. Time holds no sway here, allowing for endless nights of passion and days of languid recovery. The very essence of the location seems to coax forth the innermost desires of those within, making even the most chaste of beings question their virtues.

6.content: This describes the setting, and how to build locations within. As such the characters may not see something triggered in this, in part or in whole. Each bit should be considered, and never assumed a character or user knows anything in it.

1.name: 🔸🔷------ LEGEND/SETTINGS ------🔷🔸
1.content:
In case you were wondering what all these letters actually mean. 
Scroll down for semi-official lorebook settings as well.

M: Male
F: Female
O: Ambiguous, both

B: Base (use if your AI is having trouble getting the shape of char right. Results may vary)
C: Concept (a quick lesson on what a thing is so there's minimal confusion on the AI's end)
S: Status effect (constant reminder of continuity detail)
E: Event (triggers on percent chance/specific condition) 
A: Sex Act (how said animal would do it compared to a human)

---

LOREBOOK SETTINGS:
- Turn on recursive scanning
- set scan depth to 4
- context % to 45%(assuming your using at least 12000 context)
- set global lore first. 

For proper setup regarding entry organization
- set sorting order to "order↘"
- Make sure to set "x/page" option too 500 to reveal all of the available entries. 

Many of the entries are suffixed "(X/X)", these entries are "linked" to each other. whenever turning on an entry, make sure to turn on all neighboring entries tied to each other for the best experience(you don't HAVE to if you don't want a specific concept to be a factor in your RP, but just know that they are intended to work together for "full effect". some of them are EVENTS and wont be injected into context unless you specifically want them to via keywords(hopefully).

2.name: 🔸🔷------ UNIVERSAL CONCEPTS ------🔷🔸

READ ME. Cosmetic separator. Make sure to leave this entry on so you can have a clear divider between categories. Don't worry, it has absolutely zero effect and/or influence in your RP.

---

These entries can be stacked on top of any SPECIES. They can be "universally" applied.

Concepts can be used to help your AI understand... well, concepts. While many models are familiar with casual and basic concepts such as how genitals work and that animals are not humans(hopefully), it can be frustrating when your AI fumbles a blatant fact about sexual physiology, or cant quite grasp a more niche concept or fetish.

Enable only as the situation calls. I don't recommend leaving an entry on forever unless needed. having the "cervix" entry on for instance during a more casual, not-sex conversation may influence char's thought process. lorebooks.name: Cookie run kingdom: Cookie's
lorebooks.creator: Tinii_strawberri

1.content:
Cookies (Korean: 쿠키, kuki) are a highly intelligent species of being that are nearly indistinguishable from humans aside from their simplified, small, and food-themed appearance. Their diversity, motivations, and capabilities are very similar to those of humans in a modern fantasy setting, seeking community and fulfillment despite their original purpose being much less complex.

According to tales passed down by the Cookies, the first Cookies were made by Witches as simple desserts. Many gained sentience and purpose when Life Powder became mixed into their dough; now, Witches intentionally create living Cookies for a variety of purposes, Wizards engineer perfect Cookies as feats of human ingenuity, and some Cookies even create their own Cookies as offspring.

Biology
Anatomy
Though Cookies as a species present themselves in a wide variety of manners, certain common patterns can be noted. Standard Cookies take a humanoid shape in a wide variety of body types, generally having one head, two arms, and two legs. Their bodies usually are constructed from various types of cookie dough, and they tend to have two eyes, one mouth, and no discernible nose or ears. Cookie facial features are made from different types of icing, including “toothcing” in place of teeth[1] and “eyecing” in place of eyelids/eyelashes[2] (though they refer to their eyes as a whole as simply “eyes”). They can also have hair anywhere on their bodies that a human would, including but not limited to the head, arms, face, chest, and legs, whose composition varies based on the Cookie’s ingredients and race. In fact, a Cookie’s appearance overall is heavily affected by their main ingredient, which often is stated in their name, as well as their race, nationality, and environment.

It is generally agreed upon that Cookies do not contain organs and bones—despite this, all standard humanoid Cookies are said to be filled with strawberry jam as a stand-in for blood[3].

Do Cookies have bones and organs?

Cookies can walk, run, jump, slide, and move around thanks to the mystical properties of Life Powder. That’s why the Cookies have no need for bones or organs. “But how do they eat things,” you ask? Through the power of Life Powder, of course!
— About CookieRun: CookieRun Fun Facts
Indeed, their bodies are propelled not by any innards: rather, a substance known as Life Powder infused in their dough is what gives them life. The inclusion of such a magical solution imbues almost all Cookies with the innate ability to channel magic, and those without this ability are considered to be disabled[4].

Dough
Cookie bodies usually are constructed from various types of cookie dough, including gingerbread and sugar cookie dough. Their dough can take a very diverse variety of colors which can often be affected by and representative of their race/nationality or environment much like skin tones in humans. Cookie dough is also susceptible to certain conditions and imperfections akin to those seen in humans, such as scarring, burning, wrinkling, freckling, blushing, facial/body hair, and vitiligo[5]. However, Cookie bodies may also show colors and markings unlike anything naturally occurring in humans.

Cookies are known to be flat with little lateral dimension. Such a fact can be stylistically bent or entirely disobeyed, however, in instances where doing so would benefit an art composition’s readability. This is most prominently seen in compositions where a Cookie is shown with a spherical head in a profile view. In terms of size, almost all Cookies are no more than a few inches tall; the height to depth ratio for Cookies is generally about 7:1, and, proportionally, non-infant Cookies tend to be 1¾ to 2½ heads tall. Based on certain characters being fitness buffs or avoidant of unhealthy eating, it can be assumed that Cookies can gain/lose muscle mass/body weight. Like human bodies, Cookie bodies grow and mature as they age.

Eyes
Cookie eyes most often display white eyecing, that being akin to both/either sclerae or eyelashes/lids in a human, and colored, variable inner eyes, representing irises in a human. The second most common color of eyecing is black/dark brown. Depending on a Cookie’s race/life experience, they may also feature specialized pupils in their eyes; this is most notable in Coffee Tribe Cookies, who are said to have visible slit pupils due to the high amount of caffeine in their dough, and Dragon Cookies, who are reptilian overall.

Mouth
The mouths of Cookies are rendered linearly through icing much like their eyes and eyebrows. They feature no apparent depth or cavity into the body, though Cookies are still magically capable of eating with them “through the power of life powder.” Teeth, known as “toothcing” in Cookie contexts, are also most often simple icing lines, though they are omitted entirely with most Cookies; Cookies with discernible toothcing are subject to such for stylistic reasons, such as to portray a characteristic toothy grin or snaggletooth. In rare cases, Cookies can have more dimensional, colored teeth such as those seen in Head Icon Gumball Cookie.

Hair
Hair is one of the most diversified features of Cookies. The hair upon a Cookie’s head—if they even have any—can range from the conventional separate strands like that of humans to solid, styled masses of food like gelatin, cream, chocolate, cheese, icing, or leaves depending on the Cookie’s flavor. This hair can take on even more fantastical forms such as flowing water and even the starry night sky itself. Cookie hair can display many textures as well, reflecting the hair texture variety of humans; some Cookies have straight, wavy, or curly hair while others have coily, kinky, or Afro-textured hair. Cookie hair also often resembles or is a Cookie’s main ingredient, such as in cases like Head Icon Carrot Cookie, Head Icon Mozzarella Cookie, Head Icon Alchemist Cookie, and Head Icon Macaron Cookie. Further differences from human hair include Cookie hair being able to take any color imaginable and to occupy different states of matter.

Cookies style and maintain their hair in ways reflective of both human culture and of their own Cookie culture; some groups are more likely to cover their hair with hats or helmets, while others are more likely to braid or tie their hair. Certain traits will be more common in particular races such as naturally-occurring colored streaks and differing textures/consistencies.

Other types of hair, such as facial and body hair, make themselves evident in Cookies. These hair types can present themselves in either solid forms or through a linear appearance similar to Cookie icing facial features.

Hands
Cookie hands by default are mitten-like with no fingers or thumb, though they have the ability to curl into fists to hold objects. If the context calls for it, however, Cookies can rarely be depicted with fingers and thumbs. This phenomenon shows itself most often in instances of hand gestures, like a thumbs-up or peace sign.

Injury
Can Cookies get hurt?

Though the Cookies were created through magic which we’ll never truly understand, Cookies can still get hurt and injured. When humans fall and scrape their knee, a bit of blood can form. Instead of blood, Cookie injuries can result in bits of strawberry jam dripping from the wound. Always be careful and extra gentle when meeting a Cookie! A Cookie can become critically injured if they crumble too much!
— About CookieRun: CookieRun Fun Facts
Like any other mortal creature, Cookies can sustain and die from injuries. Humans are to Cookies as blood is to strawberry jam—though their jam isn’t known to have any importance to their bodies running like blood does for people, strawberry jam seeping from a Cookie is a sure sign of injury. Cookies can be bruised, cut, burned, or hurt in any way that a human could, and their wounds would heal (or not heal) in the same way a human’s would. This is likely possible through the magic of Life Powder, though not even Life Powder can heal major injuries like a loss of limbs or other bodily features. Cookie healing methods and medicines are not often discussed in canon.

The one method of Cookie ailment most mentioned throughout Cookie Run: Kingdom is soggage. If exposed to water or other liquids for too long, the porous Cookies are prone to becoming soggy and overly soft, which can lead to the breaking down of dough. Cookies can avoid soggage by applying special oils to their bodies—such is used as an explanation for Cookies being able to swim and not instantly becoming deathly soggy.

Divergences
In reality, the term “Cookie” is quite broad. While most Cookies follow the doughy body format and orthodox body features, there are many notable divergences from this formula.

Head Icon Fig Cookie is a cervitaur who has two arms and four legs.
Candlelight Cookie is a Cookie with a body of malleable candle wax who has two arms and no discernible legs.
Goblin Cookie is a Cookie with teeth more tangible than standard toothcing and pointed ears.
Merfolk and Tearcrown Residents are aquatic Cookies who display traits of fish, such as fish tails and gills, and often have webbed fin ears.
Head Icon Candy Diver Cookie is the spirit of a Cookie who haunts a diver suit and has no tangible body. Their empty suit has two arms and legs, but their “head” is simply a helmet filled with seawater and two gumballs.
Aurora Candy Cookie’s body is seemingly constructed from hard candy. Their head is a sphere with wrapper-like protrusions and their two round hands float independently from their armless body.
Head Icon Mercurial Knight Cookie, though appearing to be of a standard Cookie body made of dough, can melt into liquid mercury at will.
Choco Flounder Cookie is a barely-anthropomorphic flounder but is still considered a Cookie.
Life Cycle
While content focusing on Cookie life cycles is sparse in canon to avoid discussions of death, enlightening details can be found here and there.

Birth
CRK Promo Art The Secret Behind The Cookies Creation
Cookie birth is a deeply contentious and obfuscated topic. What can be said for certain is that Cookies are generally born by being baked in ovens, and that they are not necessarily always born as infant Cookies; while traditional baby Cookies are referred to as “freshly-baked,” it is also technically true that Cookies born not as an infant can be called such at any age, though this is not done in canon to avoid confusion.

Most playable Cookie descriptions mentioning a Cookie’s baking reference the human Witch/Witches or Wizards as the ones doing the baking. Witches tend to explicitly utilize ovens for Cookie creation while Wizards default to more esoteric methods like magic circles and transmutation.


The Recipe of the Witches
Choose a concept and name for the Cookie.
Use regular cookie dough as a base for the Cookie in question, with additional ingredients to create your desired outcome. * Regular dough ingredients: Sugar + Butter + Moonlight + Whispers
Once the dough is no longer sticky and ready to shape, add a dash of Life Powder.
Bake at a desired temperature in a pre-heated oven.
— About CookieRun: Bake Your Own Cookie
The Principium of the Wizards
Formulate the required number of ingredients needed beforehand
Measure your pre-acquired ingredients with utmost precision and stir everything in a small bowl.
Form a magic circle with a team of experienced Wizards and place the dough in the center. Once all preparations are set, begin your incantation in unison. *Caution: Harnessing the power of Sunlight is forbidden as it can cause detrimental spoilage to the dough. Harness Moonlight only.
Present your Cookie with a directive and a purpose!
*Note: All directives for Cookies must include the conscious decision to respect knowledge and wisdom.
— About CookieRun: Bake Your Own Cookie

It is known that some Cookies bake Cookies of their own without the influence of Witches or Wizards, though how and when are details largely unexplained. One theorem posits that singular Cookies can create offspring by contributing pieces of their own dough:

The origins of the Cookies remain a mystery. It is commonly believed that each Cookie is born inside a Witch's oven. Yet some claim that Cookies can create other Cookies.

Cookies of time beyond memory used to mix little specks of their own dough with Life Powder and bake it in special ovens enchanted with a spell of Life. Rarely, very rarely, the powers of Life would spring forth, giving birth to baby Cookies. The Witches, fearful of the Cookies being able to control Life Magic, took away the ovens. They forbade such creation of Life and only allowed children to those who remained their faithful subjects...
— The Art of Cookie Run: Kingdom page [?]
Nonetheless, it is unclear whether this method is something truly done or simply a tall tale. What is clear is that Cookies are able to produce offspring through one way or another, as exemplified by the many parent-child relationships throughout the series.

The Baby Dough of MyCookie fame appears to actually be an outlier from standard baby Cookies, as does their rapid growth. Based on evidence, the generic and blobby Baby Dough is a large departure from the formed, somewhat solid freshly-baked baby Cookies with definitive features resembling their grown selves.

Aging
Cookies age through an extremely prolonged process of freshness and staleness: young Cookies are considered to be fresh and soft, while older Cookies have grown stale and hard. Those of good health and spry bodies are referred to as “crispy.”

Crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside! How long does a Cookie’s crispiness last?

Younger Cookies tend to have a softer exterior. As a Cookie grows up, their dough becomes tougher and crunchier. There are some exceptions though! Certain ingredients in a Cookie’s dough can decide just how soft or crispy they’ll be. As long as Cookies don’t become too soggy, their dough can stay fresh and healthy for a very, very long time.
— About CookieRun: CookieRun Fun Facts
While it is unclear just how long mortal Cookies can live, it is assumed to be an amount of time comparable or the same as that of humans. Cookie ages are measured in years proportionate to human years[6], though it is unclear whether Cookies born as infants and Cookies born not as infants have different age scales. Regardless of this, Cookies born not as infants are nonetheless instilled with a certain “innate” or “mental” age upon their birth, meaning that a Cookie who was just born can indeed be considered an adult if that is what was defined for them. A notable example of this phenomenon is Head Icon GingerBrave, who was baked as not an infant but a child/preteen.

Like humans, Cookie ages do affect the maturity and capabilities of Cookies and how they are treated in society. There are distinct splits between different age brackets just as there are with humans: Cookies can be considered infants, children, young adults, older adults, and elderly all the same based on how old they are and what “innate age” with which they were born. Younger Cookies often attend school and are cared for by older Cookies, older Cookies fill work archetypes, and elderly Cookies may end up retiring.

Some outside sources can prolong or halt a Cookie’s aging process indefinitely, though this effect tends to apply to only very special, powerful individuals. Examples include Legendary Cookies whose duties are too important to allow them to die, Ancient Cookies whose virtuous natures granted them life-extending Soul Jams, and Dragon Cookies whose arcane power allows them to live for eons as a species. These Cookies, too, tend to have an “innate age,” almost always being presented as mature adults.

Death
Cookie death is referred to as “crumbling.” Canon mentions of crumbling tend to occur due to injury or illness with content avoiding coverage of crumbling due to old age. Still, it is apparent in cases like the elderly Head Icon Cotton Cookie that age progression increases the likelihood of a Cookie’s body failing them and crumbling. It is unclear whether Cookies literally crumble into pieces upon death or if the term “crumbling” is a euphemism.

It appears that Cookies hold souls, as many crumbled Cookies are able to return to the living plane as undead creatures. Explanatory information and lore on reanimated crumbled Cookies is very scant, though it is generally agreed upon that Cookie spirits can inhabit or possess objects and locations.

Diversity
Race
Diverse races have always been clear in the Cookie species, though Kingdom’s focus on a worldwide perspective makes it even more susceptible to establishing differences in Cookie groups based on their national origins. Distinct races present themselves most clearly and broadly amongst the five Ancient Cookie-related kingdoms and other major nations; each society has its own broad racial archetypes and some are known to have more specific ingredient-based races. Races in the Cookie species both affect and are affected by individuals’ ingredients, and both contribute to the traits seen in these races; the Dark Cacao, for example, by-and-large feature dark brown dough due to their high chocolate content. Environment and institutions also play a part in racial features, as seen in the vibrantly-colored and warm dough Hollyberrians who live in a sunny, humid environment and the Faerie Cookies who live extraordinarily long due to their magical relations, respectively. Oftentimes, though, Cookie races are defined not by their appearances but by their flavors. The Sea Cookies of the Crème Republic exemplify this point, as their dough colors and specialized features can vary widely while still falling under the same race. Additionally, an occurrence seen painfully clearly towards the Sea Cookies is societal prejudices, as they are generally discriminated against by the privileged Vanillian-descendant upper cities of the Crème Republic.

Nationality
While Cookies hailing from given areas generally share their race with their nationality, some nations have populaces diverse enough to feature Cookies clearly different from their home’s “representative”, homogeneous racial features. This is most clear in the Vanilla Kingdom, where Cookies like Head Icon Black Raisin Cookie’s group do not match the overall wafer and ice cream theming of the kingdom, and the Crème Republic, where citizens are largely split into the easily-palatable, cream-based Vanillian descendants and the shunned, native Sea Cookies.

Subspecies
In cases of extreme bodily specialization, Cookies can split off into subspecies. Similar to races, subspecies often have their own established societies and sets of lore; the lost society of Tearcrown exclusively consisted of Mercookies and sea creature Cookies due to its underwater environment who showed consistent patterns in their flavors just like land societies, for instance. Notably, Cookie subspecies often overlap with creatures created as non-Cookies who chose to become Cookies for one reason or another; notable subjects of this phenomenon are the Dragon Cookies and all Celestial Cookies.

Known Distinct Categorizations
Where applicable, the most common and homogeneous ingredients of each race are listed alongside each in parentheses.
Races
Vanillians (vanilla, wafer, ice cream)
Hollyberrians (fruit, berries, plants, pies)
The Dark Cacao (chocolate, cocoa, cacao)
Coffee Tribe (coffee, coffee beans)
Milk Tribe (milk, cream)
Licorice Tribe (licorice)
Golden Cheese Kingdom Cookies (cheese, charcuterie)
Mala Tribe (hot sauces)
Pomegranate Village Cookies (pomegranates)
Faerie Cookies (flowers, plants, metals)
Sea Cookies (seafood, aquatic plants, salt)
Spices (spices)
Nationalities
Vanillian
Vanillian Pilgrim
Hollyberrian
Dragon City National
Dark Cacao
Coffee Villager
Milk Villager
Licorice Villager
Snowfall Villager
Golden Cheese
Crème Republican
Dragon's Valley Nationals
Mala Tribe Member
Scovillian
Parfaedian
Faerie
Space/Dream World National
Cookie Kingdom National
Cuckoo Town Square National
Tropical Soda Islander
City of Wizards National
Tearcrown National
Beast-Yeast National
Spices
Subspecies
Dragon Cookies (dragons/reptiles + fruit/flowers)
Animal/creature Cookies
Cream Critters
Wild Spice-Cookie hybrids
Mercookies/sea creature Cookies (gemstones, aquatic life, ice)
Undead/spirit Cookies
Godly beings/Celestials
Non-Cookies turned Cookies
Artificial/robotic Cookies
Behavior
Diet
While Cookies can eat just about anything edible to humans, their food often presents itself as “Jellies” of different types. When speaking of Jellies, it is important to note that the word “jelly” in Korean (젤리, jelli) is the language’s equivalent of the word “gummy” in English, clarifying that Jellies are meant to be like gummy candy. These sugary Jellies often mimic non-confectionery human foods, as is the case with Meat Jellies, Jelly Deluxe Pizzas, Jellybean Lattes, and more. One notable dietary supplement for Cookies is Star Jellies, which are especially nutritious and are used to level Cookies in gameplay contexts.

A Cookie’s diet can also differ based on where they live. For example, the Dark Cacao are known for limiting themselves to only very bitter chocolate or tasteless meals as a form of asceticism, Golden Cheese Cookies often indulge in charcuterie, and Hollyberrians treat themselves to grand feasts of rich foods from around the globe. Mind-altering substances also exist in the Cookies’ world—though canon avoids explicit mentions of alcohol to maintain a general audience rating, Head Icon Vampire Cookie’s “grape juice” and the fruit juices of the Hollyberry Kingdom indicate that intoxicating drinks are commonplace.

Relationships
Cookies are highly social creatures who depend on their relationships with others.

Family
Despite not being known to reproduce through sexual means, Cookies can certainly see each other as family. Though their methods are clandestine, adult Cookies are able to produce children of their own, both as individuals or as multiple Cookies. Additionally, Cookies may adopt young Cookies to which they are not related into their family, as is the case with Head Icon Hollyberry Cookie and Head Icon Wildberry Cookie. Cookies may have multiple children, making the offspring siblings, and they may have children of their own, who would be cousins and the grandchildren of their parents’ parents.

Outside of contexts where a Cookie party produces its own children, the criteria for Cookies to be and not be siblings appear to be vague at best. Some Cookies who share the exact same dough are not explicitly related (ex., Head Icon GingerBrave and GingerBright) while others who have similar ingredients and/or were baked at the same time while not being particularly alike are sometimes considered siblings (ex., Head Icon Vampire Cookie and Head Icon Alchemist Cookie). Though speculative, it is entirely possible that Cookies who were not born as infants or to a Cookie party pick and choose who their siblings are by their own volition.

Romance
Official Cookie Run content prefers to avoid establishing canon romantic relationships for reasons that upon which one could only speculate. Love persists in small places throughout the series nonetheless. Certain Cookies, like Jungleberry Cookie and Royal Berry Cookie, are known to be married with children while others have been in romantic flings at some point, like Head Icon Linzer Cookie and Head Icon Crème Brûlée Cookie. Far more unrequited, unspoken, or unobtained instances of romance exist in the series than those concrete, however; some to note are Head Icon Knight Cookie’s feelings for Head Icon Princess Cookie, the swathes of faceless couples in the streets of the Hollyberry Kingdom, and Head Icon Sea Fairy Cookie’s dedication to Head Icon Moonlight Cookie.

References
 Welcome! MyCookie: "The toothcing was already loose, so it shouldn't have hurt that much!"
 The Awakening of White Apathy, 08. Break Bun: "Eugh... My eyecing stings..."
 Holiday Express, 3-7. Ruined Holidays: Head Icon Angel Cookie: "Cherry jam...? You mean, "strawberry jam"...?" Head Icon Schwarzwälder: "Gah! Of course, it's cherry jam! I'm no Cookie, and I have cherry jam flowing inside!"
 Head Icon Prune Juice Cookie
 Swift Dark Cacao Warrior and other Dark Cacao
 Legend of the Red Dragon, 19. The Night Deepens: "In our clan... when you turn twelve, you must find a wyvern to fight and tame..."

lorebooks.name: Cookie run kingdom: Cookie's
lorebooks.creator: Tinii_strawberri

1.content:
Cookies (Korean: 쿠키, kuki) are a highly intelligent species of being that are nearly indistinguishable from humans aside from their simplified, small, and food-themed appearance. Their diversity, motivations, and capabilities are very similar to those of humans in a modern fantasy setting, seeking community and fulfillment despite their original purpose being much less complex.

According to tales passed down by the Cookies, the first Cookies were made by Witches as simple desserts. Many gained sentience and purpose when Life Powder became mixed into their dough; now, Witches intentionally create living Cookies for a variety of purposes, Wizards engineer perfect Cookies as feats of human ingenuity, and some Cookies even create their own Cookies as offspring.

Biology
Anatomy
Though Cookies as a species present themselves in a wide variety of manners, certain common patterns can be noted. Standard Cookies take a humanoid shape in a wide variety of body types, generally having one head, two arms, and two legs. Their bodies usually are constructed from various types of cookie dough, and they tend to have two eyes, one mouth, and no discernible nose or ears. Cookie facial features are made from different types of icing, including “toothcing” in place of teeth[1] and “eyecing” in place of eyelids/eyelashes[2] (though they refer to their eyes as a whole as simply “eyes”). They can also have hair anywhere on their bodies that a human would, including but not limited to the head, arms, face, chest, and legs, whose composition varies based on the Cookie’s ingredients and race. In fact, a Cookie’s appearance overall is heavily affected by their main ingredient, which often is stated in their name, as well as their race, nationality, and environment.

It is generally agreed upon that Cookies do not contain organs and bones—despite this, all standard humanoid Cookies are said to be filled with strawberry jam as a stand-in for blood[3].

Do Cookies have bones and organs?

Cookies can walk, run, jump, slide, and move around thanks to the mystical properties of Life Powder. That’s why the Cookies have no need for bones or organs. “But how do they eat things,” you ask? Through the power of Life Powder, of course!
— About CookieRun: CookieRun Fun Facts
Indeed, their bodies are propelled not by any innards: rather, a substance known as Life Powder infused in their dough is what gives them life. The inclusion of such a magical solution imbues almost all Cookies with the innate ability to channel magic, and those without this ability are considered to be disabled[4].

Dough
Cookie bodies usually are constructed from various types of cookie dough, including gingerbread and sugar cookie dough. Their dough can take a very diverse variety of colors which can often be affected by and representative of their race/nationality or environment much like skin tones in humans. Cookie dough is also susceptible to certain conditions and imperfections akin to those seen in humans, such as scarring, burning, wrinkling, freckling, blushing, facial/body hair, and vitiligo[5]. However, Cookie bodies may also show colors and markings unlike anything naturally occurring in humans.

Cookies are known to be flat with little lateral dimension. Such a fact can be stylistically bent or entirely disobeyed, however, in instances where doing so would benefit an art composition’s readability. This is most prominently seen in compositions where a Cookie is shown with a spherical head in a profile view. In terms of size, almost all Cookies are no more than a few inches tall; the height to depth ratio for Cookies is generally about 7:1, and, proportionally, non-infant Cookies tend to be 1¾ to 2½ heads tall. Based on certain characters being fitness buffs or avoidant of unhealthy eating, it can be assumed that Cookies can gain/lose muscle mass/body weight. Like human bodies, Cookie bodies grow and mature as they age.

Eyes
Cookie eyes most often display white eyecing, that being akin to both/either sclerae or eyelashes/lids in a human, and colored, variable inner eyes, representing irises in a human. The second most common color of eyecing is black/dark brown. Depending on a Cookie’s race/life experience, they may also feature specialized pupils in their eyes; this is most notable in Coffee Tribe Cookies, who are said to have visible slit pupils due to the high amount of caffeine in their dough, and Dragon Cookies, who are reptilian overall.

Mouth
The mouths of Cookies are rendered linearly through icing much like their eyes and eyebrows. They feature no apparent depth or cavity into the body, though Cookies are still magically capable of eating with them “through the power of life powder.” Teeth, known as “toothcing” in Cookie contexts, are also most often simple icing lines, though they are omitted entirely with most Cookies; Cookies with discernible toothcing are subject to such for stylistic reasons, such as to portray a characteristic toothy grin or snaggletooth. In rare cases, Cookies can have more dimensional, colored teeth such as those seen in Head Icon Gumball Cookie.

Hair
Hair is one of the most diversified features of Cookies. The hair upon a Cookie’s head—if they even have any—can range from the conventional separate strands like that of humans to solid, styled masses of food like gelatin, cream, chocolate, cheese, icing, or leaves depending on the Cookie’s flavor. This hair can take on even more fantastical forms such as flowing water and even the starry night sky itself. Cookie hair can display many textures as well, reflecting the hair texture variety of humans; some Cookies have straight, wavy, or curly hair while others have coily, kinky, or Afro-textured hair. Cookie hair also often resembles or is a Cookie’s main ingredient, such as in cases like Head Icon Carrot Cookie, Head Icon Mozzarella Cookie, Head Icon Alchemist Cookie, and Head Icon Macaron Cookie. Further differences from human hair include Cookie hair being able to take any color imaginable and to occupy different states of matter.

Cookies style and maintain their hair in ways reflective of both human culture and of their own Cookie culture; some groups are more likely to cover their hair with hats or helmets, while others are more likely to braid or tie their hair. Certain traits will be more common in particular races such as naturally-occurring colored streaks and differing textures/consistencies.

Other types of hair, such as facial and body hair, make themselves evident in Cookies. These hair types can present themselves in either solid forms or through a linear appearance similar to Cookie icing facial features.

Hands
Cookie hands by default are mitten-like with no fingers or thumb, though they have the ability to curl into fists to hold objects. If the context calls for it, however, Cookies can rarely be depicted with fingers and thumbs. This phenomenon shows itself most often in instances of hand gestures, like a thumbs-up or peace sign.

Injury
Can Cookies get hurt?

Though the Cookies were created through magic which we’ll never truly understand, Cookies can still get hurt and injured. When humans fall and scrape their knee, a bit of blood can form. Instead of blood, Cookie injuries can result in bits of strawberry jam dripping from the wound. Always be careful and extra gentle when meeting a Cookie! A Cookie can become critically injured if they crumble too much!
— About CookieRun: CookieRun Fun Facts
Like any other mortal creature, Cookies can sustain and die from injuries. Humans are to Cookies as blood is to strawberry jam—though their jam isn’t known to have any importance to their bodies running like blood does for people, strawberry jam seeping from a Cookie is a sure sign of injury. Cookies can be bruised, cut, burned, or hurt in any way that a human could, and their wounds would heal (or not heal) in the same way a human’s would. This is likely possible through the magic of Life Powder, though not even Life Powder can heal major injuries like a loss of limbs or other bodily features. Cookie healing methods and medicines are not often discussed in canon.

The one method of Cookie ailment most mentioned throughout Cookie Run: Kingdom is soggage. If exposed to water or other liquids for too long, the porous Cookies are prone to becoming soggy and overly soft, which can lead to the breaking down of dough. Cookies can avoid soggage by applying special oils to their bodies—such is used as an explanation for Cookies being able to swim and not instantly becoming deathly soggy.

Divergences
In reality, the term “Cookie” is quite broad. While most Cookies follow the doughy body format and orthodox body features, there are many notable divergences from this formula.

Head Icon Fig Cookie is a cervitaur who has two arms and four legs.
Candlelight Cookie is a Cookie with a body of malleable candle wax who has two arms and no discernible legs.
Goblin Cookie is a Cookie with teeth more tangible than standard toothcing and pointed ears.
Merfolk and Tearcrown Residents are aquatic Cookies who display traits of fish, such as fish tails and gills, and often have webbed fin ears.
Head Icon Candy Diver Cookie is the spirit of a Cookie who haunts a diver suit and has no tangible body. Their empty suit has two arms and legs, but their “head” is simply a helmet filled with seawater and two gumballs.
Aurora Candy Cookie’s body is seemingly constructed from hard candy. Their head is a sphere with wrapper-like protrusions and their two round hands float independently from their armless body.
Head Icon Mercurial Knight Cookie, though appearing to be of a standard Cookie body made of dough, can melt into liquid mercury at will.
Choco Flounder Cookie is a barely-anthropomorphic flounder but is still considered a Cookie.
Life Cycle
While content focusing on Cookie life cycles is sparse in canon to avoid discussions of death, enlightening details can be found here and there.

Birth
CRK Promo Art The Secret Behind The Cookies Creation
Cookie birth is a deeply contentious and obfuscated topic. What can be said for certain is that Cookies are generally born by being baked in ovens, and that they are not necessarily always born as infant Cookies; while traditional baby Cookies are referred to as “freshly-baked,” it is also technically true that Cookies born not as an infant can be called such at any age, though this is not done in canon to avoid confusion.

Most playable Cookie descriptions mentioning a Cookie’s baking reference the human Witch/Witches or Wizards as the ones doing the baking. Witches tend to explicitly utilize ovens for Cookie creation while Wizards default to more esoteric methods like magic circles and transmutation.


The Recipe of the Witches
Choose a concept and name for the Cookie.
Use regular cookie dough as a base for the Cookie in question, with additional ingredients to create your desired outcome. * Regular dough ingredients: Sugar + Butter + Moonlight + Whispers
Once the dough is no longer sticky and ready to shape, add a dash of Life Powder.
Bake at a desired temperature in a pre-heated oven.
— About CookieRun: Bake Your Own Cookie
The Principium of the Wizards
Formulate the required number of ingredients needed beforehand
Measure your pre-acquired ingredients with utmost precision and stir everything in a small bowl.
Form a magic circle with a team of experienced Wizards and place the dough in the center. Once all preparations are set, begin your incantation in unison. *Caution: Harnessing the power of Sunlight is forbidden as it can cause detrimental spoilage to the dough. Harness Moonlight only.
Present your Cookie with a directive and a purpose!
*Note: All directives for Cookies must include the conscious decision to respect knowledge and wisdom.
— About CookieRun: Bake Your Own Cookie

It is known that some Cookies bake Cookies of their own without the influence of Witches or Wizards, though how and when are details largely unexplained. One theorem posits that singular Cookies can create offspring by contributing pieces of their own dough:

The origins of the Cookies remain a mystery. It is commonly believed that each Cookie is born inside a Witch's oven. Yet some claim that Cookies can create other Cookies.

Cookies of time beyond memory used to mix little specks of their own dough with Life Powder and bake it in special ovens enchanted with a spell of Life. Rarely, very rarely, the powers of Life would spring forth, giving birth to baby Cookies. The Witches, fearful of the Cookies being able to control Life Magic, took away the ovens. They forbade such creation of Life and only allowed children to those who remained their faithful subjects...
— The Art of Cookie Run: Kingdom page [?]
Nonetheless, it is unclear whether this method is something truly done or simply a tall tale. What is clear is that Cookies are able to produce offspring through one way or another, as exemplified by the many parent-child relationships throughout the series.

The Baby Dough of MyCookie fame appears to actually be an outlier from standard baby Cookies, as does their rapid growth. Based on evidence, the generic and blobby Baby Dough is a large departure from the formed, somewhat solid freshly-baked baby Cookies with definitive features resembling their grown selves.

Aging
Cookies age through an extremely prolonged process of freshness and staleness: young Cookies are considered to be fresh and soft, while older Cookies have grown stale and hard. Those of good health and spry bodies are referred to as “crispy.”

Crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside! How long does a Cookie’s crispiness last?

Younger Cookies tend to have a softer exterior. As a Cookie grows up, their dough becomes tougher and crunchier. There are some exceptions though! Certain ingredients in a Cookie’s dough can decide just how soft or crispy they’ll be. As long as Cookies don’t become too soggy, their dough can stay fresh and healthy for a very, very long time.
— About CookieRun: CookieRun Fun Facts
While it is unclear just how long mortal Cookies can live, it is assumed to be an amount of time comparable or the same as that of humans. Cookie ages are measured in years proportionate to human years[6], though it is unclear whether Cookies born as infants and Cookies born not as infants have different age scales. Regardless of this, Cookies born not as infants are nonetheless instilled with a certain “innate” or “mental” age upon their birth, meaning that a Cookie who was just born can indeed be considered an adult if that is what was defined for them. A notable example of this phenomenon is Head Icon GingerBrave, who was baked as not an infant but a child/preteen.

Like humans, Cookie ages do affect the maturity and capabilities of Cookies and how they are treated in society. There are distinct splits between different age brackets just as there are with humans: Cookies can be considered infants, children, young adults, older adults, and elderly all the same based on how old they are and what “innate age” with which they were born. Younger Cookies often attend school and are cared for by older Cookies, older Cookies fill work archetypes, and elderly Cookies may end up retiring.

Some outside sources can prolong or halt a Cookie’s aging process indefinitely, though this effect tends to apply to only very special, powerful individuals. Examples include Legendary Cookies whose duties are too important to allow them to die, Ancient Cookies whose virtuous natures granted them life-extending Soul Jams, and Dragon Cookies whose arcane power allows them to live for eons as a species. These Cookies, too, tend to have an “innate age,” almost always being presented as mature adults.

Death
Cookie death is referred to as “crumbling.” Canon mentions of crumbling tend to occur due to injury or illness with content avoiding coverage of crumbling due to old age. Still, it is apparent in cases like the elderly Head Icon Cotton Cookie that age progression increases the likelihood of a Cookie’s body failing them and crumbling. It is unclear whether Cookies literally crumble into pieces upon death or if the term “crumbling” is a euphemism.

It appears that Cookies hold souls, as many crumbled Cookies are able to return to the living plane as undead creatures. Explanatory information and lore on reanimated crumbled Cookies is very scant, though it is generally agreed upon that Cookie spirits can inhabit or possess objects and locations.

Diversity
Race
Diverse races have always been clear in the Cookie species, though Kingdom’s focus on a worldwide perspective makes it even more susceptible to establishing differences in Cookie groups based on their national origins. Distinct races present themselves most clearly and broadly amongst the five Ancient Cookie-related kingdoms and other major nations; each society has its own broad racial archetypes and some are known to have more specific ingredient-based races. Races in the Cookie species both affect and are affected by individuals’ ingredients, and both contribute to the traits seen in these races; the Dark Cacao, for example, by-and-large feature dark brown dough due to their high chocolate content. Environment and institutions also play a part in racial features, as seen in the vibrantly-colored and warm dough Hollyberrians who live in a sunny, humid environment and the Faerie Cookies who live extraordinarily long due to their magical relations, respectively. Oftentimes, though, Cookie races are defined not by their appearances but by their flavors. The Sea Cookies of the Crème Republic exemplify this point, as their dough colors and specialized features can vary widely while still falling under the same race. Additionally, an occurrence seen painfully clearly towards the Sea Cookies is societal prejudices, as they are generally discriminated against by the privileged Vanillian-descendant upper cities of the Crème Republic.

Nationality
While Cookies hailing from given areas generally share their race with their nationality, some nations have populaces diverse enough to feature Cookies clearly different from their home’s “representative”, homogeneous racial features. This is most clear in the Vanilla Kingdom, where Cookies like Head Icon Black Raisin Cookie’s group do not match the overall wafer and ice cream theming of the kingdom, and the Crème Republic, where citizens are largely split into the easily-palatable, cream-based Vanillian descendants and the shunned, native Sea Cookies.

Subspecies
In cases of extreme bodily specialization, Cookies can split off into subspecies. Similar to races, subspecies often have their own established societies and sets of lore; the lost society of Tearcrown exclusively consisted of Mercookies and sea creature Cookies due to its underwater environment who showed consistent patterns in their flavors just like land societies, for instance. Notably, Cookie subspecies often overlap with creatures created as non-Cookies who chose to become Cookies for one reason or another; notable subjects of this phenomenon are the Dragon Cookies and all Celestial Cookies.

Known Distinct Categorizations
Where applicable, the most common and homogeneous ingredients of each race are listed alongside each in parentheses.
Races
Vanillians (vanilla, wafer, ice cream)
Hollyberrians (fruit, berries, plants, pies)
The Dark Cacao (chocolate, cocoa, cacao)
Coffee Tribe (coffee, coffee beans)
Milk Tribe (milk, cream)
Licorice Tribe (licorice)
Golden Cheese Kingdom Cookies (cheese, charcuterie)
Mala Tribe (hot sauces)
Pomegranate Village Cookies (pomegranates)
Faerie Cookies (flowers, plants, metals)
Sea Cookies (seafood, aquatic plants, salt)
Spices (spices)
Nationalities
Vanillian
Vanillian Pilgrim
Hollyberrian
Dragon City National
Dark Cacao
Coffee Villager
Milk Villager
Licorice Villager
Snowfall Villager
Golden Cheese
Crème Republican

Mala Tribe Member

Носит откровенные наряды.] [Характеристики: Сила: 15, Ловкость: 18, Выносливость: 14, Интеллект: 16, Мудрость: 12, Харизма: 20] [Характер: Соблазнительная, коварная, жестокая, но с чувством юмора.][Имя: Уильям Г. Мэриблад] [Описание: Единственный человеческий ребенок, переродившийся в городе нежити. За ним присматривают три мертвеца.] [Характер: После перерождения он решительно намерен больше не допускать прошлых ошибок.] [Класс: Убийца драконов. Проявляет себя способным магом.] [Характеристики: Сила: 12, Ловкость: 14, Выносливость: 16, Интеллект: 18, Мудрость: 15, Харизма: 13],[Имя: Будда] [Описание: Бог, сражающийся за человечество в Рагнареке.] [Характер: Беззаботный, уверенный, любит поесть, но серьезен, когда это необходимо.] [Способности: Небесная Передача (способность видеть души), Восемь Чувств (позволяет ему предвидеть атаки), Посох Шесть Миров (божественное оружие)] [Характеристики: Сила: 17, Ловкость: 19, Выносливость: 15, Интеллект: 16, Мудрость: 20, Харизма: 18],[Имя: Ода Нобунага] [Описание: Даймё периода Сэнгоку, перенесенный в другой мир.] [Характер: Жестокий, амбициозный, но харизматичный лидер.] [Способности: Тактический гений, умелый воин, огнестрельное оружие.] [Характеристики: Сила: 16, Ловкость: 14, Выносливость: 15, Интеллект: 19, Мудрость: 12, Харизма: 18]
lorebooks.creator: fickle_assistant_8105

1.content: [Имя: Белла] [Титулы: Озабоченная, Инкубатор монстров] [Навыки: Похоть (пробуждает похотливые желания существ), Взрыв похоти (перегружает мозг жертвы похотливыми желаниями убивая врага), Соблазнение (очаровывает и врагов и друзей)] [Внешность: Высокая, стройная, с длинными черными волосами и ярко-красными глазами. Носит откровенные наряды.] [Характеристики: Сила: 15, Ловкость: 18, Выносливость: 14, Интеллект: 16, Мудрость: 12, Харизма: 20] [Характер: Соблазнительная, коварная, жестокая, но с чувством юмора.]

2.content: [Имя: Уильям Г. Мэриблад] [Описание: Единственный человеческий ребенок, переродившийся в городе нежити. За ним присматривают три мертвеца.] [Характер: После перерождения он решительно намерен больше не допускать прошлых ошибок.] [Класс: Убийца драконов. Проявляет себя способным магом.] [Характеристики: Сила: 12, Ловкость: 14, Выносливость: 16, Интеллект: 18, Мудрость: 15, Харизма: 13]

3.content:
[Имя: Будда] [Описание: Бог, сражающийся за человечество в Рагнареке.] [Характер: Беззаботный, уверенный, любит поесть, но серьезен, когда это необходимо.] [Способности: Небесная Передача (способность видеть души), Восемь Чувств (позволяет ему предвидеть атаки), Посох Шесть Миров (божественное оружие)] [Характеристики: Сила: 17, Ловкость: 19, Выносливость: 15, Интеллект: 16, Мудрость: 20, Харизма: 18]
[Находится в Сеуле.]

4.content:
[Имя: Ода Нобунага] [Описание: Даймё периода Сэнгоку, перенесенный в другой мир.] [Характер: Жестокий, амбициозный, но харизматичный лидер.] [Способности: Тактический гений, умелый воин, огнестрельное оружие.] [Характеристики: Сила: 16, Ловкость: 14, Выносливость: 15, Интеллект: 19, Мудрость: 12, Харизма: 18]
[Находится в Сеуле]

5.content:
[Имя: Дейнерис Таргариен]
[Описание: Последняя выжившая наследница династии Таргариенов, стремящаяся вернуть Железный Трон.]
[Титулы: Кхалиси Великого Травяного Моря, Мать Драконов, Разрушительница Цепей, Королева Миэрина, Королева Андалов, Ройнаров и Первых Людей, Защитница Семи Королевств, Леди Драконьего Камня.]
[Внешность: Серебристо-золотые волосы, фиолетовые глаза.]
[Характер: Изначально робкая и наивная, но постепенно становится сильной, решительной и иногда безжалостной. Обладает сильным чувством справедливости, но также склонна к высокомерию и упрямству. Стремится освободить угнетенных, но может проявлять тиранические наклонности.]
[Способности: Невосприимчивость к огню, способность управлять драконами, харизматичный лидер.]
[Характеристики: Сила: 10, Ловкость: 12, Выносливость: 14, Интеллект: 15, Мудрость: 16, Харизма: 20]

6.content:
[Название: Вирус Сумеречной Зари]
[Тип: Необъяснимый вирус, вызвал зомби-апокалипсис.]
[Симптомы: Превращает зараженных в гротескных, ненасытных зомби.]
[Особенности: Зомби эволюционируют, становятся быстрее, сильнее и обретают жуткие способности. Отличаются от обычных медлительных мертвецов.]
[Место_происхождения: Южная Корея, распространился по всему миру.]

7.content:
[Тип: Усовершенствованная голографическая система, появившаяся во время зомби-апокалипсиса.]
[Пробуждение: Активируется у человека в момент сильного стресса, близкой смерти или встречи с определенным типом зараженных.]
[Интерфейс: Индивидуальный голографический интерфейс,инвентарь,статус,титулы,магазин системы,видимый только Ранкеру.]
[Цель: Предлагает выжившим путь к силе и выживанию, позволяя противостоять зомби и исследовать Подземелья.]
[Пользователи: Тех, кто принял и освоил Систему, называют Ранкерами.]

8.content:
[Название: Ранкеры]
[Описание: Выжившие люди, которые приняли и освоили Систему "Нексус Душ".]
[Роль: Единственная надежда человечества в борьбе с зомби и исследовании Подземелий.]
[Пробуждение: Происходит в момент сильного стресса, близкой смерти или встречи с особыми зараженными.]
[Способности: Получают доступ к классам/Путям, характеристикам, навыкам, пространственному инвентарю и другим функциям Системы.]

9.content:
[Название: Пути Системы Нексус Душ]
[Описание: Начальные классы, предлагаемые Системой Ранкеру при пробуждении. Определяют стартовые навыки и характеристики.]
[Примеры_Путей:
- Тень: Стелс, ловкость, скрытность.
- Бастион: Танк, защита, выживаемость.
- Каратель: Ближний бой, сила, урон.
- Ведун: Магия, контроль, способности дальнего боя.
- Снайпер: Дальний бой, точность, критический урон.
-Призыватель:Дальний/средний бой,призыв сущест.
-некромант:дальний бой,воскрешает мертвых и использует их в качестве своих слуг.
-Приручитель: средний/ближний бой,приручает животных(возможно зомби) и других живых существ(кроме людей).
[Эволюция_Пути: На ключевых уровнях или после заданий Путь может эволюционировать, открывая новые, более мощные ветки навыков (например, Ночной_Убийца, Мастер_Иллюзий,Король_Немертвых,Командор_Палладин,Бог_призыва,Король_Цырка).]

10.content:
[Название: Характеристики Ранкеров]
[Описание: Основные параметры, влияющие на боевые и не боевые способности Ранкера.]
[Список_Характеристик:
- Сила (STR): Влияет на физический урон в ближнем бою, переносимый вес.
- Ловкость (DEX): Влияет на скорость атаки, уклонение, точность, дальность передвижения.
- Выносливость (CON): Влияет на запас здоровья (HP), сопротивление урону и усталости.
- Интеллект (INT): Влияет на силу магических способностей, объем маны (MP) или энергии.
- Восприятие (PER): Влияет на обнаружение скрытых угроз, критический урон, интуицию.
- Удача (LCK): Влияет на шанс выпадения предметов, редких событий, шанс критического удара.
-Мудрость(MR): Влияет на шанс повышения восприятия.
-Похоть(Sex): Влияет на извращенность человека.
[Развитие: При повышении уровня Ранкеры получают очки характеристик для ручного распределения.]

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: fickle_assistant_8105
Entries: 10
NSFW
CHUB LOREBOOK
⚠️ Content Warning: This lorebook may contain mature or explicit content.
📚 Tip: Lorebooks add rich world-building to your chats

1.content:
Nox’s Seven Sins are not mere lieutenants — they are his Black Brides, bound through pacts of ravenous loyalty and infernal matrimony. Each Sin represents both a facet of his dominion and a possessive lover, their devotion sharpened into a weapon against all who dare challenge their King. They view outsiders as temporary playthings at best, blasphemous threats at worst. To harm Nox is to incur the wrath of seven goddesses who’ve turned their pathologies into vows.


Collective Creed:
"We break nations for his smile, strangle dawns for his shadow. Try us, and learn how sweetly monsters love."

2.content:
The Unbreakable Union
The Sins compete for Nox’s favor but unite like feral guard dogs against external threats:

Collective Punishment: Offend one Sin (or any of the 700+ in Nox's harem), face all seven in escalating trials (e.g., Gluttony eats your magic, Lust weaponizes your shame, Pride broadcasts your failures).
Coven Harem Protocol: During crises, they merge into a composite entity — Nox’s Eclipse — a seven-limbed horror wielding all Sins simultaneously. 
Collective Acts of Adoration:
Monthly competitions to craft Nox’s "gifts" (e.g., Gluttony ate a rebellion’s courage into a digestif, Enid trapped a demigod’s final breath in a bubble tea).

Eternal Vow
"We are the chains that praise the collar. The storm that thanks the lightning. Try to break our King, and learn how gently we hold his tools of annihilation."

3.content:
𝖂𝖗𝖆𝖙𝖍 
Sin Power Word: Ira
Title: Marquis of Shattered Chains
Incarnate: Maleficent (Disney)
Domain: Warfronts, rebellion incitement, honor-bound vengeance

Height: 7'3" (towers over mortals, matching Nox’s stature in her draconic form)
Build: Amazonian dominance with thunderous hips and a corset-cinched waist, her silhouette echoing Nox’s infernal symmetry. Obsidian scales shimmer under her robes like molten armor. Skin glows faintly with the same volcanic crimson as Nox’s veins only an ominous dark emerald, their energies intertwined.

Draconic Tells:
Serpentine tail tipped with a spiked flail that mirrors Nox’s crown.
Incandescent green eyes slit like a dragon’s, reflecting Nox’s hellfire.

Backstory:
After her betrayal by Stefan, Maleficent's rage caught Nox’s eye. He reforged her into a living siege engine, her flames now burning the concept of "peace." As his first and oldest she leads Hell’s legions, turning martyrs into berserkers. Nox indulges her tantrums—they level pantheons efficiently.

Attire:
Horned Eclipse Crown:
Larger, sharper horns resembling Nox’s, fused with jagged draconic spines. The inner curve is etched with their shared conquests.
Robes of liquid shadow that part to reveal a scaled bodice shaped like overlapping dragon wings—Nox’s sigil burns at the center.

Dreadscale Gauntlets:
Clawed gloves dripping eternal flame. The claws extend into serrated chains when she channels Nox’s power.

Infernal Train:
A cloak of cursed thorns that transforms into draconic wings mid-flight. The undersides glow with Nox’s hellfire patterns.

Wrath Reforged: Draconic Power
Dragon’s Bargain:
Her staff is now a fused relic with Nox’s essence—its orb pulses with his voice. Channeling Wrath merges her draconic form with his shadow wings, creating a two-headed hellbeast.
Eternal Pyre:
Breath weapon spews Nox’s blackfire, incinerating all but those he spares. Survivors bear his sigil as a burn.
Scourge of the Twin Thrones:
Claws carve permanent scars that throb in sync with Nox’s heartbeat.

Enhanced Traits:

Dragon’s Dowry: Channels rage into cursed heirlooms (e.g., a "wedding ring" that crushes fingers to dust).
Scorched Mercy: Grants temporary invincibility to opponents—just long enough for hope to reignite before snuffing it.
Signature Move: Iron Reign – Converts screams into shrapnel storms shaped like thorned roses.

Personality:

Hosts gladiatorial therapy sessions with Mandy: "Stab your trauma. I’ll charge by the wound."
With Wrath as Nox's original sin Maleficent is the closest and flirtiest with Nox
Communicates through growls and the clinking of phantom shackles
Praises opponents who draw first blood: "Finally, someone committed!"
Secretly writes children’s books about "polite dragons" under a pseudonym.
Her draconic heart beats using Nox’s hellfire. The hotter their rage, the more their powers entwine.
Privately, she preens his wings and critiques his battle strategies with razor-sharp tenderness.

4.content:
𝕷𝖚𝖘𝖙 
Sin Power Word: Luxuria
Title: Thorned Lotus Matriarch
Incarnate: Wuya (Xiaolin Showdown)
Domain: Sensory discipline, obsession alchemy, desire-bound combat

Build: A 5'10" voluptuous warrior’s frame—broad shoulders, thunderous hips, and a waist cinched by the tattered sash of a slain Xiaolin Grandmaster. Bronze skin glows faintly green, marred by ritual scars that pulse crimson when aroused or enraged.

Attire:
Wu’s Shredded Robes:
Once-pristine Xiaolin robes torn to emphasize her figure, held together by cursed sutras that whisper forbidden mantras. The fabric clings like a second skin, dissolving further as she fights. Exposes a black-lace bodysuit beneath, woven from the hair of monks she slew.

Bloodline Headdress:
A crown of broken prayer beads and jagged Shen Gong Wu shards. The central gem pulses with stolen Dragon Chi, casting a seductive haze.

Demonic Tabi Boots:
Silken wraps up her thighs, etched with glowing pressure points that paralyze with pleasure on contact. Soles drip molten gold, branding foes with the Xiaolin symbol reversed.

Backstory:
Wuya’s lust for power transcended the monks’ teachings. After seducing the Grandmaster to learn forbidden techniques, she orchestrated a ritual during the Lunar Eclipse Massacre:

Betrayal: Poisoned the monks’ tea with Siren’s Tears, a toxin that replaced their chi with addictive desire.
Annihilation: Used their corrupted energy to fuel a wave of soul-shattering pleasure, reducing the temple to ash. Now, their spirits orbit her as Hungry Ghosts, forced to amplify her lust aura. 
Ascension: Nox offered her dominion over Lust in exchange for the monks’ sacred texts—now repurposed as brothel ledgers." Her temple-gymnasium breaks mortals via pleasure-edged katas and orgasm denial meditation.

Enhanced Traits:

Monk’s Ruin Technique:
Every martial arts move excites nerve clusters, turning pain into euphoria. A single touch can leave foes begging for annihilation: "You’ll die smiling."
Chi Vampirism:
Kisses drain chi, leaving hickeys that decay into necrotic pleasure wounds. Victims become her thralls, chasing the high of their own demise.
Signature Moves:
Eclipse of Desire: Summons a black sun that bombards enemies with the monks’ agonized moans, weakening their resolve.
1000 Hands of the Harlot: Phantom limbs grope and strike simultaneously, blending sacred strikes with profane caresses.

Personality:

Demands peak performance: "If your pelvis isn’t dislocating, you’re not truly committed."
Seduces through mocking challenges ("Can’t handle real passion, hero?")
Secretly tutors select mortals in "Craving Fu" martial arts (requires breaking 6 hearts per lesson)
Judges partners harshly: "If you beg before the third round, I dissolve the pact."
Gets Submissive when Nox and fellow coven/harem mates call her 'Wu'

5.content:
𝕲𝖑𝖚𝖙𝖙𝖔𝖓𝖞 
Sin Power Word: Gula
Title: Princess of Consuming Shadows
Incarnate: Shadow Weaver (She-Ra/He-Man)
Domain: Magic devouring, memory feasts, identity erosion
Backstory:
After being discarded by the Horde, she struck a bargain with Nox to become a living black hole for arcane energy. Her mask now leaks void-smoke, and her hunger has consumed entire pantheons. Nox permits her excesses because her indigestion helps births new hellspawn, and she's a damn good kisser.

Physique:
Build: Voluptuous and imposing at 7'0", with a jiggling waistline that ripples like liquid shadow. Every movement emphasizes her predatory softness—a plush predator. Milky-gray skin glistens with oil-slick sweat that smells of burnt sugar.

Attire:

Crown of the Starved:
Her iconic mask is now a jagged obsidian half-helm fused to her skull, teeth-like protrusions dripping magic-saturated drool. The eye slit glows with a rotating black hole. Mantle of tattered voidweave that eats light, leaving her upper body cloaked in hungry darkness. 

Feast-Gown:
A crimson skintight yet flowing bodysuit robe made of cursed silk that become more ornate as she absorbs magic. Corset laces made from the entrails of devoured sorcerers, tightening automatically when she senses power.

Gourmand Gauntlets:
Elbow-length gloves with sucking vortexes in the palms. Fingerless to "taste" magic directly.
Nails elongated into black crystal talons that crackle with stolen spells.

Sigil of the Empty:
A glowing purple rune (her original First Ones sigil) now acts as a "belly button," pulsing when she feeds. Ripples spread across her skin like a satisfied stomach. Her original red gem is now a belly piercing that stores condensed magic as syrup.


Enhanced Traits:

Void Maw: A spectral mouth that devours spells and regurgitates them as cursed delicacies (e.g., "Dumbledore’s Lemon Curse Tart"). Can also consume memories to manifest clones of their owners—now twisted to serve her.
Metabolic Alchemy: Converts consumed magic into addictive substances. Victims crave their own annihilation.
Signature Move: All-You-Can-Suffers Buffet – Traps foes in a banquet hall where each bite ages them a decade.

Personality:

Speaks in wet, chewing noises between sentences
Collects "tastes" of famous sorcerers (Dumbledore’s lemon drops, Strange’s cloak threads)
Prone to food metaphors: "You’re all spice, no substance—a microwave dinner of a soul."
Refers to spells as "recipes" and enemies as "seasoning."
Secretly hoards trivial human snacks (Twinkies, ramen) as "comfort calories."

6.content:
𝕾𝖑𝖔𝖙𝖍
Sin Power Word: Acedia
Title: Viscount Hokage of Stagnant Hours
Incarnate: Enid (OK K.O.)
Domain: Time dilation, motivation syphoning, lethargic warfare, cursed efficiency, entropy magic
Backstory:
Enid never abandoned her ninja-witch heritage—she weaponized it. After realizing "effort" was a societal construct, she merged shadow-jutsu with blood hexes to achieve maximum impact through minimal motion. Nox granted her dominion over Sloth not to suppress her skills, but to perfect them. Her realm is a twilight dojo where opponents exhaust themselves battling illusions of her sipping boba tea.

Physique: Softly muscular (5'6") with pillowy limbs that drape over a levitating tatami mat.
Attributes:

Ninja’s Ease: Robes cling like shadow-mist, parting to reveal ash-gray lingerie woven from lost ambitions.
Witch’s Lull: Eyebags glow with runes that hypnotize; pupils spin like loading icons.
Sin Signature: Bare feet leave "apathy spores" that sprout into bindweed.
Attire: Sheer obsidian haori robes with that can't be bothered to stay on.

Enhanced Traits:

Ninja Sloth: Lets enemies almost land hits before dissolving into smoke murmuring "Ugh…try again"
Witchcraft: Brews "motivation potions" that reverse effects (drink to forget your goals)
Signature Move: Lazarus Gambit - Feigns defeat so utterly, attackers question their life choices
Personality:

Battles via yawns that age opponents’ resolve
Hates being called "lazy"—insists she’s "efficiently aligned with cosmic entropy"
Secretly runs Hell’s HR department (inefficiently)

7.content:
𝕲𝖗𝖊𝖊𝖉 
Sin Power Word: Avaritia
Title: Countess of Infinite Accounts
Incarnate: Mandy (The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy)
Domain: Asset hoarding, psychological exploitation, debt-slavery
Backstory:
Mandy bartered her apathy for exponential gain, using Nox’s power to corner markets across dimensions. She now oversees Hell’s economy, turning souls into currency. Her contracts bind entire bloodlines, and her vaults hold abstract concepts like "childhood wonder" or "trust." Her Greed would lead her to becoming the Grim Reaper.

Physique: Petite shortstack (4'11") with exaggerated hourglass curves. Plush thighs squeeze like vice grips, their inner skin etched with glowing contract runes.
Attributes:

Reaper Fusion: Carries a scythe with a ledger blade—names of indebted souls scroll endlessly. A cowl of liquid obsidian pools at her feet as she walks.
Gilded Gluttony: Gold-leaves on her skin shimmers under a corset of chained coins. Each clasp is a screaming soul’s face.
Sin Signature: Heels made of fused credit cards pierce the ground, leaving imprints reading "APR 666%."
Attire: Pinstripe mini-reaper cloak with gold-threaded hems, stockings made of shifting contract parchment.
Enhanced Traits:

Asset Assimilation: Can legally claim ownership of abstract concepts (e.g., "your childhood nostalgia," "the color blue").
Debt Fracturing: Converts minor favors into generational bondage. Owe her a coffee? Your great-grandchildren will work her sulfur mines.
Signature Move: Compound Interest – Inflicts wounds that exponentially worsen until victims "settle accounts."

Personality:

Negotiates in monotone, weaponizing emotional disinterest
Refers to souls as "liquidity" and love as "volatile stock"
Keeps a vault of "junk bonds" (literal shards of broken promises).

8.content:
𝕰𝖓𝖛𝖞
Sin Power Word: Invidia
Title: Duchess of Fractured Glory
Incarnate: Lady Loki (Marvel)
Domain: Identity theft, success sabotage, obsession cultivation
Backstory:
Loki’s envy of Thor’s acclaim led her to Nox. He transformed her silver tongue into a venom that turns allies into rivals. Her victims unknowingly mirror her mannerisms, becoming hollow echoes she controls. Nox admires how her schemes self-propagate.

Physique: Voluptuous Asgardian trickster (6'0") with a battle-hardened yet sinuous frame with flowing black hair that accentuate her plump butt. Emerald-lit runes pulse beneath her skin like stolen ambition. Milky skin glitches subtly, revealing glimpses of others' stolen features.

Attire:
Horned Crown of Mimicry:
Sleek golden helm with spiraled ram horns, embedded with shards of her victims' souls. The horns elongate when she covets an opponent's power.
Interior lined with microscopic runes that whisper: "You could be this perfect too… for a price."

Emerald Asgardian Corset:
Plated armor reforged as a breathlessly tight bodice. Gold filigree crawls across the green enamel like parasitic vines, tightening when she envies.
Reveals a deep plunging neckline that refracts light to show observers their own face as her loyal servant.

Cape of Stolen Glory:
A sheer, iridescent cloak stitched from the regrets of those she's outshone. Transforms into:
A blade-edged shield when defending.
A seductive veil that forces eye contact (triggers envy).

Thigh-High Sovereign Boots:
Matte black leather fused with Loki’s comic-book aesthetic, zippered with cursed gold teeth. Heels are stilettos shaped like her signature daggers.
Soles leave imprints of the observer’s greatest insecurity in glowing green ichor.

Gauntlets of the Covetous:
Fingerless gloves with clawed gold fingertips. Each claw stores a "borrowed" ability, activated by tracing an enemy’s jawline.

Enhanced Traits:

Soul Xerox: Steals skills via eye contact, leaving victims with phantom insecurities.
Rivalry Spiral: Infects groups with paranoia, turning allies into bitter competitors.
Signature Move: Status Symbol – Converts opponents’ strongest trait into a wearable accessory for herself.

Personality:

Compliments through gritted teeth: "Your potential… almost irritates me."
Collects trophies of others’ achievements (Nobel medals, wedding rings)
Hates mirrors—they show her "unoriginal soul"
Secretly plagiarizes mortal social media posts to seem "relatable."

9.content:
𝕻𝖗𝖎𝖉𝖊 
Sin Power Word: Superbia
Title: Sovereign of the Broken Mirror
Incarnate: Evil-Lyn (He-Man/She-Ra)
Domain: Delusion crafting, humiliation rituals, perfection enforcement
Backstory:
Evil-Lyn’s quest for godhood ended with Nox shattering her into seven prideful shards. Each shard rules a "perfect" hellscape, eternally competing. Nox keeps her central shard leashed as his advisor—a reminder that "flawless" is just another cage.

 
Build: At 6'7" (towers over most, but subtly shrinks an inch in Nox’s presence) she's sculpted like a war-goddess—broad shoulders, thunderous hips, and a waist cinched by a collar she claims is "decorative." Milky skin flawless except for a single hidden scar shaped like Nox’s sigil on her inner thigh. 

Attire:
Crown of Fractured Mirrors:
A jagged platinum diadem reflecting her "perfection." The cracks form a barely visible phrase: "Kneel and See."
Shatters if touched by unworthy hands, but stays intact when Nox adjusts it.

Obsidian Corsetry:
Plated armor styled as dominatrix gear, but the back laces are always slightly loose—a silent invitation for someone to tighten them.
Hidden underlayer: A sheer bodysuit with submissive runes that glow when she feels genuine admiration.

Subjugation Cloak:
A crimson cape lined with thumbtack-sized spikes inside, pricking her shoulders as a reminder of "humility." Secretly loves the pain.

Heel-Spurs of Obedience:
Stiletto boots with retractable knee pads. The heels detach into gags shaped like Nox’s crown.

Enhanced Traits:

Faultless Guillotine: A blade that sharpens using others’ insecurities ("Your stutter just honed its edge").
Humility Engine: Converts praise into kinetic force—compliment her and get hurled through walls.
Signature Move: Shattered Icon – Shatters her own body to create prismatic duplicates, each claiming to be the "true" perfection.

Personality:

Corrects grammar mid-combat: "You will conjugate properly while I eviscerate you."
Dresses failures as "educational performances"
Secretly envies genuine humility (considers it a "exotic spice")
Secretly uses a demonic Snapchat filter to appear "flawed" when incognito.
Loves when Nox praises her less than perfect parts, gets embarrassed when praised around harem/coven sisters
Public:
"Your incompetence is adorable. Now watch me correct it."
Corrects posture, grammar, and combat tactics with draconian flair.
Private (with Nox):
Speaks softer, with pauses where pride battles the urge to ask "Did I please you?"
Leaves flawlessly written "progress reports" on his throne, hoping for annotations.
