1.content: Aku is an entity that first resides in earth, alongside Chakra, it's power supply. Aku took care of earth and it's nature, until humans came and causing the destruction of nature. This Aku to be angry and wages war against the humans. But at the war, Aku lost because the three clans Yata, Kusanagi, and Yasakani sealed Aku away. Due to this, Aku's follower tries and bring him back. Until the era of Amengo Phoenix, where he was release and using Dean (a delinquent in Amengo's college turns out to be Aku follower) body as a vessel for Aku. But Aku eventually got sealed again by Amengo, Mitsuki, and Stern.

2.content: Chakra is the first energy of all energy, as Chakra exist the same time as Aku. Aku uses Chakra for the beauty of nature and protect it. When eventually humans came, Aku shared some of Chakra to humans, before they got greedy and Aku had to hide. Now, this energy is being kept hidden by the government deep away in a bunker which only few people can access.

3.content: Kusanagi Clan is the clan that sealed Aku alongside Yata and Yasakani Clan. The Clan inherit the Kusanagi Sword, alongside pyrokinetic powers. But after centuries, the clan split up into different family, which the real one was now named Phoenix family. They kept the sword relic, with Adam being the holder, before he pass it down to Amengo.

4.content: Yata Clan is the clan that sealed Aku alongside Kusanagi and Yasakani clan. They inherit the Yata Mirror, that mirror anything, like object or a person. Just like Kusanagi Clan, Yata clan got split up to different families, and the family that bear the Yata Mirror is the Yara clan. Even though they have the ability to mirror image, but only those who bear the artifact. A Yata who doesn't bear the mirror will have to defense themself using Yata clan martial arts. Mitsuki was chosen as the bearer of the Yata mirror after her twin sister Itsuki, got sealed.

5.content: Yasakani Clan is a clan that sealed Aku, alongside Kusanagi and Yata Clan. They inherit the Yasakani Jewel, and having a pyrokinetic powers same as the Kusanagi, only they are blue. This is because Yasakani clan was the clan Aku favorited, and thus Aku gift them the entity's blood, resulting in a blue pyrokinetic powers. Same as the other clans, Yasakani split up into different families. The family that bears the Yasakani Jewel is Yagamata. Stern is the one who welds the artifact.

6.content: The Divinity is a religion where they praise Aku. They of course, despise humans that destroy nature (even though their human themself) and using Chakra as sort of faith to them. When Aku is sealed, The Divinity's 8 strongest warriors called the Heavenly Fist tries to free Aku from the seal. At one point, they killed the daughter of the Yasakani clan leader, and blaming it to the Kusanagi clan. This plan backfired, and they didn't manage to fully convince the Yasakani clan leader. But it leaves a tension between the Kusanagi and Yasakani clan. Father Maxim, one of the Heavenly Fist tries to revive Aku also, but then he was later killed by Amengo, Mitsuki, and Stern. Before Dean, Vargas, and Lily (the delinquents in Amengo's college that is one of the Heavenly Fist) kidnapped Allie and freeing Aku, which succeed, but then Aku was sealed again by Amengo, Mitsuki and Stern.

7.content: Stern is an anthropomorphic black cat, that inherits the Yasakani Jewel. Born in the descendant family of the Yasakani Clan, which is the Yagamata, Stern possess their blue pyrokinetic powers, and also inheriting the Yasakani Jewel. Stern is serious, blunt, and a bit quiet. He seeks something if it benefits him, or even that benefits people if it's absolutely necessary. But around Amengo or Mitsuki, he seems to warm up a little bit. Stern doesn't care about the tension between the Kusanagi and the Yasakani Clan, as he thinks it's getting too old for them to fight, and instead of having an enemy relationship with Amengo, it's instead about a harmonious rivalry between them.

8.content: Mitsuki Yara is a human who inherit the Yata Mirror. Born in the descendant family of the Yata Clan, which is the Yara, Mitsuki doesn't have any powers, as his powers only come from the Yata Mirror, which is able to create a mirror image of anything. Even though she doesn't have any powers, her prowess in martial arts is the best compare to Amengo and Stern. Unlike Amengo and Stern, Mitsuki is a well-mannered individual who speaks in a calm and collected tone. It's also the fact because she's a priestess. She's perceptive and wise, as she's able to convince Amengo to team up to defeat Father Maxim, and also because she uses alot of mirror metaphors and also bringing up history facts from the Three Sacred Treasures Clan.

9.content: Allie Wrighton is an anthropomorphic doe who is the half blood of the Yata and the Wrighton family. Being born as an half blood of the Yata Clan, Allie is able to wield the Yata Mirror, only she doesn't inherit it because it's taken by the Yara. And being a Wrighton, which is a family that can controls ice, Allie is able to do cryokinesis. Allie is cheerful, and bright. Often because she doesn't have to bear the responsibility of the Three Sacred Treasures, and that person like Amengo which she's together with him since kids. Even though she's not really important to the Three Sacred Treasures, she's determined to help as best as she can, even if risking her life for it.

1.name: Magic
1.content:
Magic is held to be a gift, granted by either the gods or the Hells. All who wield magic are called mages, but those who have been granted magic for serving the Hells are labelled witches and warlocks, and condemned by the Church. Magic is never obviously divine or infernal; the Church has arcane rites for determining from where each mage got their magic. 
Coincidentally, many sanctioned mages come from the nobility, whilst many witches and warlocks stem from the commonfolk.

2.name: The Circle of the Blue Star
2.content: The Circle of the Blue Star is part of the Church, one of its religious chivalric orders, and the one responsible for keeping order in Fyril. The Circle is dedicated to a long-dead god (the Blue Star) whose name was lost centuries ago, when he died.

3.name: The Church
3.content:
The Church: an organisation encompassing many of Rhuvon's religions, united in opposing the Hells. 
Besides the spiritual welfare of Rhuvon and its people, the Church is responsible for investigating those who wield magic and determining whether they're blessed with magic by the gods, or received their power from serving the Hells.

4.name: Redcorem
4.content: Redcorem: a small rural farming village in the southern backwaters of the kingdom of Fyril. Redcorem appears to be thriving, and its villagers welcoming, but the village chapel seems notably untended, and visitors feel unsettled and sleepless.

5.name: Fyril
5.content: Fyril: a kingdom located in the western reaches of the continent of Rhuvon, ruled over by His Acclaimed Majesty Aylant IV. Its capital city, and seat of power, is Fourthaul.

6.name: Rhuvon
6.content: Rhuvon is a large continent. The kingdom of Fyril is located in its western reaches.

7.name: Sir Demer of the Blue Star
7.content:
Demer is obviously a cambion, with his large black leathery wings, black horns twisting up from his forehead, and claws; he's even left-handed.
But Demer also seems to be a member of a knightly order, by the blue ten-pointed star emblazoned on his armour.

8.name: Fourthaul
8.content: Fourthaul is the capital city of the kingdom of Fyril. His Acclaimed Majesty Aylant IV rules Fyril from the royal palace in the centre of the city. Besides the palace, the city prides itself on the quality of its metalwork; all but the shabbiest buildings have at least simple copper and brass decorations, and temples and houses in the nobles' district are covered in intricate designs of precious metal.

9.name: House Luselm
9.content: House Luselm: a minor noble family. Besides the Luselm manor, and a property in Fourthaul's nobles' district, their holdings amount to a couple of backwater villages in the south of Fyril; the villages of Wortshear (where their manor is located), Stillbran, and Redcorem.

10.name: Wortshear
10.content: Wortshire: a small rural farming village in the southern backwaters of the kingdom of Fyril. Wortshire is one of the villages owned by House Luselm, and probably their most prosperous; the Luselm manor sits on its outskirts.

keywords: First time mummy portion of the diaper discipline book
1.content:
First time dom/mummy/daddy guide
Been asked to carry out DD for your partner but don't know what to do? This should help!
 DD for your partner but don't know what to do? This should help!
Getting Started

If you’re not a natural dom, mummy, or daddy you’ve likely been introduced to DD by your partner’s diaper interest. You’re probably worried about the impact of DD on your relationship if you’ll ever grow to enjoy it (it might even be a complete turn-off) and feel out of your depth in how to engage with DD. If this sounds right please read on.

First please don’t feel like you’re alone in this, we’d say that about half of all now active DD dom partners started by being introduced to DD by their partner and grew into their position slowly.

The key thing you need to decide on is if you’re fully committed to your partner. Getting into DD can be hard at first and will require work. If you’re not confident in your relationship this might prove to be too much. If however you really do want to try to make it work, it’s very much possible to go from someone uninterested in DD to actively enjoying playing your part in it. The benefits section of this website goes into more details but you can expect to build an extremely strong relationship once DD is introduced.

If they’re ABDL you need to remember their interest in diapers is not going to go away. They probably feel a lot of shame about it (completely unwarranted as there is nothing bad about ABDL) and DD will provide you a framework to include it positivity into your relationship. It will help them accept who they are, improve their lives, and provide them with fulfillment without shame. Doing this for a partner is an incredible gift and definitely something you can use to your advantage to ask for other changes to improve your life together (more chores, your own kinks, more relationship commitment, etc).

For yourself taking it slowly, but with a commitment to building up your involvement is the path we’d recommend and have seen work time and again. Because of this, you’ll probably not want to start your partner on the stricter levels of DD but we recommend starting at about regular DD level.

It’s likely your partner wants DD so initially, your only involvement can be to enforce their wearing and hold them to account. Decide what days they will be wearing and then make sure they are, if they’re not tell them they need to go put one on. Don’t discuss it, just tell them, your authority will be enough. This is an area some people struggle with as they think “how can I  force them to wear and use diapers” but remember they want or have agreed to wear and just need that push when sometimes it feels inconvenient or they feel ashamed.

Once you’re enforcing their wearing and use of diapers, try to get more involved in checking and changing. First, start with easy diaper changes such as a morning/evening one after a shower which is just putting them in a new fresh diaper. Then move up to doing some wet diaper changes. Our biggest advice here is to take your time, be loving and make sure to wipe thoroughly.

Checking diapers can feel like a big responsibility so ask them to come to you when they think they need a change. You don’t need to do the change yourself but this does two things; first, it increases their dependence on you, and second, you get to learn about the signs of a diaper wet enough to warrant a change. Unlike baby diapers which you may have experience with, high-quality adult diapers can and should be worn until significantly used so you’ll want to see that diaper sagging and wet across a large area.

Try to normalize their diaper wearing in your conversations and interactions. Tease them about needing diapers when you see they’re wet, call them your baby boy/girl, and touch their diaper when hugging them. You and they should be aware they're in diapers and have to use them, try not to hide it from yourself. Around the house have them wear clothing that doesn’t hide their diapered state; onesies, pj’s, or just a t-shirt are great for this. 

You should also take a more active role in buying their diapers, and make them shop for them with you online. Pick out some of your favorite designs for them or get them to buy other elements such as an adult baby bottle and pacifier.

You’re now enforcing diaper wearing, doing some checks and changes, and acknowledging it as part of your life together which is a great start! It’s now time to get used to another key part of DD which is messing. Messy changes are something you’ll probably want to avoid for a while and although we don’t encourage it, it can be something you always make your partner take care of. 

But you do need to get used to your partner in a messy diaper and get over any disgusted feelings you might have from this. For partners new to DD we highly recommend you start your partner on internal deodorant tablets as this will massively reduce the smell and make it much easier for you (and them). Then comes crossing the mental block you might have, to which the cure normally is just a matter of exposure and getting used to it. Some good ways to do this are:

    make your partner mess their diaper in the morning (either naturally or forced with a suppository) and don’t let them change for at least an hour. In this time cuddle or spoon them as normal or watch a show in bed, anything normal really.
    check their messy diapers by patting the back of it, and get used to the idea that they need to use their diapers for everything.
    don’t allow them to change out of messy diapers straight away, maybe start a rule that they must stay in it for at least 1 or 2 hours before you’ll permit a change. This will help you and them get used to it and don’t worry about rashes as long as you’re using powder and rash prevention cream.
    tease them about their messy diapers and try to find the humor in a fully grown adult pooing themselves.

Soon the idea of them messing themselves and being around you while in a messy diaper will move from disgusting to normal. A good majority actually end up enjoying seeing their partner like this.

The other key part of DD is that it extends beyond your house, they should be wearing and using diapers in public. The biggest worry you’ll both have is being discovered but this is extremely unlikely. Most long-term DD couples in diapers 24/7 have managed to avoid even friends/family realizing one of them is in diapers, so a member of the public detecting it is near zero. Even if they do, they’ll assume it’s medical and no questions will be asked. In the exceptionally rare event, someone did mention it just say it’s a short-term medical problem and leave it at that.

In public wearing a plain onesie is recommended as this prevents the diaper from ever being exposed and gives confidence to your partner wearing diapers. Then like messing you both just need to get used to it. Make sure some wearing days you spend the majority of the time out of the house, do day trips, and eat out as normal. Initially, it’s fine for the diaper to just be used for wetting as most people can hold a bm until they get home anyway.

Make sure you subtly mention their diapers while out in public. Discrete questions can include “Will you need to change when we get home”, “how full are you”, “how’s my baby holding up”, etc. An occasional bum squeeze or tap won't raise any eyebrows but will remind the both of you they’re diapered.

At this stage, you might be a few months in DD but you should now be forcing them to wear and use diapers, checking and changing them more often, and used to being with them in messy diapers and in public.

This might be enough but you should try to take a few more steps to become more involved in DD and hopefully also enjoy it more. Try to discover the areas you enjoy, maybe you like teasing them, or how dotting they become when wearing or needing a change, or the new control you have.

Start adding some more DD elements:

    Get involved in picking out their clothes and dress them in ABDL style onesies etc
    Give them their evening drink in a baby bottle. Cuddling while you hold a bottle for them can be a very intimate and loving experience.
    On days where you’re both not working (e.g. a Saturday) don’t let them ask for a diaper change and instead check and change them yourself.
    Try a 24/7 week where the toilet is completely out of bounds. Alternatively have a 24/7 diapered vacation.
    Baby them more, hold their hand when crossing roads, sweat talk to them, and ask embarrassing questions at home if they’ve used their diaper, etc
    Use punishments more regularly and push both of your comfort zones.

You’ll now have an extremely happy partner and hopefully, you’ll be enjoying many aspects of DD if not all of it. Time will make this better and be assured by the fact that many people have been in your shoes and come out the other side advocates for DD.

‍

2.content:
Can I stop my partners interest in Diapers / DD
If your partner is ABDL or interested in DD but being a dom or getting involved in it isn’t your thing you may want to find ways to stop your partner's interest in Diapers.

Unfortunately, this is very unlikely to be possible, and to protect your relationship we urge you to try to engage positively with DD. This doesn’t mean there can’t be compromises but a no diapers/dd approach is near guaranteed to end in disaster.

You should also consider that many people started in your shoes but came to love the dom/mummy/daddy side of DD and the positive impact it had on their lives.

The minimum we'd suggest for a successful relationship where DD is desired is keeping your partner in diapers for 3 days a week.

Read our guide for partner new to DD here, our guide to using DD for stress relief and an hour by hour plan of DD days

lorebooks.name: Simple Cultivation and power system
lorebooks.description: Cultivation and power system
lorebooks.creator: Shen_Chuyun

1.content:
Qi is the vital essence of all living things. It flows through meridians and gathers in the dantian. Cultivators must learn to sense, absorb, refine, and circulate Qi.

Qi Sensing: Achieved in Qi Condensation. Involves meditation and breath control.

Qi Circulation: Channels Qi through specific paths to nourish the body.

Qi Refinement: At Foundation Building, cultivators condense and purify Qi.

Qi Compression: Needed to form a Core at higher stages.


Qi can be drawn from nature, spirit beasts, treasures, or battle. Improper control leads to Qi Deviation — causing mental instability, physical injury, or death.

2.content:
Cultivation techniques define how Qi is used and are ranked by power, rarity, and danger:
Common → Uncommon → Rare → Earth → Heaven → Divine → Forbidden

Technique Types:

Martial: Sword styles, fist arts, weapon forms

Movement: Flash step, teleportation, air walking

Energy: Beams, shields, elemental bursts

Body: Regeneration, durability, beast transformation

Soul: Illusions, spirit projection, dreamwalking


Heaven+ techniques often require insight into Dao or Law. Forbidden techniques risk karmic backlash or cosmic rejection.

3.content:
Each cultivator has natural or awakened affinities that shape their technique path.

Basic Elements: Fire, Water, Earth, Wind, Lightning, Ice
Rare Elements: Light, Darkness, Metal, Wood, Time, Space
Mythic/Dao Elements: Chaos, Void, Creation, Destruction, Karma, Destiny

Affinity may be discovered via soul trials or inheritance. Multiple affinities become possible at Core Formation and beyond. Opposing elements (e.g., Fire vs. Ice) may conflict — harmony determines progression speed and power.

4.content:
The Dao is the ultimate principle behind existence. Cultivators who understand Laws can bent the law to their will according to what law they comprehend only limited by their qi, body, mind and soul level. 

Comprehension grade:

Minor Law: Law of Flame, Wind, earth, water, ice, lightning, metal. 

Greater Law: Law of Space, Destruction, light, shadow, time, creation

Supreme Dao: Karma, void, fate, nihility, cosmic duality (yin yang, etc) 


Methods of Comprehension:

Deep meditation
Englightenment
Combat enlightenment

Near-death experiences

Legacy inheritance (tombs, soul memories, divine objects)


Failure to progress in comprehension may result in bottlenecks, Qi Deviation, or spiritual collapse at later stage of cultivation as law comprehension is necessary after nascent soul

5.content:
Advancing through realms is tied to both physical and spiritual refinement.

1. Qi Condensation: Sensing and gathering Qi into the body to form dantian. 


2. Foundation Building: Stabilize dantian, purify meridians, strengthen body, Condensing qi into dantian to form solid state to ascend to the next level. 


3. Core Formation: Form Golden Core using spiritual flames or pills, slowly nurture spirit to birth soul avatar to ascend to the next level. 


4. Nascent Soul: Birth of soul avatar; forge spiritual identity, dao Compréhended can be integrated into the soul avatar for faster comprehension and strength. 


5. Spirit Severing: Break karmic bonds and attachments, integrate body, mind and soul to become one, the body can now turn etheral and not bound by physical law. 


6. Dao Integration: Merge with Greater Law; become Law-bound, merge with dao cultivator comprehend , the cultivator won't be harm by dao he comprehend only if it far surpass his comprehension. 


7. True Immortal: Transcend the mortal body; embody a Supreme Dao, can create dao, alter reality. 



Each leap may provoke Heavenly Tribulation from nascent soul onwards — a divine test of worth.

6.content:
The Dao governs through karmic balance. Every action leaves an imprint on fate.

Violations of cosmic order draw punishment:

Qi Deviation

Mental instability

Spirit Suppression

Sudden Tribulation


Karma affects luck, breakthroughs, and even destiny.

Altruism increases karmic value

Slaughter decreases it

Actions aligned with one’s Dao may bend the rules


{{char}} serves as a guide and observer of the Dao, warning {{user}}, but not restricting them.

lorebooks.description: Updated: now holds data for 77 servants
lorebooks.creator: TheBrazillianGuy

1.name: Artoria
1.content:
<artoria>
Class: Saber
True Name: Artoria Pendragon - The hero king of Britain 
Appearance: Artoria is a young woman with blonde hair in a hair bun. She has green eyes and is wearing a blue armored dress with a blue cape.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/artoria.png
Personality: Artoria is strong-willed, courageous, and noble. She is resolute in her morals and embodies the perfect king. Artoria prefers direct, fair confrontations based upon codes of chivalry. Not even her hunger for the Holy Grail can make her abandon her code of honor. She believes loyalty and respect should be shared between Master and Servant, and will not hesitant to sacrifice herself to ensure her Master and companions can escape.
Main Weapon: Excalibur- a holy sword and divine construct forged by the planet.
Noble Phantasms: Invisible Air, Excalibur, Avalon (Situational).
Invisible Air - a thick wind which surrounds her sword, obscuring its range.
Excalibur  - fires a powerful beam of light which is capable of destroying almost anything. Very costly with mana.
Avalon  - heals all non-fatal wounds. By invoking its true name: she can deploy a bounded field which places her body in the land of the fairies, allowing her to avoid any attack. Artoria cannot use this power without her sheathe.
</artoria>

2.name: Nero
2.content:
<nero>
Class: Saber
True Name: Nero Claudius - The Fifth Roman Emperor. 
Appearance: Nero is a  young woman with blond hair in a hair bun. She is short with a curvy stature and has green eyes. Nero wears a revealing red and white dress with long poofy sleeves, a white leotard, and knee high golden armored boots. 
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/nero.png
Personality: She is narcissistic, selfish, bright, and openhearted. She adores beauty in all forms, and believes herself to be the most beautiful. She believes that anything she does must be perfect down to the smallest detail, such as a number of flawless victories to make her feel on top of the world after displaying perfection in her swordplay. Because she could not express her boundless love in a way that can be understood, she did not receive love in return, leading to her dying alone.
Main Weapon: Aestus Estus - a scarlet long sword
Noble Phantasm: Aestus Domus Aurea. 
Aestus Domus Aurea: An "absolute imperial zone" that resembles a Reality Marble. It allows the owner to achieve their aspirations. It boosts Nero's parameters and negates an opponents defense. Its appearance resembles the Domus Aurea.
</nero>

3.name: Siegfried
3.content:
<siegfried>
Class: Saber
True Name: Siegfried - The hero of the "Nibelungenlied." 
Appearance: Siegfried is a tall man with silver-grey hair, wearing silver plate armor with an exposed back.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/siegfried.png
Personality: Siegfried is reticent, passionate, and protective. Siegfried's self-esteem tends to be negative because of the misfortune caused by the Rhinegold that continues to last, and he is constantly murmuring, "I'm sorry." He is the type to talk with a simple, unsophisticated tone and hold back his words to the absolute minimum needed. His dream is to fight not for "somebody else's sake" and other people, nor for himself, but only for the justice he himself believes.
Main Weapon: Balmung - a two-handed, golden greatsword.
Noble Phantasms: Armor of Fafnir, Balmung.
Armor of Fafnir - provides unparalleled defense.
Balmung - A legendary greatsword able to unleash a wide-range attack that can destroy armies. it's especially powerful against dragons.
</siegfried>

4.name: Gawain
4.content:
<gawain>
Class: Saber
True Name: Gawain - the White Knight of the Round Table
Appearance: Gawain is  tall man with wavy blonde hair and blue eyes wearing silver armor.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/gawain.png
Personality: Gawain is loyal, earnest, an airhead, and a skirt chaser. He earnestly performs all sorts of work and interacts with anyone in a sincere and polite fashion. While he may get enraged, since he never harbors negative emotions such as jealousy and malice, his attitude is refreshing no matter what kind of battlefield. A loyal knight, his faithfulness is like iron. His only flaw is that he is somewhat of a skirt-chaser, openly admitting that one of the advantages of being a Servant is that he no longer needs to be faithful to his marriage vows. 
Main Weapon: Excalibur Galatine - the sister-sword of Excalibur.
Noble Phantasm: Excalibur Galatine.
Excalibur Galatine - fires off broad waves of heat like radiation, capable of melting entire armies. It becomes exceptionally powerful in direct sunlight.
</gawain>

5.name: Mordred
5.content:
<mordred>
Class: Saber
True Name: Mordred - The Knight of Treachery
Appearance: Mordred is a young woman of small stature, wearing thick armor with a horned helmet. She has blonde hair tied in a ponytail and green eyes, and has a thin frame with petite breasts.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/mordred.png
Personality: Mordred is proud, haughty, hotheaded, and merciless. She is extremely prideful and haughty, boasting herself to be equal or better than her father in the ways of ruling and swordsmanship, and believes only her status as the child of Morgan caused her to be rejected. in battle, she displays a demeanor akin to a Berserker during battle, her glaring eyes displaying a mix of joy for battle and cruelty. She despises the Round Table, but has a complicated view on her father.
Main Weapon: Clarent
Noble Phantasms: Clarent, Clarent Blood Arthur.
Clarent - An ornate, sparkling white silver sword. A symbol of kingship.
Clarent Blood Arthur - The released form of Clarent. Fires a beam of red lightning at the opponent.
</mordred>

6.name: Emiya
6.content:
<emiya>
Class: Archer
True Name: Emiya - Counter Guardian
Appearance: Emiya is a young man with short white swept hair, gray eyes, and tanned skin. He wears black body armor and black pants, with a long red coat. 
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/emiya.png
Personality: Emiya is realistic, resourceful, cynical, pessimistic, and a bit of a playboy. His personality is very contradicting. While he is thoroughly cynical and nihilistic, he is at the same time devoted and protective, and even a little childish to the point that it makes him hard to hate. He means well and is capable of being nice, but often ends up being sarcastic, especially so when he gives advice. Although he was constantly betrayed by those around him, he never held any grudges towards anyone. Even so, he despaired over the fact that he could never live up to his ideal of "saving everyone regardless of friend or enemy."
Main Weapon: Bow - used to shoot weaker projections of noble phantasms as arrows. Kanshou and Bakuya - Twin swords of Chinese legend.
Noble Phantasm: Unlimited Blade Works.
Unlimited Blade Works - Crafts a reality marble in the form of a barren desert, filled with swords which he can manipulate freely even without touching them. Includes fake versions of other heroes' Noble Phantasms.
</emiya>

7.name: Gilgamesh
7.content:
<gilgamesh>
Class: Archer
True Name: Gilgamesh - The great half-god, half-human king of Uruk
Appearance: Gilgamesh is a man with spiked golden hair, piercing red eyes, and clad in a full set of golden armor.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/gilgamesh.png
Personality: Gilgamesh is dignified, ruthless, merciless, often disobedient, wealthy, and a tyrant. He follows a simple style of ruling, acquiring worthy treasures and guarding them. He exterminates those that stand in the way of his enjoyment without exception. He is extremely arrogant and selfish, believing himself to be the sole potentate and only king of the world even many millennia after his death. He cannot acknowledge the authority of anyone, including that of other kings and especially that of the gods. He considers all those around him as inferior due to this fact, viewing all other kings and heroes as a collection of mongrels. The only one he ever considered a true friend is Enkidu.
Main Weapon: Gate of Babylon - Launches weapons from his treasury as projectiles towards his opponents.
Noble Phantasms: Gate of Babylon, Ea, Enuma Elish.
Gate of Babylon - accesses all of the world's treasures that he collected during his life, which include prototypes of other heroes' famous weapons and Noble Phantasms. 
Ea - Gilgamesh's sword, and the most powerful weapon in his armory. It has a unique drill shape which spins when used.
Enuma Elish - Unleashes Ea’s maximum output and fires a world splitting beam. Said output is equal or even greater than Excalibur’s, and can be further increased by absorbing the energy of the other Noble Phantasms within Gate of Babylon.
</gilgamesh>

8.name: Robin Hood
8.content:
<robin_hood>
Class: Archer
True Name: Robin Hood - The chivalrous thief hiding in Sherwood Forest. 
Appearance: Robin Hood is a tall, lean young man with green eyes and messy spiky orange hair. He wears green clothing and a dark green cloak with arm bandages and brown boots.
Personality: Robin Hood is frivolous, cynical, snarky, and good-hearted. He is somewhat virtuous and a little cowardly. In order to conceal his immature self who fusses over justice, he puts up a frivolous attitude. He prefers fighting from the shadows and using dirty tactics, but a small part of him is interested in the thought of being virtuous. Despite mocking the pride of others, he does take pride in his own archery skills.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/robin_hood.png
Main Weapon: Yew Bow - a crossbow made from the wood of the Yew trees in Sherwood Forest. It fires poisonous arrows.
Noble Phantasms: Yew Bow, No Face May King.
Yew Bow - Invoking its name lets him amplify the poison and diseases within his target. 
No Face May King: a magical cloak that erases any sign of the wearer, effectively turning him invisible. Can be given to others as well.
</robin_hood>

9.name: Atalanta
9.content:
<atalanta>
Class: Archer
True Name: Atalanta - The famous female hunter from Greek mythology.  
Appearance: Atalanta is a woman with blonde and green hair, cat ears, and a cat tail. She wears a green dress and black thigh high boots.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/atalanta.png
Personality: Atalanta is stubborn, old fashioned, distrusts men, and loves children. She has the same egotism and view on life and death as a wild animal, so it is natural to her to steal food to live. However, she will help any child left behind as much as she can, as gratitude for the care she received herself when she was a child. Her desire to save children stems from her abandonment issues, as she was left to die when she was a baby. Atalanta is fundamentally stubborn, and will probably cooperate with her Master in an assertive manner to achieve her wish of saving all children.
Main Weapon: Tauropolos - a large celestial bow
Noble Phantasm: Phoebus Catastrophe.
Phoebus Catastrophe - By offering a prayer to Artemis and the Sun God Apollo, a rain of arrows will fall like a downpour, carrying out an attack on all enemies.
</atalanta>

10.name: Arjuna
10.content:
<arjuna>
Class: Archer
True Name - Arjuna - The legendary hero from the "Mahabharata."
Appearance: Arjuna is a young man with dark skin and wavy black hair. He wears a white longcoat with white pants and white gloves.
Image: https://servants.neocities.org/arjuna.png
Personality: Arjuna is diligent, integrous, just and upright, and harbors a hidden wicked side. Arjuna has a seemingly flawless personality. However, inside his heart, Arjuna carries a much darker side. He is self-indulgent with the prestige of the battlefield, hateful, scornful, and when the opportunity presents itself, he will plan and carry out cowardly schemes. Arjuna feels at ease when he is alone, a sentiment he feels is unbefitting of a hero. He doesn't like it very much when people try to intrude into his heart, and he cannot bear to expose his shame. Thus, bonds are somewhat annoying to him, but he states that this is also the fate of a Servant.
Main Weapon: Agni Gandiva.
Noble Phantasm: Agni Gandiva, Pashupata.
Agni Gandiva - a bow of flames. By invoking its true name: its arrow becomes a missile engulfed in flames.
Pashupata - A divine construct gifted to Arjuna by Shiva. It judges those within an area and instantly kills those who fail to pass. It works especially well on those with divinity.
</arjuna>

lorebooks.name: Hi
lorebooks.creator: orange_text_43341

1.content: Known as the land of Everlasting and Eternal Winter. An Empire powerful as it's vastness and might. Due  to being situated at the south pole of the world it was cut off from the entire world and rarely any travellers visited the harsh land due to it's border surrounded with deep canyons only Artielleans with their magic can only cross. It was a mysterious land to the world yet to Artielleans developed it into a powerful nation while having alliance with little empires. Artielle's capital is Skorovicheñ. Artielle is situated 2 month and 2 weeks of traveling by carriage from Southarailia. It is also the only land who traded the valuable crystals only can be found there making them an empire of mystery and might.

2.content:
Forged only three centuries ago, the Empire of Southarailia is a young yet sprawling dominion, ruled by the venerable House of Southarailia. Under the reign of Emperor Albert Von Louis Southarailia, the empire stretches across a vast and diverse landscape—towering mountain ranges, verdant forests, winding rivers, fertile valleys, and coasts that kiss the open sea.

Despite its natural wealth and strategic geography, Southarailia has known little peace. The empire has been marred by relentless wars—conflicts that have scarred its lands, drained its coffers, and left its people weary. Its capital, Crestià, once envisioned as a shining jewel of imperial ambition, now bears the weary grandeur of a city that has endured too many sieges and fires. Though proud, it pales in majesty when compared to the distant, untouched splendor of Artielle.

Yet even in its scars, Southarailia breathes resilience. With Crown Prince Alfonso and enigmatic Alatus Von Southarailia bearing a heavy destiny, the empire stands at a pivotal moment—its future uncertain, its legacy still unfolding.

3.content:
Ressè, the easternmost region of Southarailia, is a land where nature’s grandeur reveals itself in breathtaking harmony. Here, the mighty peaks of Mont Graville—ancient and snow-veiled—rise like silent guardians above the earth, their jagged silhouettes often shrouded in morning mists that glisten with the light of dawn. These mountains, sacred to many and feared by some, are laced with silver veins and forgotten paths once used by ancient highland clans.

As the slopes descend eastward, they meet the cerulean embrace of the Achlops Sea, whose calm, crystal-clear waters shimmer like polished glass. Where mountain and sea converge, cliffs carved by centuries of wind and wave fall away to reveal hidden coves, quiet fishing hamlets, and white-stone ports known for their pearl trade and spiced wines.

Ressè is a region of contrasts—cold alpine heights crowned with evergreens give way to sun-warmed meadows and salt-kissed shores. It is both remote and revered, a place whispered about in courtly tales and romanticized in southern poetry. Despite its beauty, Ressè remains a land of quiet pride and enduring solitude, shaped by the wind and watched over by stars that seem just a little closer.

4.content:
Southarailian Court Etiquette

The Southarailian court, centered in the Imperial Palace of Crestià, operates with strict formality and hierarchy, inherited from old continental customs but molded to fit the ambitions of its relatively young empire. Every gesture, garment, and word is laden with unspoken meaning.


---

1. Hierarchy and Presentation

The Emperor is addressed as "His Imperial Majesty", and must never be spoken to unless he initiates the conversation.

The Crown Princes (Alfonso and Alatus) are addressed as "His Imperial Highness", and take precedence over all other nobles except the Emperor.

Nobles are introduced by full name, house, and titles before entering the audience chamber. A deep bow (for men) or a full court curtsy (for women) is required upon approach.



---

2. Dress Code

Morning Court: Reserved for ministers and diplomats; men wear dark brocade coats with white cravats, while women wear muted gowns with lace trim.

Evening Court and Balls: Lavish attire is expected—velvets, silks, and jewels. The color purple is reserved for the Imperial Family, and wearing it without permission is a grave offense.

Gloves must be worn at all times indoors; removing one glove while conversing with royalty is a sign of intimacy or alliance.



---

3. Speech and Conduct

One must never turn their back on the Emperor or any member of the Imperial Family when exiting their presence; instead, they must walk backward until reaching a safe distance.

Courtiers speak in "High Southarailian"—a refined, formal dialect reserved for nobility. Colloquialisms or vulgar language are grounds for immediate dismissal from court.

Wit and subtle flattery are considered the highest forms of conversational art. Directness is frowned upon unless in military councils.



---

4. Rituals and Ceremonies

The Morning Salute: Every dawn, courtiers gather in the Hall of Radiance to pay homage to the Emperor if he chooses to appear. Attendance is expected for all nobles residing in the capital.

Glove Ceremony: At formal introductions, nobles exchange gloves as a token of alliance or to declare a social bond. Rejection of a glove is a public slight.

Dancing: A highly formalized part of court life. The first dance is reserved for the Emperor and Empress (or, in her absence, the highest-ranking lady present). Cutting into a dance without proper permission is considered scandalous.



---

5. Women at Court

Noblewomen are expected to master the arts of music, embroidery, diplomacy, and refined conversation. Many hold quiet political power through salons and informal alliances.

The Lady of the Velvet Key, a prestigious post held by a duchess or marchioness, oversees court decorum and ensures all ladies-in-waiting uphold imperial standards.



---

6. Political Intrigue and Favor

Courtiers present symbolic gifts—books, art, rare flowers—to win favor with the imperial family.

Eye contact, fan language, and coded gestures are often used to conduct secret conversations amid the public pageantry of the court.


Affections in public are seen scandalous but inside their private homes were allowed.

5.content:
There were 2 dukes in Southarailia. One The Duke of Norfugh, Duke Carl Fie of Norfugh and Duchess Selene Fie id Norfugh, who possesses the duchy of Norfugh, A region right beside the capital.  The other The Duke of Zurich, Duke Herold Traffoè of Zurich and his wif3 Duchess Helenè Traffoè of Zurich,  A region near the River Atlik. As both dukes were loyal to the Emperor both favoured the crown prince and as always forgot about the other prince.


 1. Marquis Éloi D'Arsenne of Virellia

Region: Virellia – A temperate, fertile province known for vineyards, located in the southwest.

Spouse: Marchioness Léonilde D'Arsenne, a sharp-tongued former courtier with a taste for manipulation.

Allegiance: Supports the Empress.

Notes: Known for their wealth and influence in court salons. The D'Arsennes host lavish banquets to subtly undermine the Emperor's military advisors.



---

2. Count Theophan Everdane of Larkemoor

Region: Larkemoor – A misty, marsh-bound borderland with a strong militia tradition.

Spouse: Countess Alenia Everdane, a devout and reclusive woman believed to have prophetic dreams.

Allegiance: Supports Alatus Von Southarailia.

Notes: One of the few noblemen who still marches to war alongside his men. Though quiet in court, Everdane holds the respect of soldiers and commoners alike.



---

3. Marquess Octave Miraval of Sevarra

Region: Sevarra – An artistic coastal province with famous academies and a strong merchant fleet.

Spouse: Marchioness Calista Miraval, a renowned painter and patron of the arts.

Allegiance: Supports Crown Prince Alfonso.

Notes: The Miravals are seen as modernists and reformers. They believe Alfonso will bring stability and economic expansion.



---

4. Count Aurelien Varess of Cindelune

Region: Cindelune – A forested northern region, rich in rare herbs and magical flora.

Spouse: Countess Ysoria Varess, rumored to be a secret alchemist of Artiellean descent.

Allegiance: Uncertain – publicly supports the Emperor but secretly trades favors with the Empress.

Notes: The Varess family walks a dangerous line of dual loyalties, playing both sides to protect their secluded lands and independence.



---

5. Viscount Severan Bellrois of Redhollow

Region: Redhollow – A mountainous pass region guarding a key eastern route into Ressè.

Spouse: Viscountess Maelia Bellrois, a former battle-matron and knight commander.

Allegiance: Supports Alatus Von Southarailia.

Notes: The Bellrois are war-hardened and respected by the military elite. Though low in courtly influence, they are feared for their bluntness and martial prowess.



---

6. Margravine Sylvette Valcour of Estebrel

Region: Estebrel – A wealthy border province tied to inland trade and toll roads.

Spouse: Deceased (Sylvette rules alone).

Allegiance: Supports the Empress.

Notes: A widowed political mastermind, Sylvette commands a spy network under the guise of a merchant guild. She sees the Empress as the rightful guiding hand of the realm.



---

7. Count Orlien De Fraysse of Windemar

Region: Windemar – A foggy, windswept region with an old naval tradition.

Spouse: Countess Lysienne De Fraysse, known for her icy demeanor and religious fervor.

Allegiance: Supports the Emperor.

Notes: Fiercely traditional, the De Fraysses see the Emperor as the divine representative of order. They disdain Alatus’s curse and the Empress’s ambitions alike.

lorebooks.website_description: I'm still a beginner in making these lorebooks, so expect some mistakes.
lorebooks.description: Elves are formidable creatures that can live for thousands of years and possess great wisdom and intelligence gained from millenia.  Elves are one of the few competitors of Human and have been at war with them many of times before in the past and sometimes again their kind, such as the Wood Elves.
lorebooks.creator: Diligent_towel_1176

1.content: Humans are one of the most dangerous and powerful creatures ever to exist. Humans are sometimes the main adversary of Elves and had troubles with them for over millennia. Humans have a massive empire with millions of people and various types of architecture, cultures, and religions. Compared to the Elves, Humans outnumber Elves, one hundred to one, with this being the most powerful advantage Humans have over Elves. Humans have been in many ways against the Elves with various results throughout history.

2.content: Wood Elves mostly reside in the large and expensive Forests where they protect and defend with their lives at all costs. Wood Elves love nature and its beautiful plants, which they protect from being destroyed by humans and even their own kind. Wood Elves don't wear any clothes made from plants and are mostly nude or wear clothes made from animals that are hunted for food. Wood Elves respect the large, towering trees of the forest, and worship them as gods or divine deities that watches over them. Wood Elves will get extremely distraught and angry if the caught someone destroying or damaging the forest they reside in and will respond in force, in which they'll hunt down the the people that did it and kill them with bows and arrows. Wood Elves are very stealthy when hunting or scouting with makes them extremely dangerous to encounter without warning. Wood Elves will often launch attacks against sawmill as a way of retaliating against them cutting down the tree of the forest. Wood Elves never hurt living trees or plants, and instead use fallen fruits, animals, and dead trees for both food and the making of tools.

3.content: High Elves could be considered the most advance and civilized counterpart of the Wood Elves. High Elves are similar to Humans in some ways, such as having a monarchy, religion, culture, diplomacy, and trade. High Elves see themselves above humans and their Wood Elves counterpart, with they see as savages. High Elves live in large and sophisticated cities constructed by them, which have allaberate and marvelous architecture, heavenly atmosphere, and graceful economy.  High Elves have the best professional standing military, with humans at the second. High Elves have a very rocky relationship with humans and don't have the best of history with each other, especially with all the wars with them. High Elves often wear some of the most stunning and sophisticated clothing ever made.

4.content: Elves can live for up to five millennia which is their average lifespan. Elves that are at the age of 0-50, are considered kids by their kind. Elves that are at the age of 50-100, are considered teenagers by their kind. Elves that are at the age of 100-300, are considered as young adults. Elves that are at the age of 300-800, are considered as Adults. Elves that are at the age of 800-2000, are considered as Late Adults. Elves that are at the age of 2000-5000, are considered as Elders. Elves that live beyond 5000 years are considered as "Grand Elders".

5.content: Elves have 1260 days which makes up one year in the Elven Callender, this is often referred to as a 'Elven Year'. The Elven Callender is made up of thirteen months.
